One is spoilt for choice for activities, shopping and foods, More so, the service provided by staff were most satisfied including Amuse Restaurant‚Äôs breakfast venue. They were friendly, helpful and served with passion and smiles. They were Rooms : May Kwan Sales : Francis and Maggie Front Office : Michelle, Sky, Yadu, Irah, Siti, Oonah, Jason, Jermaine Amuse restaurant Jackie I am sure I will be back again.

title: Below Average 4 star
desc: The hotel should have everything going for it. Nice location, good size, fairly expensive, but I was left a bit disappointed. Facilities I can‚Äôt really comment on as I didn‚Äôt use them, the bar/restaurant looked fairly small. Staff were friendly and there was a lovely Belgium Microbrewery bar opposite which was a pleasant surprise. The room itself was very small and felt dated and cramped. I especially didn‚Äôt enjoy seeing the staining on the cream carpet, which gave the room an overall feel h of being dirty. Double bed was two twins pushed together which annoyed me at first but I got used to it. I‚Äôm Sure there‚Äôs better out there for the price

title: Well located, comfortable and lovely staff
desc: The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. I felt very comfortable in the room, and the AC was put at a reasonable level in the lobby. Then, I think the location was key to the success of my stay: steps from chinatown, and walking distance from gardens by the bay or clarke quay, if you like to walk a little bit (if not, then very close by metro). The Outram Metro station is literally under the hotel (you take the elevator down and get there), direct to the East-West Line. I had a great experience at Dorset Singapore, 5 stars deserved from my point of view.

title: Few nights in November '19 - Liked
desc: Overall, good. Will return. Booked in girlfriend's name. Room standard and ok. Could improve on bathroom area cleanliness (house keeping supervisor - please note). Slept fine. In room TV and electrics all fine. Location good - next to subway and 15-20 min walk from Marina Bay (3 or 4 stops on MRT). Staff professional and polite - as would expect in Sing. Night time staff could improve attentiveness/dress a bit. Restaurant on ground floor - on small side and average looking, but food was very good, and staff inside friendly (even in the face of one rather rude guest). Breakfast not in our package and was good/fair value. Evening opening hours for restaurant dinner could be better/longer. Overall, satisfied and we will now use Dorsett as our Sing. preferred hotel,

title: Lovely clean and friendly central hotel
desc: Overall lovely stay - staff were very friendly and helpful. The bathroom door was frosted glass which wasn‚Äôt quite private enough for our liking but not a huge issue. Shower was great pressure and temperature, beds were comfy, room was very clean. Pool was lovely and clean too. We had an issue with the air con but it was fixed immediately despite being very late at night. Central location, a lot of construction in the area but close to Chinatown and easy to get everywhere by bus, MRT or taxi. Would stay again!

title: Lovely Hotel
desc: I love to stay in Dorset whenever I go to SG for business trip. The location is strategic and walking distance to China Town. The front office staff are courteous and prompt. My experience of check-in is good. The room is clean and modern. I enjoy my stay in Dorsett.

title: Great location
desc: Very good location just walking distance from Outram Mrt and Chinatown. The hotel is very cozy and staff are very warm and helpful. Special mention to Yadi and the reception staff who are always welcoming.

title: Excellent Stay
desc: Dorsett hotel has friendly staff and people especially Michelle, May, and the rest of the reception staff. The rooms are all inclusive and clean. The food in the restaurant is tasty and even cheap. Very accessible to roads and transport. We wish to be back again!

title: Great Stay
desc: This was my first visit to Singapore and I chose the Dorsett Hotel based on its location and positive reviews. I was checked in by Jason at the front desk. His service was excellent. He up graded my room and provided useful information about the surrounding area (MRT location, etc.). My room was very nice. A minor issue was a lack of conveniently placed electrical outlets. The breakfast buffet was good, offering a fine variety. The hostess, Jackie, was so very friendly and helpful. If I return to Singapore, I would not hesitate to stay at the Dorsett. It has a great, convenient location, nice rooms and outstanding service.

title: Drab, dirty and downtrodden. Good location.
desc: A drab , dirty hotel that is clearly not worth US$250 per night. The rooms look dilapidated and worn out, there is trash everywhere along the hallway, with the garbage masking somewhat the smell of the carpets. Stay here only if you want to be in this area, location is close to the CBD and Chinatown areas.

title: Great hotel for a business trip
desc: Spent five nights here on a recent business trip. Room was small but clean and well-appointed. Staff service throughout the hotel was excellent. Included breakfast was tasty and catered to both Asian and Western tastes. A few small quibbles: room design is poor in several ways. No outlet for the hair dryer in the bathroom so have to sit on the bed and use a mirror kind of far away. Shower door skims the floor so tightly that it bunches up the bathmat and you have to step out onto a bare floor, which could be slippery and dangerous. Also, every day at least one of my towels was threadbare or had a hole in it. That being said, I would definitely return to the Dorsett due to location adn friendly staff.

title: OK but location isn't great
desc: Hotel is located near China Town which is nice, however everything else is far:city center, Orchard street and little India. The pool and rooms are OK, but they are overlooking a construction site and a police station... Internet speed is a joke 4 mbps, as if it is year 2000.

title: Spacious room
desc: We were pleasantly surprised by the spacious and clean the room is given that they been ard a few years and how complete their amenities are, comb, bathtub etc. The area is interesting with a lot of variety of foods. Look forward to my stay again :)

title: Amazing Staycation!
desc: The hotel staff were thoughtful enough to upgrade my room and prepare a cake for my hubby‚Äôs birthday. Staff were friendly and we loved the room, service and pool! : ) Would come back here for a staycay again!

title: Never Disappoints
desc: Staying 2nd time here. Dorsett never let down our expectations. Though the usual check in time is 2pm if you're lucky you may get early check in, like me. Thanks to the crew for giving room at 9am itself. Total relief. Couldn't get this in the previous visit though. Rooms are decent enough for staying with all the regular amenities provided like toilitries, pool and gym. I would say the breakfast is average rather good. May be because of less vegetarian/indian options for me. Singapore is not aplve where we stay inside the rooms and all we need is a comfortable sound sleep at the end of exhaustive walk or trips/visits of city. Water refill is not unlimited rather you need to buy after 2nd replacement. God, SG is humid and you'll drench like anything. Ani the good thing is the

title: Highly Satisfactory
desc: If the area is where you want to stay, this is the hotel. It is in the Chinatown area, right on top of a subway station, where I enjoyed the night life of Chinatown and the convenient of access practically everywhere by MRT. I stayed only one night this trip to embark a cruise at Harbor Front and the location is just right. Very well-managed chain (from Hong Kong) and the room allocated to me is spacious and has excellent city view. It has all facilities including a mobile phone for local use. Service is very good. My previous stays in Singapore have been in 5-stars at Orchid Rd or Marina Bay but this change is a revelation, as Chinatown may be an even more interesting areas to explore (a 5-min walk).One of the best among 4-stars, and good value makes it nearly 5-star.

title: Disappointing!!!
desc: Spent nearly HKD2000 a night for three nights in total. The room is always wet and humid. The beds feel dirty. The waiter left us two small toothpastes for three days. No tea bags were provided for the 2nd and 3rd days. The refrigrator was locked, not allowed to use. The hallway is full of camera shape decroration, making people feel always being watched. All in all, uncomfortable, disappointing, not worth the momey.

title: Mouldy ceiling, small room, good location
desc: The Dorsett Singapore fell well short of my expectations. Firstly, the ceiling of my room was severely mouldy - see attached photo, which for me it unacceptable for a 4 star hotel. The lobby I also found uncomfortably hot, almost like they do not have the air conditioning running, and I live in Dubai so am used to hot and humid conditions. The double single bed room was small and tight with very little space to move around. On the plus sides, the beds are comfortable, and the location is on the edge of Chinatown, meaning that you have more eating and drinking options on your doorstep than you could wish for. It is around a 25 minute walk to Marina Bay.

title: Pleasant one night stay but...
desc: Only needed to stay one night after a wedding in Singapore. The room itself was pleasant and quiet as requested. Location great. They even let me check in earlier, check out later and everything was great up until after I checked out. On the day of checkout I lost my sunglasses and I was certain I left it on a couch in the lobby whilst waiting for my Grab. Needless to say I had to call THREE times regarding this lost property. I left my name and number over the phone and even had to call from overseas. On the third time, I even sent a photo of the sunglasses! Why was it so difficult for someone to contact me just to let me know what was going on? I guess I‚Äôll never find out As I never heard back. I would‚Äôve given 4 stars as the bathroom was quite small and there was a

title: Really excellent hotel
desc: Staying at the Dorsett was a wonderful experience. The location was fantastic - right next to the Outram Park MRT with a lift from the MRT to just opposite the hotel and only requiring traversing four stairs and one quiet lane. The Dorsett is walking distance to China Town and Pinnacle@Dutton and in a very lovely area. We used it as a base to explore as far as Tanah Merah to the east and Tuas in the West. The hotel itself had a pretty classy lobby. When arriving desk staff were kind and helpful and there was self-serve calamasi drinks available near the entry. On our last day we inquired about a late check-out and got a one-hour extension (it was all we needed) at no cost and they set up the room keys immediately to confirm this and they were so nice about it. The camera theme

title: Trip to SG for our Anniversary
desc: We stayed at Dorsett Hotel for 4 nights and it was superb! The hospitality of their staff especially Front Office agents is remarkable! From check-in to check-out, it was really smooth and hassle free.. their FO Manager Ms. Michelle was very friendly and accommodating! We really enjoyed our stay there üíï The location of this hotel is really accessible, they even have their own access to MRT and very near to a bus stop. Walking distance to Chinatown where you can eat and shop esp if you‚Äôre in a budget. Overall, our stay was enjoyable and satisfying :)

title: Next to Chinatown
desc: Traveled with Gate1 travel guided tour. The rooms are not what we are used to the US. Smaller but very nice. Location is great. The subway is also across the street and under the hotel. $1.50 for rides. Super safe. The food was okay during breakfast, since they offer Asian food also for breakfast.Barinside next to restaurant. Customer service was excellent all the way around.

title: Everything you need in a great location
desc: I really enjoy staying at the Dorsett. Have stayed 3 times now and it has been better each time. The staff are excellent, with requests handled enthusiastically. The pool is a lovely size, and beautifully clean. Room service menu is comprehensive and well priced. My only criticism would be that the lighting in the bathroom is not great, so for ladies getting ready for a function, its a bit of an inconvenience. Can't fault it otherwise.

title: Great Place and Great Services
desc: I travelled with 2 kids and spent 3 nights. Staffs are helpful and ver good responses on handling issues. Too bad i had no chance to enjoy swimmi g pool and upper garden. Location are very strategic.. MRT Outram is exactly next door..also bus station.. I did not include breakfast but food I ordered by room service was great base on my Indonesia taste scale. Easy to find alternative foods around the hotel, specially people like me who enjoyed chinesse food, (there's also halal food closed by hotel) Overall I enjoyed the stay

title: Would give a good rating if it existed!
desc: Dorsett is a hotel which tries to be a higher class than it is. We had high expectations, not all of which were met. The positives are the location which is excellent, near enough to thw hustle and bustle of Chinatown but far enough away from the noise. Also service is generally very good. The hotel was v responsive to our queries before we stayed there and also allowed us to leave our luggage there days before the check in as we were going to be away from Singapore. After check out, we could also leave our luggage and hotel staff coordinated showering facilities. The room we had was a corner one so we had a nice view of the city. Negatives of the hotel were the standard of housekeeping - there is a distinct lack of attention to detail so replenishment of things like shaving

title: Nice and enjoyable stay
desc: When I first checked in at Dorsett, check in was seamless. and I was led to the room at 4th floor.. Room is nice and spacious. Swimming pool area is great and I had nice swim there. I love this hotel because it is located near the train station. You can even take lift from station to this hotel . From this train station, the train can take you to many shopping centres, like Chinatown Point, and Vivo City. After shopping, I return to Dorsett restaurant called Amuse for light meal . I had afternoon tea set where I had chicken wings set with free flow coffee/ tea. You have to go to coffee station where you can make your coffee (espresso, cappucino, latte, or just black coffee) ( all these for only $12 after taxes and service charge) I love to return again for loft room one

title: Excellent Stay
desc: We had a relaxing stay just like the last visit. The front desk team were wonderful especially Michelle, May, and Dana. We booked another room for our friend also because the location is very good. We will be back again. Thank you Dorsett!

title: Great location, service and hotel
desc: Love this hotel. It was my second time staying and such a great location right next to the MRT. Close to great cafes with good coffee (like Populous), as well as some great bars and restaurants nearby. The breakfast has improvised significantly on the last time I stayed. Very comfy beds and a great bath in my room. Pure heaven. Highly recommend this property.

title: First Time
desc: My first time staying at Dorsett Singapore. Check in process was very professional and efficient by Yadi. He give me a map and suggest the places for me to visit when he get to know my first time to Singapore. Room was simple and have much everything that i needed. The things that annoys me was the room is not soundproof. Location is good and near to the train station.Overall my stay is good and i will definitely come back.

title: Beautiful Dorsett Hotel
desc: The location is great, less than a 10 minute walk to China town, straight down New Bridge road. It is very convenient having the Outram Park MRT right beside the hotel as well. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but clean and comfortable. The pool is great as it is not that deep and a reasonable temperature (not freezing like a lot of hotel pools in Singapore!), the gym is a standard hotel gym, enough to do a quick workout. What makes his hotel stand out, is the attentive and friendly staff, especially Yadi and Dana. Yadi on the front desk is hilarious and very kindly arranged a cake for my mum for her birthday. Dana is very caring and kind, she checked on us each time we passed the front desk, ensuring that we were enjoying our stay. I would recommend this hotel to others.

title: Customer Service - top class
desc: We arrived at Dorsett very early due to our flight and were not disappointed with the level of customer service at the hotel. Although there were no rooms available for early check in, Rachel (Duty Manager) did her best to give us access to facility in the hotel for shower and changes. She was very knowledgeable of the place and helping us with best transport to get around the city and the airport. The rooms were spacious, clean, tidy, and quiet. However, there was a little smell of mould in the room. The gym was adequate and spacious for my work out but it needs a bit of attention. The hotel is a walking distance to Maxwell Road Hawker Centre. Would come back again.

title: Location second to none.
desc: It was our first time to Singapore and the Dorsett is a great place to stay. Being SO CLOSE to the MRT and China town is wonderful and the staff are so friendly and knowledgeable about how to make the most of your time there. The decor and and ambiance of the hotel is great. Our only feedback is that the beds were hard and the shower layout made it so the floor outside was soaked after you showered.

title: Wonderful location and service
desc: My husband and I are a regular guest at this hotel. The location is very good and close to china town and clark quay hence many choices of restaurants and hawker center. It is also easy to travel as outram park MRT station is next door. The front desk staff is very friendly and professional especially Onnah and Yadi. They were really helpful and Make our stay easier. The marketing staff, Nadya, also informative and friendly too. Thanks so much for wonderful service.

title: Comfy & great location
desc: Room 718 -The Dorsett Singapore Had a stop over for 2 nights on my way to Germany, I stayed here on my own but was travelling with my sister & brother in law The air conditioner worked well, (important) there was a big lovely comfy bed with huge feather down pillows which meant a great nights sleep. Very friendly smiling check in staff. Nice bathrooms with robe & slippers & things like shower cap/comb/disposable toothbrush & paste/razor & shaving cream/eye pads & cotton tips/. There were 2 bottles of water each day which are needed as Singapore is HOT! Awesome shower that also had the rain shower head in the ceiling. There was a snack /drink vending machine in the lobby. I didn‚Äôt go looking for the Pool but there is one. Hairdryer & in-room safe. Great location, you can

title: Central location
desc: We arrived in the very early hours of the morning, our check in was quick and easy as we were tired from our flight. The twin room was compact but adequate and the beds were very comfortable. The MRT was 1 minute walk away and the hotel was very close to China town. I used the gym that was small but perfect for my workout. The room was very clean with a nice big shower.

title: Excellent location
desc: Perfect location.... walking distance to Chinatown, metro next door (for the rest of Singapore), 5 min by taxi to Cruise Port. Rooms were clean/good-sized and service desk personnel friendly and helpful. Would stay here again and definitely recommend to friends!

title: Good to stay.
desc: Hotel is located in good location. Room is small but clean and comfortable. It is convenient to go by MRT, there is the way to go down to the station next to hotel. Breakfast is good but the man work there is unfriendly. It seem like customers beg him for food. Do not expect for staff supporting in Singapore like bellman or city information if you stay in 3 stars standard hotel.

title: Loft room
desc: I booked their loft room for a staycation for our family. The hotel reception looked (and smelled) really good! The room was alright, it looked like the pictures but it felt abit old. I think the cupboards are in need of an update. Some of them made creaking noises when we opened it. We wanted to boil some water to make coffee but the kettle didn‚Äôt look ‚Äòclean‚Äô so we just got coffee from the vending machines in the lobby. I‚Äôve stayed in several loft style hotel rooms and I think The Dorsett‚Äôs loft is one of the best. No other hotels give you a tv hanging over the loft! I also like how they refill the shampoo and soap bottles (they smell really good too) so no wasteful disposable ones! The bathroom cannot be locked and i don‚Äôt like that there‚Äôs no place to sit down and do my

title: Wonderful service
desc: Oonah and shah excellent representatives of the hotel eager to help, very professional and did everything they could to make our stay pleasant. Went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and welcome in your facility. Definitely will tell others!

title: Average hotel
desc: The rooms feel more like an average 3 star hotel. The staff are really friendly but the rooms themselves are poorly designed and not comfortable - the bathroom is a very odd design and the so called double bed was two uncomfortable single beds put together. Not worth the money. Warning: we booked through booking.com and the advertised price does not include tax...

title: Wonderful Stay
desc: The area is very clean and many buses around. The location is convenient and close to MRT. Room was comfortable and pillows were okay. Staff was very helpful especially Michelle who helped my friend when she got injured. We will come back to stay again hopefully next month!

title: Great stay
desc: We booked this hotel due to its proximity to Chinatown. We have been to Singapore many times and wanted to stay in a different area. The location was perfect. MRT station nearby as well as many shops and Chinatown itself. Check in was quick and professional. We had a lovely stay here and would recommend this hotel.

title: Bad service
desc: The only great things about this hotel is the location. Other than that, breakfast is mediacore, service is bad. Asked for housekeeping in the evening as the do not disturb sign was up during the day. Called reception from the room 3 times, there was no answer. Called operator and housekeeping, no answer either. Why bother having a speed dial form the room phone if nobody is going to answer the phone? Went to request housekeeping at the front desk. Came back to a room still unkempt, but with a bunch of towels left on the table. Is that the Dorsett Singapore version of housekeeping? If you're looking for easily accessible location and around the same price, can easily find other with great location but with better service.

title: The best staff in the world!
desc: I stayed at the Dorsett for 3 nights in early July, business trip. The hotel is fine for the price bracket - the pool is very nice, although there could be a few more amenities and protection from the view and noise of traffic; the restaurant to be avoided. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown - not the sterile Singapore I had expected, but rather a messy, vibrant and trendy network of streets and alleyways, with some delicious food. But the best thing by far was the hotel staff, who are the friendliest and most helpful I have ever come across. On arrival, I was allowed to check in and given a room hours before the due time; after a long o/n flight from London that was wonderful. During my stay, I found helpful and friendly advice whenever required. And on the day I left, I was

title: Location & Amazing Staff
desc: Arrived after a late night flight and the check-in process was extremely smooth and friendly even for the early hours of the morning. My partner and I were celebrating a special occasion and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect for those who don't want the hustle and bustle of Orchard but still want the convenience of easy MRT access to Santosa & Marina Bay. The proximity to local hawkers/ Chinatown made the trip all that more authentic. Working in the Hospitality industry myself & having been to Singapore many times I would have no hesitation recommending Dorsett to my friends and family for their future travel. Please commend the whole team for an overall amazing experience. Looking forward to staying here again. - Yohan

title: Comfort stay for business travelers
desc: I've stayed here for my last work trip. The room is clean with comfy bed. The staffs was awesome. Managed to print my boarding pass with them without fuss. The location is just a stone away from Outram Park MRT and Chinatown. Look for room with heritage view. You will just love it!

title: Unbelievably unprofessional front desk experience
desc: So my sister made the booking for me under her Agoda account. I came to the front desk and showed the booking confirmation and passport. The front-desk staff requested that I or my sister must contact Agoda to confirm my name in the booking request. Ok, so my sister messaged Agoda under the booking reference section on Agoda website. I showed that to the front-desk (I had to queue again behind other guests who came after me) but they said a web message is not acceptable and demanded my sister directly call Agoda. Ok, so I had to step aside again to call my sister, she called Agoda and after several attempts Agoda picked up the phone and did sort it out, said that they will send an email to the hotel immediately. I asked the front-desk, but was instructed to wait until further

title: Great location and friendly staff!
desc: This hotel was great and was located in the perfect location, right near the MRT train station. This enabled us to travel around Singapore costing next to nothing. The hotel in the staff were very accommodating and helpful and were only a knock away when we needed something. I would defiantly stay again, the housekeeping staff also made sure our rooms were kept clean when out exploring. Thanks Team!!

title: Singapore Holidays Stay May 28, 29, 30 2019
desc: Greetings ! As old Singaporeans from North America Dorsett Hotel is well located in the People Park 's Centre neighborhood of eateries shops etc in fact we had a Friends Dinning Together at very expensive Spring Court Cuisine Eatery nearby it has Deem Brunch !Dorsett is MRT accessible for light luggage Travellers like us, being near Outram ,Tanjong Pagar revived good aide memoirs for me including Kereta Ayer Chinatown ! Although we did have family help on transport to Changi and from being nearby to MRT Outram is comforting ! We are at Room 308 , your multi lingual staff at Reception is welcoming and superb Majullah Singapoora Jika Tak Mahjong masa ini ! Dorsett 's swimming is too small and too shallow for lap swimmers like me ! Dorsett might do very well with a Chinese Deem

title: Family stay at Dorsett
desc: Kami menginap 2 hari sangat memuaskan good service and thanks Ms Michelle good service for my family love stay at hotel and good location. Near Chinatown and the Outram park mart stadion. We will be back again.

title: 2 nights stay
desc: Stayed at Dorsett for a business trip. They are very responsive from the booking, check in and all other requests. Located near Chinatown and VivoCity. Many restaurants to choose from. Breakfast selection is few but can fill you up. Room is ok, but there are some dust inside the cabinet. Not a big deal though. Will definitely stay here again ;)

title: Hospitality Is Everything.
desc: I stayed here with my husband and 13 y.o daughter. The staff is quite friendly and helpful. Specially for Mr. Yadi. He‚Äôs the duty manager when we stayed there. He explained things and gave directions to the place we want to go etc like we‚Äôre his old friends. And one of the things I like about this hotel location is that chinatown is on a walking distance. The hotel also surrounded with beautiful buildings, small enchanting cafe, bookstore. MRT? They have special lift that goes there directly in front of the hotel. Accessible, Affordable, and Hospitable. Need I say more ? I definitely coming back to Dorsett.

title: A very happy stay in Dorsett
desc: It was synchronicity that we stayed there. I wanted to stay in Wyndham but the Agoda Website crashed everytime I opened Wyndham Hotel for booking. Luckily, Dorsett caught my eye on the next page and they offered a sudden 50% discount. What a great move! This is the most Central Location, right on top of a Metro Station and next door to the wondrous ChinaTown. From here to Sentosa is just 7-8 dollars by Taxi. We went twice to Sentosa because of Dorsett. The Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are fine, a bit small but better than Hong Kong Hotel rooms. The facilities are all World Class, and the Wifi Quality, magnificent. No need to sit in the lobby to get access, we got lightning fast Free Wifi on the 8th Floor. Very good restaurants abound nearby, there is a

title: Great stay
desc: The staff were really pleasant and helpful, especially Dana who was happy/enthusiastic and knowledgeable, nothing was any problem. The room was clean and spacious. The bed was really comfortable. The en suite was large and well equipped. Pool towels were provided in the room, together with bathrobes and slippers. The pool area had sunbeds/tables/chairs and the pool was very clean. Our afternoon swim was thoroughly appreciated. We did not eat in the hotel but enjoyed the happy hour drinks. The hotel has direct access to the Outram MRT so great situation for Chinatown and Little India and the purchase of the Tourist Travel Pass is a must at 30SD with 10SD refund is a must! We had a great stay and would definitely book this hotel again should we return to Singapore in the

title: End of Trip
desc: Singapore is modern, friendly people, easy transportation and lots of shopping! This hotel is comfortable, accommodating, and bed is superb. Staff exceptional, patient, and friendly. Michelle, Pravin, Rachel to name a few.

title: great hotel good location
desc: i was visited dorsett early april. the room very clean i got room upgrade because of staff compliment about their mistake. the location is great very near outram park MRT station. very near to chinatown and many food,resto,and bar around there.

title: Great for Chinatown
desc: We found the staff at the Dorsett were very helpful and friendly. Michele on reception and the ladies in the restaurant were outstanding. The hotel even has its own entrance to the MRT underground railway, a few steps beyond the main entrance. Its proximity to Chinatown is a massive positive. It is one stop on the MRT which is great for the air conditioning but it is a short walk to get some super food at great prices. The Dorsett may not have the plush 'bells & whistles' of the 5-star hotels such as the Mandarin Oriental et al but we loved the location, liked, appreciated the staff and were happy not to have to deal with the 'bling' of the plush hotels.

title: Lovely Staff, Great Room, Nice Location
desc: We stayed for 4 nights on holiday. Hotel staff were so lovely & helpful from check-in till check-out that I wrote Assistant Front Office Manager Michelle a long 2-page email to thank her and her staff. Room was spacious clean & comfortable. Bathroom was roomy & clean. Swimming pool was nice and we enjoyed it. Great location. Right on top of subway station and bus stop. I walked to nearby Chinatown Hawker Centre every morning to buy yummy & affordable hot breakfast and also pick up fresh fruits in the wet market below! Will definitely recommend Dorsett Singapore to friends & stay again! P.S. By the way, there was a small issue with shower area where we had to put bath rug & towels to stop water from draining into the bathroom. Not a big issue so we didn‚Äôt bother telling the hotel

title: Nice hotel in outram park area
desc: Very close to China town and all the restaurants, hawkers and bars. The price is quite good for value (according to Singapore market price). If you are a fan of Crazy Rich Asians, this area will remind you some good memories. Cozy hotel with small rooms.

title: Loved my stay here!
desc: Perfect- location wise, front desk staff, the needless to ask but automatically refilled toiletries. The rooms are a decent size, the bathrooms better than most in terms of space.. I wish they had a fairly ok priced breakfast. But then there are several options (and rated ones at that) around that you can go pick up a good breakfast.

title: Lovely Staff
desc: Stayed for 2 nights on holiday. Lovely hotel which met all our needs. Attractive lobby and nice pool area. Room was spacious clean and comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and clean. Pool towels were provided. The staff were outstanding and couldn‚Äôt do enough to help us with anything we needed. Location at the south of Chinatown was ok if you don‚Äôt mind walking but it is a bit out from the main drag.

title: Excellent!
desc: We stayed here for 5 nights and had fantastic service from all the staff. It was great value for money and well located. It was a short walk to Chinatown where there were markets, temples and many good restaurants. It was also centre to getting to most sights around Singapore 3 stops on the MRT (metro) to Orchard Rd and 1 to the Harbour front which also leads to Sentosa Island. The MRT (Metro) is next to the hotel. Oonah who was at the front desk was particularly helpful to recommend restaurants and activites to do during our stay. She provided guides and maps for us to use and even arranged a bottle of wine, card and found a restaurant for us for our 5th anniversary. Thank you for a fantastic time in Singapore! We will be back!

title: Great stay.
desc: We booked in here for 3 nights prior to joint our cruise to Hong Kong. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a higher room with a better view, which was nice. The room was good, and the bed was very comfortable.The staff were uniformly friendly and polite. The breakfast was also very good with a wide variety of dishes. For us however, one of the main attractions was the proximity of the MTR subway - just round the corner from the front door.

title: Great trip
desc: The overall stay was awesome. However it‚Äôs a little bit far from food stores and 7-11. The staffs were super friendly and helpful. Even the cleaning lady is nice to me when I met her on the way down. I booked my stay directly on hotel site so there is room upgrade and small snack at check in. This morning when I check out, they also let me have a lucky draw with the price is a multi all in one plug. I would recommend Dorsett to my family, friends and colleagues.

title: Not Bad for a stop over
desc: Hotel is conveniently located next to Outram train station so easy to access. I arrived at 1:00pm and was lucky enough to get my room straight away. Thanks to Michelle. Room was small but well equipped. Bed was comfortable, and bathroom was clean. Only comment would the carpet which was very filthy. I didnt dare walk bare foot. I left at 5:00am the next day and the 2 ladies at the front desk were very helpful in getting me a taxi. Overall this place is not bad for the price you pay. I would stay here again for a short trip like this.

title: Ticks all I need
desc: My family and I stayed in this hotel during my visit to the Singapore General Hospital. The proximity to the SGH and MRT station was the consideration to choose the hotel. When you exit Outram Park MRT station towards Dorsett hotel using an elevator you will come right at in front of the hotel. It has a decent size room, nice mattress and pillows. The room equipped with iron and ironing board, kettle. Definitely will stay here again.

title: Had a wonderful experience here
desc: 2 night stay and there was nothing we could be negative about. Every single member of staff was lovely, professional and helpful - and I'm picky when it comes to customer engagement! Would definitely recommend. In terms of location the MRT is just next door - after exiting the train, follow signs for New Bridge Road/Dorsett hotel and take the lift to level 1 after the 2nd up-escalator. There are 3 steps down then you come out at the micro brewery next door and only a few steps to the front doors of the hotel. The area around the hotel has lots of eateries. the Maxwell food centre, for example, is only about a 6 minute walk. Thank you to everyone at the Dorsett!

title: The location is great
desc: The location is great, direct access to Outram Park MRT (green & purple line). Walking distance to Chinatown, Budha Tooth Relic Temple and Sri Mariamman Temple. Very photogenic location. Value for money.. the facilities are good, room is comportable and clean.

title: So Nice!
desc: Awesome front desk staff. Courteous and went out of their way to be helpful. Concierge was on hand to welcome us whenever we returned from our outings. Great location-above MRT Station and walking distance to food court.

title: Good stay, excellent location & staff
desc: 3 nights in the standard Dorsett room. 'Compact' room but good value given the price. Location terrific above Outram station and lots of choices of bars, restaurants and cafes walking distance. Special mention to the staff and in particular, Dana. Always smiling, always thoughtful. Thanks

title: Brilliant Service - Lovely Hotel
desc: My friend and I chose this hotel as it was our first trip to Singapore and we needed a hotel in a good position to go sightseeing. We were staying for 3 nights. The hotel exceeded expectations, It was beautiful and clean and the staff were fabulous. ( The bathroom was a little small causing difficulty in moving about- but really nothing to worry about) Our thanks go to May who went out of her way to help us find our way about, arranging taxis when needed and explaining the MRT routes which turned out to be right next to the hotel - perfect! We had breakfast included in our stay and the choice was excellent and of a high standard. Omelettes cooked to order. We were within walking distance of China Town which is lovely and provides numerous places to eat and shop in the evening (

title: Same old same old
desc: My 2nd stay here at Dorsett was just for one week, shorter than the first time I stayed. It was pretty much the same as a year ago. The Handyphone previously provided was gone. WiFi speed was still the same. Breakfast still had the same spread and still opened at 6:30 am, which is later than other hotels. I had to leave early for a couple of days and the hotel had to pack me pastries and fruit but I would have preferred to sit down. I love the rainshower stall but would also prefer to have a bidet available to use. Overall it was pretty much the same experience as last year.

title: Great Location !! Next to MRT
desc: The room was good and clean. The hotel located next to MRT Outram which very good !!!! No need to change mrt line from the airport . And only one station away from Chinatown . Perfect area. Recommended

title: Good without being great
desc: I chose the hotel as I had a layover of 24 hours and wanted somewhere to rest and to get a quick glimpse of Singapore before my midnight departure. This hotel provided. The rooms themselves I found were basic and didn't really impress, but it was sufficient. The check in was good as the reception offered a 1pm check out which was much appreciated as I was a late night arrival. The location was great. Only a few minutes from Chinatown, which consumed my entire day, and I also noticed transport was close by. Overall it was good without being great and was sufficient.

title: Half term break
desc: We spent 6 wonderful nights at the Dorsett Singapore during our kids half term break. As this was our first time to Singapore and with the abundance of hotels to choose from I was initially a little apprehensive but this quickly disappeared on arrival at the Dorsett. Despite our early arrival (11 am) we were afforded an early check-in, which was a nice touch considering we had an overnight journey. The hotel itself is well maintained, clean and the location was excellent. The nearest MRT station was a 3 minute walk from the hotel and 1 stop thereafter to Sentosa island. China town with an abundance of eateries/ shop / market was only 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The staff are friendly and welcoming, all were well informed about the surrounding amenities and a special

title: Superb service and convenience
desc: I chose this hotel because I needed to close to the MRT as I was attending a conference at at BIGBOX in Jurong East. It exceeded my expectations in every area. Superb spot. It is right above Outram MRT and close to Chinatown and Duxton Hill.

title: Ideally Located Hotel
desc: Hotel is modern, clean, centrally located and close ot everything a tourist might want to see. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Next to subway station, Chinatown, and Hop On Hop Off bus stop. Will stay again next time in Singapore.

title: love sg more cause of this hotel
desc: hotel so easy to find, close to mrt , easy to get there when arrive changi airport. room available before 2pm and they‚Äôre let us check in first so adorable and also may is very nice reception. she is a perfect receptionist tell everything to us who visit sg in first time and reccomend us friendly room is good with reasonable price, we so happy to be here and will reccommend this hotel to friends : )

title: ill maintained and dirty. Avoid if possible.
desc: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on travel websites but the room that was given to us didn't reflect the good reviews we had read at all. The room smelled really bad upon entering and I had to leave air con running constantly to keep it bearable. The carpet had pretty bad stains all over the room and I was scared to walk around bare feet. The wallpaper had some old glue residue (or some kind of repair, see pictures) and was very old and showed its age. The shower cubicle had mould on rubber sealing and floor tiles, again, I couldn't use the shower bare feet. The toilet paper holder was rusted badly and broken. The management was informed and they were swift to come up to inspect the room. They agreed that the room was not fit for purpose, but they were still

title: Good standard mid range hotel
desc: My wife and I stayed for a couple of nights before taking a cruise, having found a good offer online. The hotel was very clean and modern, on the edge of Chinatown, next to one of the main Police Stations, so felt very safe. Good breakfast buffet, covering not just Western staples, but South East Asian Fare too, which allowed us to try something new and tasty. Hotel above a subway station, 40 minutes direct from Changi Airport. Did not try hotel restaurant, crazy to do that with the fantastic food courts only a few hundred meters away in Chinatown. Good swimming pool, with plenty of space to relax in the shade. If you have been to Singapore you will know why you need shade! Not top price, because not in central area, but worth every penny.

title: Superb staff
desc: Wanted to arrange a Valentine present as my wife stayed over. The staff made is possible with some fantastic effort. They went out to buy some chocolate and even had hart balloons on her pillow. Thanks!

title: Short visit
desc: Located in Chinatown, the hotel has an impressive lobby. Check in was smooth. Our room on the 10th floor was small but had all the facilities for our short stay. The bathroom on the other hand was big , no bath but a lovely shower.I was having difficulty finding a few cigars, and asking st the desk the staff went the extra mile and found me an excellent store, Old Cuba, within easy walking distance. The store was hard to find and I would not have succeeded without their sterling work. We were going to have breakfast at the hotel, but found it was badly over priced The air conditioning was noisy

title: Comfortable and accessible
desc: We stayed here with 4 other friends prior to our travels to Thailand. Lovely hotel with a couple of little considerations. Firstly we were all given an upgrade to a loft room which was very nice. The beds are so comfortable. 2 considerations for the bedrooms, there is no plug anywhere near a mirror if you need to use the hairdryer or a plug to charge your phone up near the bed where you can reach your phone. Other than that it was a very nice hotel. Clean, friendly, right next to Outram MRT. We were there during Chinese Lunar New Year and it was crazy busy in Chinatown. The bar closes early which was a bit strange for modern hotel so don‚Äôt come back thinking you‚Äôll have a nightcap before bed.

title: Sufficient for a short stopover
desc: We stayed at The Dorsett on a short 2-day stopover. The rooms are very small with limited packing space, and the bathroom is very cramped. This did not bother us too much as we were never at the hotel, but if you like unpacking and settling in I would recommend looking for something a bit bigger. We have stayed at other hotels in Singapore before around the same price range with bigger rooms. The pool is very nice to relax in after a day of walking around town. There is a MRT station close to the hotel, but you cannot access it from the lobby, you have to go out and around the block. There was some construction being done across from the hotel when we were there. Breakfast is sufficient, but not extraordinary. Staff in the restaurant was not too friendly. I have dietary

title: Prime Location
desc: Was there for staycation. Location is great, few steps a away from Outram park MRT and a short walking distance to China Town which have great choice of food options. Room size is fairly big compare to other hotels in Singapore. Fair enough. Aircond is superb for a polar bear like me, enjoyed the freezing cold aircond and had a good hibernation for my Christmas holiday. Please take note that if you are driving, there are limited car parks for guests.

title: Good location but...
desc: Visting Singapore fro the first time as a family we wanted a hotel to have a good location and this is the best thing about this hotel. It's next to the subway station, one stop from the Sentosa station and 3-4 to Marina bay so from this point of view is great! But there are are many things that are not as great. Firstly the rooms quality, The first room was given to us was in a floor that smelled paint thinner and the room was really terrible with wallpaper teared apart in many places and very dirty carpet, After I went back to the reception to complain they changed the room to a better one but nothing special, just better condition. Another weird thing is that after 8pm if you need a coffee or anything to eat you can't! I never met this in this kind of hotel level before.

title: Good midrange hotel on the border of Chinatown
desc: Pleasantly decorated rooms which are a lttle on the small side, but well appointed, with quiet A/C and good shower. Good wi-fi and ditto breakfast make this an easy stay. Not a very homey bar, but then bustling Chinatown is just staggering distance from the hotel where there are many to be found. The hotel is on top of Outram subway station, which the gateway to everywhere in Singapore.

title: Staycation
desc: Had an enjoyable and relaxed stay at Dorsett Singapore hotel over the weekend with my parents. The staffs are friendly and extremely attentive towards my aged parents . We are extremely impressed with the hotel‚Äôs facilities- sleeping rooms are well equipped with basic requirements. Excellent wifi facility, spacious room with high ceiling! Hotel is conveniently located near to MRT station and within closed walking proximity to the famous and good eateries (restaurants and bars). Thank you to Dorsett Singapore for a great, memorable experience!

title: Disappointing Stay
desc: My family and I decided to stay in this hotel so as to be in close proximity for the Chinatown Lunar New Year 2019 countdown celebrations. This hotel is convenient as it‚Äôs within minutes‚Äô walk to the heart of Chinatown. Price wise it‚Äôs expensive. We booked the Dorsett Room at SGD250+ per night. The room is small although the room condition is pretty new. However, there‚Äôs an issue with the toilet design. This toilet is so poorly designed such that the toilet bowl area is adjacent to the shower area and both areas share 1 door. The space inside the areas is so small that it‚Äôs difficult to move around inside; the toilet design concept is just weird. This hotel also lacks a club floor which offers a club lounge (another thumbs down). The Carpark is also located away from the

title: Cannot imagine anything better!
desc: The entire staff at the Dorsett have been the most helpful, friendliest, kind and thoughtful that I have ever experienced. Thank you all for a very happy, memorable trip to Singapore. I will never forget you. I must add: clean, beautiful, convenient location, to mention just a few! they even re-set my clock to a 12-hour system so I could know what time it was without having to figure out the 24-hour system.

title: Quality hotel
desc: Stunning hotel, in a great location close to China town with lots of superb cafes and restaurants surrounding! Close to universal studios and close to all the beat Singapore has to offer. Once the surrounding construction work has finished especially concerning the view from the beautiful swimming pool this will be a 5 star rating hotel

title: Run down, poor, terrible food
desc: Just completed a 6 night stay. This hotel is convenient for Chinatown, and very close to Outram Park MRT station. That‚Äôs about all the good I can say about it. Restaurant food is not very good at all. The one evening meal I ate their was served very, very quickly. Far too fast for it to have been freshly prepared. It was bland and uninteresting (guests from UK, think cheap and bad chinese takeaway quality). The restaurant plays terrible covers of international pop music on repeat. After one night, I switched to Deliveroo or GrabFood deliveries when eating in. Breakfast is standard buffet food. No yoghurt (if that‚Äôs your thing). The hotel bar shuts at about 9:30, and room service stops about 10. Don‚Äôt expect service after a long day in the office or sightseeing. After that

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
desc: We had a lovely 2 night stay here on route to Thailand. Very convenient for transportation getting around. Easy checkin and room clean. Would stay here again, however, was not so keen on the loft room. Stairs to bed, with bathroom downstairs. Hard getting in and out of bed if you slept on the ‚Äúother side‚Äù of the bed. Couldn‚Äôt walk around the bed. As has been said in earlier review. Could not blow dry your hair looking in a mirror, asked for an extension cord but didn‚Äôt have one. Couldn‚Äôt open safe at 5am the morning of departure, the hotel sent someone out, got it open and changed batteries without delay. Thank you

title: If you want a super comfy bed, spacious room, powerful shower and lovely staff then this is the hotel for you.
desc: We stayed here for three nights at the start of our holiday to Asia. It was the perfect place to acclimatise and adjust to the time difference. The hotel was around $24 dollars from the airport and took about 20 minutes. Check in process took less than 5 minutes. The desk staff were friendly, welcoming, professional and efficient. Our deluxe room on the 8th floor was spacious, clean, comfortable and well equipped with robes, slippers, kettle, water, tea and coffee, lots of toiletries (including razor, toothbrushes, cotton wool etc.) The shower was hot and powerful. TV had a good mix of channels. The in-room safe was nice and big. Big enough to hold a large laptop and several other valuable devices. Air conditioning was functional and quiet. Black out curtains were fab.

title: Comfortable
desc: If you want to be around ChinaTown this is the place to stay. Breakfast was good, bed comfortable but bathroom somewhat lacking. Overall a good stay once you get your bearings. Close to lots of cafes/restaurants and the train.

title: thanks for your survice
desc: I accidentally hurt my finger when closing safety box at night. It bleed a little bit and made some staining on bed sheet and my pillow during sleep (I tried to clean those stains but still quite remarkable). The next day afternoon I got a letter form the hotel service concerning and asking if there's anything they can help. My wife also got a call from custum service, not for compansation, just for concerning. I wrote a letter for appology and hope to make compensation for the stains. The custum service was so kind and concerned my wound again, and I didn't have to pay for it. Sincerely thanks for the kindness and warmth of the hotel survice!

title: Comfortable, great location, slightly odd bathroom
desc: Modern, clean and comfortable business-class hotel in a convenient location on the edge of Chinatown and next to an MRT station. Standard twin room was not large but not cramped either. Great A/C and beds. Only annoying quirk was the bathroom layout, with an internal door that could close off the toilet or the shower, but if you needed to switch between the two you had to open the main bathroom door (or be very skinny to slide around the internal door). Pool and gym looked nice (the pool was being repaired most of the days I was there, but open again at the end). Walked a few minutes to the Chinatown Complex hawker center for amazing breakfasts!

title: This hotel is so run down
desc: It was our 4th time with this hotel. We always love the hotel for its location. But the hotel is getting worse by each year we came back to visit Spore. Rooms were so dated. The worse thing was, the room was so freaking dusty! Till i have to do my own house keeping. I was told they had their management changed. Saving cost i assume? Hey, your price ain't cheap for a small room with a 4 star rating. And you made the house keeping people for each of them work for 30 over rooms!! Insane! I Don know how true this could be, but i rather trust my own experience. The proof of a very obvious dust on the radio. It was near to my bed for haven sake! I'm breathing in dust during my sleep. I had nose allergies and when i got home, i was down with a flu! Worst still! You even provided me

title: A lovely retreat in busy Chinatown
desc: Easy access via the MRT with the station exit just twenty steps from the hotel lobby. Also clear signs at the MRT station itself. Right in the corner of busy Chinatown (Singapore) its a great retreat for some peace and quiet while still within walking distance to a wide variety of food - and being truly spoil for choice! And within walking distance to explore neighbourhoods like Tanjong Pagar, Chinatown and Tiong Bahru And more food. The room was lovely and the shower area relaxing. The pool was good for soaking in the sun and long enough for a few decent laps. My only issue was all the edges and corners in the pool - not fully safe for children. The hotel was thoughtful to send up some cake as a Birthday gift. it was a treat!!

title: Great service at AMUSE Zichar + Bistro Concept
desc: The Dorsett Singapore is conveniently located at one of the exits of the Outram Park MRT station. Two friends and I had the lunch semi-buffet at one of their restaurants - the AMUSE Zichar + Bistro Concept. The service was very good, friendly and helpful. The semi-buffet offers free flow of coffee, tea or water, salads, starters and desserts. Patrons get to choose their main course from a list. The decor was nice, and the overall experience value-for-money.

title: Friendly, warm, comfortable
desc: For a 10 day trip we were looking for a place that would have been central in location, unobtrusive yet warm and friendly in service, have most amenities of a five star hotel and we found all this and more at the Dorsett Singapore. The whole experience from the booking stage where Rose from reservations and Peter Chua the Rooms division manager ensured the initial part was smooth giving the right advise. We arrived on an early flight and at arrival Oonah was a pleasure to talk to, she organised an early checkin which was such a blessing as we had hardly any sleep on the flight and escorted us to our room making sure everything was explained as well as offering any assistance to ensure we settled in well on the first day as well as ensured we had the right amount of amenities

title: A Generally Nice Hotel With Some Odd Quirks
desc: There are two styles of room (two-story loft and one-story standard room) that could accommodate 3 people. I stayed in a loft room that was quite cramped and had the main bed upstairs (the stairs lead directly to the bed platform, so there is nothing upstairs other than the bed). I personally slept on the pull out couch. With the couch pulled out on the bottom level, the room became very difficult to navigate. We had to awkwardly scoot to get to anywhere on the bottom floor. In fact, you could not get into the bathroom without walking over the bed and stepping down into it. We found that one of the closet panels went through to the bathroom so we actually ended up ducking through the closet to get into the bathroom while the couch was pulled out. This was very awkward and

title: Excellent location and convenience
desc: Had a great stay at Dorsett, in. Deluxe room. Super comfortable, nice pillows, clean and neat room. Extremely convenient location near the MRT and buses. Close to Tiong Bahru, and China Town. Close to food and amenities. Well done!

title: Pleasant surprise on the edge of Chinatown
desc: I was booked here while on a recent visit to the National Cancer Centre and the medical campus. The hotel is linked to the MRT (which is fabulous and such a great way to get around Singapore) and literally two short blocks from the teeming streets of Chinatown and all that area has to offer (lots). I arrive in the middle of the night and my room was waiting for me. Very quick check in however they neglected to tell me that I had to put my room key in the slot next to the door to be able to watch TV. This took some time to sort out because I am used to having to insert the key to activate all the lights and the lights worked fine without the keycard thing. Anyway.... bed was comfortable with down pillows. The room was not large but fine for one person. The bathroom is tiny and

title: right above MRT
desc: Stayed at this hotel for the recent StanChart marathon. Pros first: nice big lobby that was nicely decorated for Christmas; rooms relatively nice (although ours had a weird configuration where the bathroom door was in front of the bed so my husband really hated that); location was great as it was just above the Outram MRT so had access to both the green and purple line; they have a guaranteed 24 hour stay so if you check in at 3pm you can also have a check out at 3pm the next day; at the time of our stay they were also having a promo where your rewards membership automatically get upgraded to the next tier so we got upgraded to a better room as well; there are also some quaint restaurants and bars around the surrounding area. Cons: breakfast options really limited, you would be

title: Excellent hotel great service.
desc: Booked the Dorsett as a last minute replacement for accommodation that fell through. Staff were excellent, on check in we were advised that we had been given complementary breakfast for the 4days of our stay which was excellent with young children. The room was well represented on website, pool has a lovely view and easy access to the MRT station under the building. Short 5min walk to Chinatown.

title: Short walk from Chinatown
desc: Short walk from Chinatown and has the really nice ManMan restaurant just behind it. Construction work is still going on across the road but they usually can fit you in overlooking the houses on the other side. Staff are friendly and helpful. They have done away with the portable hotel phones. Conveniently located at the Outram MRT station.

title: Duty Manager Oonah Taylor was warm and welcoming
desc: I had checked into Dorsett over the weekend for a short getaway as my birthday celebration. Upon learning of this, the duty manager Oonah, who was processing my check-in, offered to send me two slices of cake to my room. Sure enough, soon after I had checked in, the doorbell rang. To my surprise, it was Oonah herself that was sending the cake up to my room. Along with the cake was a birthday card signed by her on behalf of the management team. Such warm and welcoming gesture has definitely made my stay much more memorable. I will definitely book my future getaways at Dorsett from now on.

title: Small and cosy room
desc: The twin beded room is quite small. I do not like the pillow, it kinda of of feather pillow and everytime I lay on it the pillow is flat and make it uncomfortable.The location is good near MRT and walking distance to Chinatown.

title: Very nice hotel and helpful staff.
desc: Our group of 28 persons stayed at Dorsett for 2 days before boarding Princess Cruise ship. Ms. Jaimay, one of the receptionist, helped us to purchase the tickets at the MRT station. We enjoyed our visit at Dorsett and love to come back. The location is the best, very close to Chinatown . Thanks to Ms. Low. She helped us for transfer arrangement from airport to hotel and to the ship.

title: To play or not to play
desc: Conveniently located near Chinatown, 15 min walk from the river. Friendly staff. Took ages to get the confirmation through Agoda. Lots of problems because they apparently can‚Äôt charge your credit card directly, so I might as well have booked it directly at Dorsetts own website, especially when the final price after fees and taxes ends up being the same. Good location for business and sightseeing. Room a little oldish looking, not bad but could need a facelift. It‚Äôs a feeling that it once was very push when carpet tapestry etc was new. They have a grand piano in the lobby that plays it self from a USB key. The strange thing is that it would have been so easy to make it cozy, just download a playlist that would have done the job, and people could get sit and enjoy a song while

title: Great location.
desc: Stayed for 2 night. Great location. Room is small but fine for a few days. Bathroom was fine. Staff are super helpful. Easy access to Chinatown. Restaurant is also good value for food. Pool was great for a quick dip

title: good location
desc: Reception: I booked under agoda, it took them not long enough to find my booking, and handed my room key. Room: Found the rooms table top & cabinets dusty.. I right away call for housekeeping and the staff came few mins and in less than 3minsthe staff left already, literally for show only that she wiped..I didn‚Äôt bother anymore to asked again.. I do the wiping myself..For the room size average for 2 adults not too small for a family of 3.. Location: Very good location.Mrt station next to the hotel and bus stops to bring you to the attractions..

title: Nanorooms, but conveniently located for Chinatown
desc: Stayed there twice, had to because of proximity to Chinatown., but will not do so again. The rooms are tiny tiny (really) and while there is a small fridge, it is not stocked. After about 9pm, there is very little close by other than iffy street food, and no open bars , so one has to use the rather expensive vending machines. Even so, they keep a $50 deposit on a paper cc slip which then they tear out, after pulling the paper file - it is a hotel which here is elsewhere in time. The staff is minimally efficient and totally expressionless, you ask a question and wait for awhile for an answer, not knowing if the questions was understood. The price is not right for what you get, I paid about US$130, incl taxes. The breakfast is priced as in a far better hotel (if of course you

title: Modern and Classy
desc: This establishment is modern and classy. The rooms are quite spacious and clean. The receptionists were very helpful in providing information as to where we could eat like locals and how to get around the city. The hotel is situated in walking distance to a metro station and is a few stops away from the main attractions of Clarke Quay and Marina Bay.

title: Great stay at Dorsett Singapore
desc: Stayed for 7 nights and had a fabulous time. The staff is wonderful, the location is great (literally on TOP of the MRT station!!) and the pool is very good (really liked the pool in the garden feel). Rooms are fine. Very happy and will return. Aishah at the front desk was terrific in taking care of us. Thank you everyone at Dorsett Singapore!

title: Good hotel but needs to improve on service recovery
desc: I booked a loft room on 4 Dec 2018 for my daughter and friend. Check in experience was not as pleasant as those in other hotels unfortunately... as the receptionist gave me a rather official welcome accompanied with a not so friendly ‚Äúpassport please‚Äù tone. As I was utilizing my AMEX voucher, i showed the email verification and Amex card. Upon check-in, you will find the loft room interesting with its split level and a long staircase leading up to a bed with suspended TV monitor but the room was rather small in my opinion. I requested for the sofa bed to be set up around 2pm and when my daughter returned to the room at 6pm, the sofa bed had not been set up. Service response could be further improved. Room hygiene could do with further improvement as my daughter found and

title: Great!
desc: We just stay 3 days, it‚Äôs good location. Surrounded with a quite neighborhood, near MRT station (Outram Park), bus stop and taxi stand make us feel enjoyable travels with baby. Only 7 minutes to Sentosa Monorail and approximately 10-15 minutes to another attraction in Singapore. Room and bathroom quite tiny, but still okay for asian people, the staff members really helpful to make us more comfortable.

title: Deserve a compliment
desc: I'm from Hong Kong to Singapore for a business trip for one week. When I arrived the hotel at evening Nov 12th, I realized that my hotel booking was made for Dec 12th mistakenly. The booking is neither cancelled nor refundable. Unluckily I was told that all hotel rooms for Nov 12th were fully booked. At that helpless moment, Madam May Kwan of the hotel come to helped me a lot. She concerned with my situation, then handed me her name card for future contact then call a cab for me to another hotel. Later she helped me to asked the hotel to assessed my situation and finally made me a waiver on the wrong date reservation without any penalty. l here thank you May Kwan for her helpful and hospitality and the discretion as well. Even thought I didn't stayed at Dorsett this

title: Very enjoyable stay!
desc: This hotel is located in a great location with close proximity to Sentosa Island and train station. Also within walking distance to little China. The hotel interior is stunning and rooms, although small, are clean and stylish. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful and contained a wide variety for both myself and my pescatarian husband. The staff is pleasant. The only reason for not getting 5 stars is the rooftop pool is small and shallow.

title: Staff are wonderful. Very good hotel in many ways.
desc: Thank you to Michelle for all her help with the lost passport including walking my daughter to the police station when she made her report for the embassy. (Note: We found the passport and boarded our cruise on time!) All the staff were wonderful throughout our stay at the lovely hotel, from restaurant staff to housekeepers. Compact rooms but comfortable beds, many amenities, air conditioning works well, big swimming pool, location on the Edgar of Chinatown just a few feet from MRT station, 4 blocks from Chinatown Food Strreet, a few blocks from Hop Off Hop On stop. So helpful with giving directions, etc.

title: Lovely stay
desc: Hotel stay was lovely, room was very clean and comfortable. 7 min walk to china town. Upgraded our room at checkin due to it being our honey moon.Aisha at Checkin was very efficent. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Above outram park mrt station.

title: Hotel near MRT Station
desc: I stayed here for 4 nights, and I enjoyed it. The location is very near with MRT station, you just walked to the next building, and you can find MRT Station Outram Park. You can find Chinatown just walked around 10 minutes. Their service is good, the room is clean, the breakfast taste is also good. The hotel staff is very helpful. It‚Äôs fit for staying in business purpose or vacation also.

title: Great hotel.
desc: Great hotel. Some construction in area/opposite one side of hotel to be aware of as at 2018/11 but hotel is great. Front desk Staff great. cleaning staff great. Good amenities. Nice rooms. Nice view from the one side facing the city. Next to Outram MRT. Close to get to Chinatown and other areas.

title: The hotel is a modern design boutique hotel great for business and sightseeing.
desc: Stayed 2 nights with my daughter for vacation. Conveniently located near Chinatown in a strategic location, Dorsett Singapore hotel is great for both business and sightseeing. FYI, it took only 33 mins from Changi airport to Outram Park MRT station. Room was well organized and neat. Pool was lovely. Î∞©ÏùÄ ÏûëÏúºÎÇò Íπ®ÎÅóÌïòÍ≥† ÌíÄÏû•Ïù¥ ÍπîÎÅîÌïòÏó¨ Îß§Ïö∞ ÎßàÏùåÏóê Îì§ÏóàÎã§.

title: Holiday
desc: Our Stay here was wonderful. Staff are nice and everything is very clean. Super kind room service lady and lady at Reception Miss Ann from South Korea is the nicest one. She took full effort about helping us out to find the phone even though we did not got that back. In total very nice stay. Will come again back here.

title: Ideal location and great service
desc: A very hospitable environment and gracious staff. They were very helpful - setting up our cellular with Wi-Fi, answering all our questions, providing sightseeing tips and information. Clean rooms and free breakfast. Near Chinatown, Metro, Restaurants and Shops. The Hop On-Hop Off bus stop up is three blocks away. Both hotel and restaurant staff were very accommodating. Great service. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Memorable staycation
desc: The staff here was helpful and they did an extra mile just to do the decoration. I love it and she love it the most. Ann and Lina did an wonderful job. Thank you Ann for the decoration and Lina for the her props.

title: Absolutely nonsense!
desc: I booked the room through Booking.com (18 November 2018) for my wife and daughter for their vacation in Singapore. The next day after I made the booking, I was contacted by one of the hotel staff (Nur Sakeenah) that they could not charge my credit card. They sent me a form to fill up my credit card details to be returned back to them. I did and also send the front copy of my credit card. They then proceeded to charge my card for the total amount (S$188.32) of the room and I received a confirmation from them and from my bank (that my card has been charged). On the day of arrival (23 November 2018), the hotel front desk personnel asked for my wife's credit card and proceeded to charge it again for the room charges. She confronted them and said the payment for the room has

title: Kitch glitz but no substance
desc: After 36 hours of travelling I tried to check in to the hotel with my Singaporean DBS visa card for the expense deposit. I had paid for the room in full when I booked it. I was told that my card wouldn't work. I told them it had worked in Shanghai, Hong Kong, Mumbai, Abu Dhabi & Chicago the previous fortnight, so there is no reason it wouldn't work in it's home town. I was then told that I needed to use a different credit card which I refused as this was my business card. They then said I needed to pay $50 per night cash as a deposit. I refused. They asked if I wanted to use Australian currency even though I had given my Singaporean EP as ID. I was getting annoyed and they gave up. I then went to the room. The rooms are shabby. There were what looked like white water stains all

title: Wonderful Stay
desc: We were given early check-in to refresh ourselves. They manage to find rooms even if what busy. Location is good and the metro is underground. Reception was friendly, especially Michelle, Jean and Jasmine. Thank you for taking care of us.

title: Dorsett hotel is very nice
desc: The Dorsett hotel is very nice. Conveniant location close to Chinatown and to the subway. There are two minuses, one is the extremely disturbing "music" in the lobby,that is not really music but sounds like someone practising on the piano, the second is the continuous and disturbing clearing of items from the breakfast table, very bothering that things are cleared away that was not yet started on, and also someone coming every couple of minutes to the table. Otherwise the service is very good.

title: Close to China town and the Metro
desc: I booked at this hotel via Singapore airline Singapore stopover holiday programme. The hotel is ideally located for exploring Singapore City, Sentosa, etc. The subway station in just under the hotel and easy access. It is virtually next to Chinatown. Love the food and the atmosphere of Chinatown. The room that I got was not that spacious. The bathroom also was rather small. Wished if they had provided a bottle of water on arrival. But no. Clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful front desk. They store the luggage for you after you check-out if you need. My main disappointment was that they charged my credit card after I left without my authorisation. I had already paid in full for my stay. So, I have no idea why they again charged my credit card especially since they told

title: Family Birthday
desc: Reception prepared birthday surprise for my daughter. Thanks Michelle Jean Jasmine Wanting and Shah. They have gym and swimming pool on level three. It's a convenient location in the city with buffet restaurant.

title: Excellent for a business trip
desc: Hotel location is great, close to business and by chinatown so when done with work you can be in one of the interesting areas of singapore within few minutes. Rooms are Ok, breakfast is good ( opens at 6:30 AM so if you are jet-lagged will have to wait a little bit) Overall a great experience

title: Birthday celebration
desc: Friendly staff ,clean room but small ,good vibes & super convenient it just next to the Outram park LRT, overall value for money .and thanks to the hotel prepare a cake for my wife birthday.enjoy ur stay

title: Good
desc: A good, clean and well staffed hotel located within easy reach of excellent public transport links. I couldn't fault my stay. A short stroll from China town. Safe area. Staff courteous and helpful at all times. Would recommend.

title: Great location an nice rooms
desc: Had a quick one night stay with the Dorsett and was pleased with its convenient location, close to all the China town sights. The rooms were lovely and modern and of a decent size. Would definitely stay again for a convenient and comfortable place to stay.

title: Dorsett Hotel Singapore
desc: Dorsett Hotel Singapore is a mixed hotel and residential building, conveniently located above the Outram Part MRT Station in the fringe of Chinatown. Thus, easy access from Changi Airport via MRT, transfer at Tanah Merah station. Quite a handful of Michelin Bib Gourmands around the hotel within walking distance.

title: Great location, good hotel
desc: 3 night stay at the Dorsett. Great location especially with Outram Park MRT underneath the hotel & on the edge of China town. Warm welcome from staff & quickly resolved an issue with payment (note - take the credit card with you that you booked with!). Really nice room, albeit a bit darkly decorated. Really nice bathroom with double ended bath & separate shower with superb overhead rainfall shower. Rooftop pool area was nice, but is currently opposite a building site & is next to the roadside effectively so not the most peaceful. Didn‚Äôt eat at the hotel so unsure what the food is like. Ultimately very happy with the stay & would return. Was very grateful for the offer of an umbrella to borrow. ‚òîÔ∏è

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location and staff
desc: Centrally located and the MRT in few steps with most attractions close by. Breakfast is very good, so the networking dinner. Staffs are helpful. The only issue was the size of the room and the toilet area.

title: Thumbs Up!
desc: We booked the Dorsett Room at a reasonable price since it was a mid-week day and was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a balcony room. Although the room was small, it was enough space for 2. The location was great because it was easily accessible to Outram MRT, and taxi fare is fairly cheap if you plan to roam the city. The bed was really comfortable but the pillows are too soft for my taste. The pool was nice and not crowded because it‚Äôs a weekday, but the view from the pool was a construction (not the hotel‚Äôs fault though). We weren‚Äôt able to check out the rooftop garden :( The breakfast was not that great, for $23 per person it would be better to walk around i.e. Chinatown for breakfast option. The TV has very minimal choices, so I don‚Äôt think this is a good option for

title: Good established hotel
desc: Pros: 1. Great location, inside central area of Singapore with most attractions close by 2. Good pool 3. MRT station is directly below the hotel and easily accessed 4. Good breakfast 5. Good helpful staff Cons: 1. Room was a little cramped but overall acceptable

title: Fantastic value
desc: I usually stay in 5 star so have to say I was super impressed vs my expectations. Small rooms (fine), love the shower and lovrly, helpful staff. The breakfast was really horrible but doesn't affect my rating.

title: Good choice at a good rate
desc: The hotel is in a good location close to Marina Bay, rooms are clean and they have a modern design, the hotel offers a nice pool with a small gym. Staff is welcoming Good choice for a couple of days discovering the city

title: Great location, pool and very helpful staff
desc: First time in this hotel - very pleasant welcome and upgrade to the room with a bathtub. Room spacious, bed very comfortable and very good quality pillows. It was also excellent that one can decide about the temperature in the room by adjusting it. Have had fantastic dinner in the restaurant, best vermicelli seafood noodle (went repeatedly back and that says something in Singapore). However I believe that breakfast can be so much better for the amount charged compared to other properties. Lack of fruit, yogurt, very little selection of bread varieties was a bit of disappointment. However coffee there was good and pool absolutely fantastic. Would come back again but not pay for the breakfast until further notice.

title: Lovely staff and hotel
desc: I have just returned for a business trip to Singapore. I would like to say that my stay at Dorsett Hotel was a great one. All of the staff were friendly and the hotel itself was lovely. Very clean and well presented. Also very conveniently located next door to MRT station. I would like to say a big thank you to Wilfred in particular.
