This was my first trip alone and I was worried about being on my own in a different country. I felt that Wilfred looked after me and gave me good advise of how best to experience Singapore whilst I was there. Very nice, friendly and hard working man who made me feel very welcome! If i return to Singapore in the future I will be sure to return to Dorsett hotel! :)

title: Great Hotel!
desc: We stayed at Dorsett for 5 days. It was our wedding anniversary so we chose a nice hotel to stay in. We loved it! Good location, clean and elegant. The lobby smelled nice too! The staff are very accommodating! Will surely come back and choose the same hotel. I highly recommend this!

title: Good basic hotel with access to MRT
desc: Good value based hotel located near Chinatown. Room was spacious and reasonably appointed, good gym but the breakfast was very average in selection and quality. The staff were helpful and I would rate this as a solid 4 star offering.

title: Just average
desc: At first we picked this hotel because of its location that is very convinient, close to the subway and the new hip part of China Town area. Walking distance from the Straits Clan and Keong Saik rd. We had awesome breakfast at the legendary Tong Ah. The drawback was they didn't clear the room properly every day, glass was not being washed at all, supply of bath amenities was very limited and the tissue toilet holder position was a bit annoying. Electrical outlet for charging didn't work. Room was loft style and it is tiny. At least the window is big tho so that plenty of natural light. Design of the lobby was quite tacky. All in all, it is just plainly average.

title: 3-night stay in this hotel
desc: I stayed in this hotel with my wife from 4/8/2018 to 7/8/2018. The location of the hotel is very convenience. It is clean and tidy with very polite and helpful staff. They are supportive and understand the needs of clients. As our flight was scheduled to depart at 18:30 from the airport, we asked for late check-out and was granted to leave at 13:00. This helped us to have a half day travel before checked-out without any hurry. The only thing I would like to mention is that there has no socket in the toilet for hair dryer, it was very inconvenience as we could not dry and set the hair with mirror in the toilet. We could only dry the hair near the bed with sockets there.

title: Good hotel in vibrant area
desc: Check in was efficient, we were a few hours early, but they had a room ready. We stayed in both regular and deluxe king rooms. The regular room is quite snug, the deluxe just about right amount of space. Bathroom is small, but has all you need. Pool area is basic, and is severely lacking in chairs and loungers. But if you get one, it's ok. Lots of construction opposite at the moment, ear plugs and music a must. No service of any kind at pool. Wi-Fi good. Didn't have any meals, but restaurant was always busy. But you are moments away from very bustling Chinatown, so plenty of options there! Walking distance to most MRT lines. I think a bit pricey for the room standard, but we enjoyed our stay. Staff are friendly. We did have an issue with a noisy extractor, but it was dealt

title: amazing
desc: only fault when we went to use outdoor swimming on monday nobody informed us they were doing maintenance on it when we ordered towels pool was lovely with jaccuzi at 1 end dining room and food good overall was really nice room was clean and staff on reception really helpful

title: Splash Room
desc: Great location - quick train into downtown for work whilst quick walk to everywhere for food and drinks after work. First time staying in the splash room (enjoyed an upgrade) and appreciated winding in the bath tub after a long day. As always, my preferred hotel.

title: Again a good stay
desc: We visited Dorsett Singapore for the second time for a week. The location, right above Outram Park MRT station is excellent. Check-in and -out went smooth and friendly. Very friendly staff at the A*muse bar. If we have to think of improvements, the only thing was bedlinnen that had holes in them, quite noisy airconditioning and some hairs on the carpet that were longer then ours. But overall recommended!

title: Convenient location and comfortable room
desc: The location is convenient with the Outram Park station right below the hotel. It‚Äôs within walking distance to Chinatown and city centre. It‚Äôs close to Keong Siek Rd. and Duxton Hill. Lots of little cafes, bars and restaurants. Perfect for work and play.

title: A strategic stopover
desc: A very ideal place for a short stopover, it is very strategic, right above the subway station, making it easy to travel. not far from Chinatown shopping center. The hotel is clean with good service, but unfortunately it is too crowded and busy, so it feels a little uncomfortable in the lobby.

title: Good location
desc: Good location with easy access to historic and picturesque Chinatown. However, only one common set of toilets on the ground floor shared by diners of Amuse Dine & Bar and the hotel guests/visitors. Interesting grand piano near the lobby.

title: Good service Good location
desc: Very friendly and helpful staff. My recommended hotel to whoever visits Singapore and looks for a 4-star hotel. Cozy room; convenient location; local restaurants, pubs, hawker center within walking distance.

title: Wonderful staff, great location!
desc: Location was the original reason for the choice, but the staff will bring us back. In particular, Catherine in the dining room and Sheena in housekeeping, really went out of their way to take care of us and make our stay wonderful. -- The bed was very comfortable but the rooms are small. Unfortunately, there was not an outlet in the bathroom for the hairdryer or my curling iron. Very difficult for an older woman to not have the ability to use those items in front of the mirror. I suspect that the hotel was designed more for the younger crowd:) The pool was not open during the ten days I was there. Maintenance needs to happen, but I was very sad that it happened then. I really wanted a place to sit outside but the roof top garden didn't have a single bench or chair. --

title: Amazing location and staff
desc: The good: - Amazing staff (from reception desk to housekeeping) who were all very helpful and always smiling (I've requested for several items over the room phone and they are always very obliging) - Bed is clean / no fraying towels - Internet/Wifi connection doesn't require frequent/daily logins - Literally zero disturbances while having DND sign activated (this is very important! We've had other hotels badgering us to allow for daily housekeeping despite us hanging the DND sign.) - Vending machines at lobby selling everything from sunblock lotion to batteries to snacks to drinks and bottled coffee are life savers (despite being priced slightly higher than normal stores) for night owls like us. The nearest 7-11 require a minimum 5 minutes walk via a shortcut. - Location is

title: Terrible - Not a 4 Star!
desc: The hotel looks great from outside but the rooms are very small. Also my room had issues with the water shower cabinet - where the water was getting clogged. I was ok on day 1 and calmly asked the reception to Ensure this was fixed while I was away for work. Day 2 morning - nothing had been fixed! Day 2 - I shared with the reception again (quite sternly) to get this fixed ! I come back and realise it was not fixed! I am right now waiting (been 15 mins) since I called the reception to immediately send someone! Let‚Äôs see if they even send someone! For 200$ a night - that‚Äôs the service level !

title: Great location, amazing staff, would return
desc: Came for a conference in the cultural precinct. Which was two stops away on the MRT. This hotel is located in China town and so convenient to get around, close to attractions and restaurants. A taxi to some of the main city locations is less than $15 in peak hour. I had a balcony room, overlooking the pond. While I did t ha e much time to enjoy it due to work, it was a lovely element to help relax after the chaos outside. The hotel is quiet, good room size for business travel and a good size desk to work. I would definitely return

title: Dorsett Singapore Hotel Review
desc: For our 10th wedding anniversary, we stayed at Dorsett Singapore. And boy it was such a great decision! We loved everything about the hotel! Our room was cleaned everyday so it smelled great! Fresh set of towels were given too everyday! The hotel's lobby smelled great too! We were given a corner room, so it was really quiet! Loved it! The hotel's location was outstanding! Dorsett Singapore is just above the Outram Park station, and from there, you could literally go anywhere with Singapore's interconnected train station! Harbour Front is one station away which is the gateway to Sentosa island and VivoCity mall! The hotel's swimming pool was great! The water temperature was so enticing, I would've burned under the sun! LOL! We would love to go back here again and we highly

title: Staycay
desc: Bed is comfy - Housekeeping is responsive. Room view with a koi pond. Peace and nice room. Well kept and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lots of food around the hotel area! overall stay was Awesome!

title: 15 days of Stay, As Comfy As Home!
desc: We got sort of things to do in Singapore, so I stayed in this hotel with my friends for about 2 weeks in a row. The hotel facilities are very good, so many delight kind of food for breakfast, clean room, comfortable bed, strategic place because near of MRT Station and affordable price. The receptionist and food lounge staffs are very kind and helpful. I feel so comfortable as comfy as at home. This is one of the best hotel in Sg! I‚Äôm happy has been stayed there for a long time periode.

title: You get what you've paid for
desc: Stayed in the Dorsett room for four nights while I was doing a training (Stayed in another hotel when my friend came) Pros: - Conveniently located close to outram park station (which is one station away from Harbourfront station, the mall that you can take connecting train / Use the walkbridge to get to Sentosa); Maxwell food centre is just ~10 minutes walk from the hotel! - Shower is good - Bed is comfy - Housekeeping is responsive (the hairdryer wasn't working well so I left a written note and they change another one the next day); give enough bottles of water Reminder: it's close to MRT station but if you are taking the train from airport, do expect a bit of walk (~5 min) inside the station since Ourtram park is a relatively big station. The platform you got off is not

title: Convenient
desc: The location is ideal. 5 min walk to the china town and 10 min walk to Clarke quay. An MRT station is right next to the hotel. Hotel staff is helpful and hotel is lovely except the room we stayed in has to be by far the smallest one I have ever seen. By saying that we got a good deal so maybe rooms that are on special are small and the other ones might be bigger. We didn‚Äôt stay at the hotel much as our itinerary was quite full so it worked ok for us.

title: No regret
desc: This is my return trip to the hotel because of the room and location that quite convenient. I would like to thank you in person to Ms.Jean (front the tag) at the lobby front desk who checked me in and out. She was professional and up to task in order to fulfill my request and never fail a single thing. I really appreciated it that she could remember and welcomed me back for my return. Keep up all the fantastic work and i will be sure to come back in no time. Thanks again.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
desc: This is my first time staying in this hotel but how I was blown away by the experience. The hotel room was very clean, well maintained. I am quite surprised as this hotel although looking very new has been around a few years and it's easy for a room quality to depreciate. It is obvious that the hotel management and staff takes very great pride in taking good care of their hotel and reputation. The hotel is very close to the National heart centre and Singapore General Hospital. As I was covering for an event there, this hotel is conveniently located just opposite the road 10mins walking distance away. The city centre is located about 10 minutes train or bus ride away. There are plenty of nice food options around this area since the hotel is situated near Telok Ayer/Chinatown

title: Great location, comfy bed, amazing service
desc: I stayed at Dorsett Singapore while attending a trade show. It was my first time staying at the hotel and I was not disappointed. My room was immaculate, the staff extremely professional, and the location was very close to Chinatown and the trendiest part of town, and the MRT station was around 50m away from the hotel. I was very happy with my stay, and would definitely be back!

title: A Curates Egg!
desc: The front of house staff were outstanding and a particular mention to the colleague called Jasmine who went over an above the call of duts to make the stay comfortable. Spotlessly clean rooms and a comfortable bed - albeit a little small by normal standards. One odd space saving design was to have the wardrobe as a part of the bathroom - maybe this was an innovation that turned the bathroom into a walk in wardrobe? The dining facilities were outsourced and not at the same standard as the hotel or the same standard as the usual food offering in Singapore. DSo whilst the Hotel accommodation was more than acceptable the dining facilities spoiled the whole thing for me.

title: Comfortable Hotel
desc: Last month stayed for a family holiday for four nights. team at the reception was quiet professional they gave us an early check in and an upgrade as we were with our 5yrs old daughter. rooms are small but very functional. location wise nice and well connected to MRT. enjoyed our stay.

title: Business/conferance visit to Singapore
desc: Great hotel.Good ambience.Helpful staff.Good traveller facilities.Centrally located with nearby shopping facilities.It was very near to Singapore general hospital where the conferance was held.My trip went very smoothly.Thanks

title: Friendly staff, good pool and gym, good location
desc: 4 day stay, generally very good experience, room was comfortable, gym and pool were great, staff were friendly, 10 minute walk from my meetings, lots of cafes 2 minutes walk away; they lost 1 star because the breakfast was far too crowded (a big tour group was there) and the offerings were not very enticing. But otherwise a v good hotel for this location and price point.

title: Good location and beds, bad service and food
desc: I‚Äôve just completed a 7 night stay at this hotel. The positives; Lovely comfortable beds. Excellent location. Good pool area. Room spotless, good maid service. The negatives; Poor service; had to wait ages to be seated in the restaurant, the server was either chatting or on his phone! Tried to have room service but the restaurant although meant to stay open to 10pm was closed before 9pm. No drink service at the pool. Staff were aloof and not attentive. Restaurant; We ordered chicken skewers my daughter ate half then asked if the chicken was ok as it tasted funny. I tried it it was cold and raw inside so told her not to eat anymore, the waiter wasn‚Äôt around as he‚Äôd already asked us to sign for the meal and left. My daughter was ill within the hour and sick all night, I

title: Excellent Customer Service
desc: Singapore was our relaxation stop after backpacking through Sumatra & so happy we stayed at the Dorsett. Getting there is extremely easy on the MRT from the airport & there is lift access from the underground. When we arrived we were upgraded to the Splash room, which gives you a larger ensuite & bath tub. The bed is extremely comfy, the rain head shower just awesome & the room overall fantastic. The staff are extremely friendly & hotel location for us was perfect. We wanted to be close to Chinatown & could walk there in minutes. The Outram Park MRT station is basically at your doorstep & makes getting around easy. Fantastic hotel & staff, we will be back & highly recommend.

title: Great place to stay
desc: We found the Dorsett an excellent place to stay. Very simple to catch the MRT straight from the airport and they are located adjacent to a MRT station. Short walk to Chinatown. They have good sized rooms and a nice swimming pool.

title: Dorsett did NOT disappoint !
desc: We spent 4 days at the Dorsett, choosing to break away from the chains such as Sofotel, Ibis, Crown but still wanting the Mc-Luxury of knowing what we are getting, you know that no surprises, uninterrupted comfort that comes with a solid hotel brand - where we are paying so we don‚Äôt have to think about (or demand) it. Our regular readers know we are well travelled and just as happy sleeping on a beach in Cuba as we are in a 5 star hotel in NYC. We chose Dorsett as we had never stayed at a Chinese hotel chain - how would it stack up? Also we specifically chose for location and that was to be right in the thick of Chinatown. Dorsett did NOT disappoint and in fact it is very difficult to find something we don‚Äôt like, we would be really fussy and have to think about it (and as

title: Impressive service n good location
desc: Was here for staycation for a day and I it did left a good impression to be back coz of the welcoming feel by the staff and nice n clean hotel room environment . Only disappointment was choosing the loft room , the bed design . The edge of the bed facing the window is easy to drop things below and I‚Äôm quite certain It dropped it there but I can‚Äôt find my necklace afterwards . Cal the hotel to check after check out but can‚Äôt be found stil . Will come back but choose other room next time .

title: Great stay - would recommend
desc: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the beginning and end of a 3 week holiday to Vietnam. Good location - NEXT to tube station! The tube system was super easy and we used the tube to get from and to the airport - only 1 easy change (platform opposite) and cheap, would recommend doing this. When we arrived we were knackered and the receptionists and bell boy were so kind and welcoming and sorted out an early check in. We didn‚Äôt have breakfast as seemed expensive. Late check out kindly arranged for us also. Easy tube journeys to Clarke quay and other places. The reason why we give 5 stars is because the hotel offer a ‚Äòhandy phone‚Äô for free in every room - gives you good deals on trips and 4g hotspot for you to use when out and about. Overall lovely staff, nice rooms, good location

title: Decent business hotel near China Town
desc: Lovely hotel near the China town (walking distance). Staffs were very nice & attentive. Room is pretty small, bed was comfy although I did not try other pillow options. Bathroom & shower is very small which could cause some problem for the big people. TV is ok but not many good cable channels. Pool is ok but it will need some renovation soon. Gym is quite good with some very cool equipments. The disappointed thing I found at this hotel was its breakfast. Only has some choices and the foods were not very attractive at all. I should give 2/5 for its breakfast. The handy phone is no longer available at this hotel.

title: Best location to access the MRT and free room upgrade
desc: Originally, we have booked a Dorsett room and the hotel upgrade us to a Splash room that includes a bathtub and a king sized bed. We are totally thankful to the hotel for this initiative. The comfort of the bed provides us with the much sought for good sleep over the weekend. The hotel has a direct access to the linkway to Outram Park metro system that makes travelling around the city centre easy and sheltered from the frequent rainy days of Singapore. The hotel is surrounded by chic bars and eateries along Teo Hong Rd, Keong Saik Rd and Duxton Plain park. Also it is walking distance to Chinatown.

title: Good location hotel
desc: I didnt know how many times staying at this hotel. I guess it becomes my fav hotel while having a business trip to Singapore since the location near to my office. There is no difference since my first time stayed here. Except they had new vending machine in the lobby. I wish they made new improvement eg carpet changing or additional inside room property. Otherwise many regular customer will move to another brand new hotel or airbnb. wish they allowed me for late check out because the last time they didnt allowed me

title: jacuzzi not functional room too small
desc: room really cramp though its 4 star hotel and cant expect too much for the price. bfast passable for the pricing. only gd thing near mrt station i guess. the part timers at the bfast rresto area v helpful and friendly

title: Would come back
desc: Upon arrival was told that rooms booked, adjoining, were not available but had 2 rooms on the same level - no big deal as kids are teenagers now. Staff were very apologetic and offered us complimentary breakfast for our stay. Hotel rooms clean and with everything you need. Central to Chinatown and right next door to the MRT. Very easy location to get anywhere in Singapore. Pool on level 3 was great but the deck needs work which is being completed shortly. Pool breaks up the day from being out and about to a relaxing session before dinner. Would definitely be back at this hotel next time we stop over in Singapore.

title: Great location
desc: Although the room was small, everything else about the hotel was good. Easy walk to Chinatown. Handy to the train. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean. Would stay again when visiting Singapore.

title: Professional Hospitality
desc: My stay was one week as official attending for seminar. Very easy access by either way from new bridge road or sub way and there is a separate door from metro station.Their front line job is excellent and professional and all gents and girls are so helpful. Room facilities and service are up to high standard level. breakfast in restaurant is nice and you are so welcome for it. Though room are somewhat small you can have comfortable stay.What I noticed the negative thing is abnormally established wash room.

title: good and pocket friendly choice
desc: Very convenient located right on top of MRT. Chinatown with all it charms directly around the corner. Rooms are just spacious enough, but fully stuffed with all amenitie one might need. Furnishing is comfy but slightly dated. An extra PLUS for the super friendly staff. .

title: GREAT STAY
desc: I booked the Dorsett as to its closeness to the city and Chinatown The room though smallish was beautifully appointed and had a great Singapore skyline view Was fantastic to have a good 2 meter pool to get some laps in Breakfasts were great with a wide range of foods to suit all tastes and cultures Big thanks to Michelle for her patience at reception for making sure i had a comfortable balcony room which was appreciated and Jasmine who headed me in the right direction for museums and shopping with taking the time to find addresses for me My only criticism which i find in many hotels is the lack of real milk in the mini bar for tea as powered creamer just doesnt cut it Thank you all i enjoyed my time at the Dorsett and am sure to stay again when in Singapore in future

title: very nice stay we will be back
desc: lovely room good room service very good price views from hotel were incredible and was directlly above the mrt professional desk staff the only negative thing was the hotel restaurant having just buffet breakfast

title: Chinatown with a Touch of Class
desc: The third time I have stayed in this Hotel which I like because it is only a short walk from Chinatown and my favourite Restaurants and Market Stalls and Shops ... The whole area is so much nicer, quieter and Friendlier than uptown near Orchard Road and eating out is half the price ! The Dorsett is relatively modern and in good condition with clean and well presented rooms and a well priced Breakfast but avoid the crush at 8-9am for sure. Give the Hotel a try next time and if you have not experienced Chinatown in recent years then you will be pleasantly surprised at the upgrade !

title: Good location
desc: This hotel is located just next to Outram Park MRT Station and its directly accessible from Changi airport. It's also one station away to Chinatown or alternatively if you wish to walk to Chinatown its only a short stroll there.

title: A Good Location
desc: The hotel allowed us very early check in which was much appreciated. The desk staff were friendly and professional. The rooms were small but adequately furnished. The TV channel selection could be improved. The pool was nice.

title: annual visit to Singapore
desc: Reception good friendly staff, spotless, shiny interior. The room was badly designed. Tiny bathroom, tinier wardrobe, had to live out of the suitcase. The large bed was too soft & after 3 nights became uncomfortable. Phone not working. Very poor room service menu. Buffet breakfast only ordinary, rubber fried eggs, sloppy scrambled eggs, the worst selection of Asian foods I have ever seen. The lobby had 3 vending machines with a choice of several stale chips, chocolate etc. The best thing about the hotel was it's lift to the MRT. & a bus stop nearby. I won't be using this hotel next time..

title: Good price and service. No service at the swimming pool
desc: The only negative thing is the swimming pool. While it is long and nice there surroundings need to be renovated. There are in addition no service/towels easily available there. Good thing you get the evening sun on it.

title: 2.5 star hotel in 4 star location
desc: It's ok. Maybe a B or B-. It's showing a lot of age. Carpet and room furniture should have been upgraded by now. Bathroom floors have too much film and a tad bit too much mold. The location is great, staff is nice and bed is very good. But other than that, I get a seedy vibe because it's so old.

title: Excellent Staff and Location
desc: I was in the hotel until today, the staff very polite, the breakfast was the best, the location have the private lift to go to train station, very modern, and I forgot my cardholder in the room and the hotel sent me message

title: Good location
desc: The Dorsett is well located: near Chinatown and the Metro station. On arrival a male employee approached us - we thought - to help us with our luggage. Bummer! He just spoke to the taxi driver - no help offered whatsoever. Check in was okay, as was the room. The pool was kind of cold. Breakfast: we have had better buffets in lower classified hotels. On check out we had some help with our luggage - as you may expect for a hotel of this category. So in total a mediocre experience.

title: Average comfort
desc: As its a busy month i opted Dorsett for my stay, i feel there are limited staffs. we have get iur own taxis most of the time unless we call helpers. The pillow covers were not washed properly, had to ask for a change. In terms of locality for business visit its ok but tourist not an ideal spot. Interesting part is i paid 70% of hotel rent when i checkin & said rest will be paid a day before i vacate. But these fellows disabled my room key access card in just 3 days, when i rushed to reception i got a wonderful response. I paid rest of the rent & got access back. Bad experience with this hotel. Hotel Mng can take this comment in positive note & improve.

title: Classy and comfortable hotel
desc: Overall experience is positive. Nearby Chinatown, lots of good food and shopping. Room size is small cannot have too large luggages. WiFi is excellent. Staff were helpful and welcoming. We did not have any meals there.

title: Conveniently located
desc: The Dorsett is very conveniently located. Whether on official or personal trip, in the evening you can step out for a walk to nearby Chinatown for dinner or a drink. The young hotel staff in the reception are friendly and cheerful but I wish the older staff at the restaurant where as cheerful as their younger colleagues. Breakfast at the hotel is functional and the menu is basic. Dorsett is fine for short stays.!

title: VERY GOOD HOTEL
desc: We were there from 25-30th March, 2018. First I chose a family loft room, which was not comfortable and suited for us. On demand, they changed the room in a Deluxe room with extra bed without any charge. I had opted the loft room of Rs.13000/- per night. Deluxe room was of Rs.9000/- per night. In lieu of this, they offered a complimentary breakfast for us till our check out. Hotel location is very good and nearby to OUTRAM PARK Metro Station. Hotel is located at Chinatown. The hotel staff was very good especially Ms. Aishah & Ms. Angelia who were well supported throughout our whole stay. The hotel is half an hour drive away from Changi Airport with nominal fare i.e. 20 Singapore Dollar.

title: Great location!
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Fantastic location in Chinatown and the hotel has its own access to the MRT. Our room was smaller than I thought it would be but still plenty big enough for the 2 of us. We had dinner here on our last night and it was very nice. I would certainly recommend and would also stay here again.

title: Strategic Location, Warm Hospitality
desc: Really appreciated the warm hospitality of the staff. The front office receptionist, Ann, is really polite and helpful. The room itself is nice, well maintained and designed with a practicality in mind. What's even best, hotel is really strategically located on top of Outram MRT: so rain would not resulted in you being stranded. Walking distance to Chinatown Food Street as well, so you can rest assured to have Singapore's delicacy within your reach!

title: It is what it is
desc: Take no notice of the TV screen at the entry of the restaurant this is fictitious and certainly not that good. The staff are helpful and obliging but the outdoor garden is just astroturf and no seating. But worst is the piano in the lobby it .is painful just playing random notes is painful

title: Singapore Getaway @Dorsett
desc: This was an awesome place to stay while you are staying for a short visit to Singapore. Just above MRT Outram Park Station so this is conveniently located as its close to almost every attraction in Singapore. Room was spotless and very clean. The swimming pool was amazing as it has the most pristine water which tempt you to swim everytime you look at it. The room and hotel corridorr were soundproof since you will not hear anything from nearby activities (there was a construction works accross the road during our stay between 20 - 22 Apr 2018 and our room was located next to elevator) which made your sleep nice and comfy. Definitely reccomend the hotel to friends and will come back again.

title: Nicely done
desc: - Beautiful hotel with lovely staff - Unique interior d√©cor without being pretentious - Excellent location--handy to trendy bars and caf√©s/restaurants but also Chinatown, downtown, and MRT - Slightly on the pricey side but worth it

title: Better for Short Stays
desc: The Dorsett has a direct connection to Outram Park MRT, which certainly makes it convenient for transport. There is a bus stop just in front of the hotel. The rooms are quite small though not unexpected in Singapore particularly at this price point. I stayed for nearly 2 weeks on a business trip and towards the end I was beginning to feel cramped in that space. I was quite disappointed with the WiFi as I had high expectations given Singapore's well connected reputation. The 4G connection from the Handyphone provided was much faster. The breakfast spread did not vary much over the course of my stay so towards the end I explored options outside. Since Chinatown is a short walk away, then it was not a problem. I would stay here more for a leisure trip or a short business trip but

title: Convenient location
desc: Booked a room for staycation to celebrate my friend's birthday. Staff is fast in responding to email queries and hotel is situated at a very good location - close to MRT and alot of food at chinatown. Good view as oversee the shophouses. Was upgraded to deluxe room but room was not as big as I expected. Bathroom area is relatively small and compact. Only thing that wow me is the doorbell in the shape of camera which makes it pretty different from most hotels.

title: A very pleasant return
desc: I last stayed at the Dorsett a year or so ago and was not much impressed. HOWEVER, things have turned around amazingly. I was most impressed on this visit. I returned for the convenience of access not for memories. I do not know how the change came about. I only know that I found the hotel on this occasion delightful. The most startling change to me was the competence, friendliness and helpfulness of the desk staff. Very impressive - and particularly Reuben who was a mine of information and helpfulness, none of which was too much trouble for him. Congratulations. The room I occupied, 330, was excellent. Everything spotlessly clean. The pillows, often the weakest point of hotel bedooms, were great as was the mattress. 'Just right!" I can't say I'd give the architect

title: Terribly disappointing!
desc: Booked a 'luxurious Secret Escape' at 50% off, and what a terrible mistake I made. The hote's 4 star rating is a joke, and an insult to Singapore's hospitality industry. The first room I was assigned was too small to swing a cat, and had to pay for an upgrade to a larger room, which wasn't much better. The mini bar was inadequately stocked (2 soft drinks and 3 beers), there was no room service after 8:30 pm, the breakfast was pretty ordinary, half the lobby was a 'left luggage' faculty, vending machines in the lobby, - DEFINITELY NOT a 'luxurious' experience. Whose idea of a joke was this?

title: They call this 4 star?
desc: This is the worst 4 star hotel I have ever stayed at. The lobby smells great but as soon as you get to the other floors it has a strong musty almost moldy smell. The first room we got had blood on the carpet and ripped bed sheets. All the furniture was chipped and needs an update. When we reported this at reception it took them 15 mins to get us an upgraded room on another floor as we sat in the lobby waiting. This floor also smelled like mold and you could smell it as soon as you stepped out of the elevator. On the day we left we requested a late check out, the front desk said they would call me back. We've done this at plenty of other places and would get a straight yes or no. And of course after half an hr no one called back and we had to call again with the same request.

title: Every thing is ok
desc: I was in dorsett hotel for 5 night from 23 of feb.the first thing is good location and u can easily acess to MRT ( metro). U can go by walk to china town in 10 min and if u want to go sentosa just one station to habour front.the cleaness is very good .the break fast is accept able.

title: Great Location
desc: I am the type of person who will choose to stay in a budget hotel instead of business hotel. Turns out i am kind of addicted to stay in this type of hotel. Well not every business hotel will offer the something like this hotel did but overall i had a great stay here. The room was pretty spacious, pretty quiet. I have a good rest here since i already walk around the city all day. One of dissapointment only on breakfast. I ordered an omelette for 2 times to a middle aged lady and she forgot to make my egg. I am not sure that it was that busy, but i don't expect to ask it twice yet i was still not getting my order. But this hotel had a great location, just 5 minutes walk from the mrt station. Will come back again for sure :)

title: Singapore Dorsett - okay
desc: The Dorsett in Singapore - quite a nice hotel - nice lobby - dining area a bit like a cafeteria. The staff were lovely and the bellhop (?) was extremely helpful. Rooms were very nice except for the bathroom! The layout was a bit weird with this sliding door that didn't close off all the way so privacy was a big issue for me. The toilet seat seemed too small for the porcelain and moved a lot so we were a bit apprehensive sitting on it - waiting for the pinch! Also there were black hairs and fluff (?) along the wall in the toilet and there was mould in the shower. Beds were comfy which was great. I thought breakfast charge (which ended up about $48.00 AUD for two of us) was a bit high but the meal itself was okay. Our flight from Paris got in at 6.30 am. We were tired, felt

title: Has everything you need
desc: The hotel is small overall and rooms are small, however it has all the amenities you require, the staff are excellent and always help to assist. The air con is brilliant and the rooms are very clean. The restaurant and bar are nice. The hotel has a gym and an outside pool. The location is 2 stops away from raffles place the main business district 5 mins away and marina bay sands is 10 mins. The hotel is situated above the mrt (tube) and only a short walk to the vibrant China town.

title: Five stars room and services
desc: Great hotel, enjoyed my stay here. There are a lot of bars or restaurants located next to the hotel, in those nicely maintained colonial shop houses building. Chinatown is just a stone throw away too. It's never a problem walking in Singapore, because they have a lot of trees and thus it doesn't feel so hot. Metro is just below the hotel, making it extremely convenient.

title: Great location but not suitable for family stay
desc: We had our staycation at this hotel as we had a free night stay from one of the credit card company. The location was great but the room is superly small. We had requested for an extra bed and initially wanted to upgrade to balcony room. However was told if we want to add an extra bed then balcony room cannot fit so we just stayed in the deluxe room which we barely had space for walking. As with other reviews the bathroom design it is indeed not ideal. In addition, there is a hole design on the door so imagine if we were there to stay with a friend or colleague it will be so inconvenient. We also paid for the breakfast in the hotel and was disappointed. Spread was not good and clearly shorthanded as the table was not clean. The swimming pool is shared with the residence and

title: Good location but small room
desc: Stayed with a friend in Jan 2018. Location very convenient, it‚Äôs just on top of the Outram Park MRT station with its own exit. It‚Äôs also walkable distance to Chinatown. Lobby is quite cosy and room generally clean. However the room quite small and the design of toilet is like some reviewer mentioned before, it‚Äôs quite strange. The mirror of toilet is on the door of the wardrobe and the door of the wardrobe is a part of the wall of the toilet. Which if we slide the door and close the wardrobe, there‚Äôs no mirror in the toilet. The toilet is not a totally enclosed space. It‚Äôs ok as I was traveling with a very close friend but even so, It was quite awkward as the one inside the room can able to hear all the sound the one in the bathroom made. Really hope that the hotel can change

title: Great stay
desc: My partner and I stayed here while on a Malaysian/Singapore road trip. Location good. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Check in was quick. Rooms spacious and bathroom was spotless. Would recommend to family and friends when visiting Singapore.

title: Not worth the price.
desc: I have stayed in a few Singapore hotels so I feel I know what to expect.To try and make it short. The front desk staff is not good (Excluding the bell hops). Defiantly not professional when comparing to other local 4 stars(many errors). As well the rooms are smaller than average. I feel your paying for 3 star hotel at 4 star prices. Yes the location being above the MTR is good. Never tried the breakfast but many people saying its terrible.

title: Visted Hotel for a drink, we did not stay but they deserve 100 marks for their service oriented attitude
desc: We did not stay in the hotel but was there for a drink but what greeted our short visit was simply the amazing attitude that prompted me to write this review. We were greeted by a young gentlemen who offer to help me push one of the wheelchair to my mum who needed to use the washroom while I was helping my dad with the other wheelchair... he even request us not to wait in the front door but to wait in the lobby which was cooler and even ask whether my dad needed water... for a young gentlement to be so caring, such attitude is missing from many today. Next while waiting for our driver to arrive, another young lady Jasmine brought a stool from the front desk for my aging mum without us requesting for it and the front office manager Michelle even help us to hail a taxi as the 1st

title: Strategically located
desc: Check in was quick and polite at 11pm. Room is clean with basic amenities. Location is good, just outside Outram MRT station and behind Chinatown area with lots of eateries nearby. Breakfast spread not too bad as well. Would stay here again.

title: Good hotel but...
desc: Everything about the hotel is great. Except for the design of the bathroom (after comparing notes with my colleagues, I find that this is dependent on the floor). The room I got on the high floor, the door to the shower opens outwards into the small bathroom walkway - it means to get out from the shower, you would really have to step dripping into the room before closing the shower door and walking back into bathroom area/sink. Wherever you put the floor towel, you will have to shuffle it back in place after entering or exiting. And not too convenient if you have guest in the room. Should have used a sliding door and solve the problem. *They do have a fantastic iron provided in room that is better than most that I have used.

title: Chinese New Year visit to Singapore.
desc: Came back to the Dorsett for Chinese New Year, checking out of room 819 20th Feb after six days,. Had a really good stay, friendly staff at all levels - always very helpful. This time I booked a Dorsett deluxe suite which is quite a bit larger than the Dorsett Room which I normally book. The Deluxe is ideal for two people, mind you I do prefer the bathroom configuration of the Dorsett room. The deluxe room was comfortable and I had good sleep each night. The attached A*muse restaurant had a special Chinese New Year menu, I invited a my local friend and his family to join me on 15th Feb for the Reunion Buffet - it was excellent. it also has great breakfasts - the food range surprises. Thanks to Peter Chua and Harols (A*muse) for another good stay. Might just come back

title: Close to mrt
desc: Stayed at this hotel in December for 4 nights to experience thee xmas lights on Orchard road MRT at hotel doorstep making it very easy to get around Singapore on the trains Close to Chinatown and eating establishments and room ok size for Singapore standards and buffet breakfast was adequate but not great Have stayed at better hotels in Singapore but you get what you pay for but all in all not bad

title: Great location but compact rooms
desc: The hotel is located near a train station so very convenient to get around. There was tea making facility but we had to use the bedside socket to boil the kettle. We did not have the expensive breakfast in hotel as it is in Chinatown so lots of restaurants nearby. At the moment there are lots of decorations and sales for Chinese New Year. We had a twin room which was very compact. The bathroom was a weird design with restricted movement. There was no bath but only shower which was fine as we dont use bath during holidays. The glass door is used for both the shower and toilet. The wardrobe slide door which shuts the bathroom leaves a gap so really the bathroom didn't close completely. The toiletries and tea bags were not replenished on a daily basis. There was no doorman at the

title: great hotel!
desc: thanks for making us feel welcome. We enjoyed our 3 night stay and it was a convenient location for our purposes. Its a short walk from Chinatown and right next to Outram MRT, making it very easy to get around. thanks again!

title: Good compromise
desc: Good location in the city center Direct metro station even to go to airport Room comfortable Breakfast to be improved, quality of food proposed not really tasted Service ok Difficult to negotiate late check out

title: convenient
desc: the location is the best about this hotel, next to the outram park mrt stn, even it has it own access from mrt to the hotel. only about 400-500m to chinatown where there are lots of awesome foods.Besides it nothing interesting around the hotel the room is quite spacious compare to other average hotels in Sin with the cute designüòâ the con about this hotel is the position of the toilet paper next to the closet is not convenient

title: Caring staff, great location!
desc: Stayed for 3 weeks on a business trip. The location is super convenient. You can get to the Outram park station by elevator through the hotel. You'd also be a 7 minute walking distance from the Chinatown food street and a 20 minute walk to the Downtown business district. Check in is very efficient. I thought their breakfast spread was really good and fresh, having been not so impressed at some of the other hotels I've stayed at in Singapore. During my last week, I caught a fever and couldn't walk out. The receptionist kindly offered to have some food sent up. They also sent me some fruit and a Get Well card, which I thought was really sweet. Only thing I'd ask to be improved is that vacuuming of the room be done more frequently. Would definitely stay with them again!

title: Right above MRT station
desc: This hotel is located right above the outram park MRT station. There is even an elevator at the MRT station that goes right to the hotel. The room is small and simple, bathroom a bit small for my liking (not much space to store my toiletries). Walking distance to Chinatown. There are a few nice cafes near the hotel. Overall for me, the only selling point of this hotel is the location, good for solo travellers like me as it is so convenient to travel anywhere using the MRT. There is not much do at the surrounding area, need to travel out or walk 10-15 minutes to Chinatown for good food. Food at the hotel restaurant is average. Good hotel for a short stay in Singapore.

title: Good location average rooms.
desc: Located in Chinatown with the MRT next door this hotel is one stop from Harbourfront Station with its high quality shopping centre and perhaps more importantly the gateway to Sentosa Island. The hotel was good value for the price we paid through booking.com but would not be good value if booked directly with the hotel. The room was average. It was 2 levels with the bed located upstairs in what could only be described as an internal balcony which only fitted the bed. Interesting, but I am still unsure of the practicality of the configuration suffice to say that one person could go to sleep whilst the other person could watch the tv downstairs. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. Overall being such a good location would probably make me consider staying at

title: Nice, clean, big rooms
desc: We stayed 3 times in Dorsett. Always a good experience. Quiet and big rooms, especially for Singapore. Price/quality ratio is great. It is close to Chinatown, has lots of nice restaurants around and the metro is just next door. Highly recommended.

title: Quiet and well equipped.
desc: My room was very comfortable, quiet and spacious with a koi pond as the view from my window. Plenty of storage provided and a large shower with good water pressure. An added bonus was the provision of an Android mobile phone with unlimited local talk and text that could be used as a hot spot for my iPhone. This made it so much easier to get around using google for maps and information. Right in the heart of Chinatown and walking distance to Clarke‚Äôs quay and other tourist spots and a short cab ride to Sentosa island. My room had a few dirty marks on the carpet and some of the glasses weren‚Äôt the cleanest at times but bottled water was supplied each day. I would stay here again. Great value for money.

title: Almost perfect
desc: Another fabulous stay here. Firstly, didn‚Äôt have the breakfast here (ate at the hawker centres) or swim in the pool (rained most days). One criticism was the hot water in the bathroom sink wasn‚Äôt very hot. Checkin with the staff was so efficient. May was terrific. The room was really spacious and spotlessly clean. The location is really good for getting the MRT everywhere (one stop to Sentosa). Do yourself a favour and get the travel card not the 6 use ticket. The latter is double the price at least per trip. Taxis are okay but we also used Grab cars. Uber was more expensive than Grab. We used the MRT to get to Sentosa, Little India, Suntec shopping mall and Old Airport Hawker Centre to name a few. That‚Äôs why Dorsett is just great. Overall, the location, super friendly staff and

title: Nice hotel
desc: Booked this hotel for my friend recently, a cozy, comfortable & accessible hotel since is near to the MRT station. Highly recommend. Though room are small it has a fridge, makeup area and a good size bathroom. Is near to eateries like Chinatown and behind this hotel, many F&B place.

title: great location
desc: Literally on the MRT station, so there is no problem about travelling. One stop from china town or you can walk there. The room was fine and peaceful, staffs are helpful. The price was affordable and worth with quality

title: One of the best room design hotels we have stayed!
desc: Love the brilliant interior design of the room, though the room is small but everything fits well in their cabinets with hair dryer, iron&ironing board, safe, bedroom slippers. We love the fact it's near a Metro station and near Chinatown which we had a good breakfast on the Sunday before our checkout. Each room has a phone with a hotspot which we could use when we were outside the hotel premise. We did however had a small incident with the coffee drawer and reported it to avoid future accidents, other than that, we were happy during our 4 days stay.

title: Nice hotel
desc: I stayed at the Dorsett for 4 nights and I can recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel that is comfortable and is in a good location. Rooms are clean staff are very pleasant, food is good, and you can get a late check out if you ask. Being next to Outram Park subway station is a great bonus, also the bus stops right outside the hotel. Would recommend to anyone looking for a comfortable place to bed down when in Singapore.

title: Great and convenient !
desc: First time staying with Dorsett and it was wonderful. Really convenient location, MRT station Outram Park. About 30 - 40 minutes away from Changi airport by MRT. Easy walking distance to Chinatown and the Handy Phone which was really useful. Loved the comfortable soft pillows for a good night's rest.

title: Great Pool and Good Location Near Chinatown
desc: This was a very clean hotel in a great location next to the Outram Park subway stop. The breakfast has good variety with European and Asian selections. The area is safe and clean. I liked the pool and workout facilities. A smart phone is provided with free calls to the UK and North America. The reception desk staff speaks excellent English and is extremely helpful.

title: Convenient, Serene Hotel
desc: Hotel is very clean, located at the corner of big streets, has own lift/elevator to Outram MRT Station, 5 minute walk to Chinatown. Staff is very friendly. Restaurants in hotel and walking distance. Public buses have stop/station nearby hotel....

title: Always a warm welcome - another good stay
desc: Checked out of room 915 yesterday morning after a seven day visit - I think it was my twelfth stay - I guess the friendliness of all staff makes a good point of difference. Reception staff are efficient and always ready to help - enjoyed a catch up with the Director Rooms - the Dorsett group is expanding int3ernationally with a Perth location being planned. Stayed in a Dorsett room - just right for me...very clean - comfy beds - quiet from the main road and construction across the road. The new A*muse Dine & Bar provides a wide range of meals from breakfast, lunch and dinner. Had breakfast each morning - the breakfast buffer is much improved from the old restaurant - what suprised me was the improved decor - bright lighting- many more people in for lunch and dinner each

title: Bright, airy & conveniently located
desc: The hotel has direct access from the Outram Park MRT station, which is very convenient. Rooms are spacious, airy, clean & have that handy smartphone with which you can stay in touch with family & also use it as a convenient map while out & about. Staff is helpful & friendly.

title: Lovely and welcoming
desc: We really enjoyed our stay at Dorsett hotel. Everything from the welcoming and friendly staff to the nice and clean room. It was close enough to some shopping areas and only a short taxi ride to the Marina Bay Area and Orchard Road.

title: Convenient location
desc: We chose this hotel because of its location. It is right above Outram Park MRT station, and 10-15 min walk to Chinatown and various restaurants nearby. A cell phone (with data) is charged in the room for you to bring along while you walk around the city. Super useful! The room was compact, cleanliness can be improved as we saw dead flies in the bathroom, and the lid of the toilet was cracked. There was also a slight foul smell in our room but since we were extremely tired and only staying a night and spending most of the time out of the hotel, we lived with it. Overall good place for short stay and convenient location.

title: Cozy & Excellent Family Staycation
desc: We are a family of 3 and stayed in their Loft room, which was clean and came with all the necessary toiletries (with nice design n color scheme on them). We enjoyed the Loft experience, with a nice king size bed on the upper floor and you can request to have a sofra bed on the lower floor. This is useful especially good for family with kids or young teens. The location of this Dorsett Hotel is very good, right at the Outram Park MRT, hence you can get around Singapore easily. Being Singaporeans ourselves, we enjoyed the experience of walking around to explore the surroundings, like the old Chinatown area, Telok Ayer and even walking to Tanjong Pagar area, seeing the old parts and business districts, enjoying the vast varieties of good food and shopping. The staffs are

title: Good little hotel
desc: Rooms are nice. Quite small but good enough and king size beds are super comfy. Noise was really minimal which was surprising considering it‚Äôs on a busy street. Girls at reception were always super nice as well. Pool area is quite large - gym is pretty average but standard for a hotel.

title: Compact and convenient
desc: Best thing about this hotel is the location which is above the Outram Park MRT train station which is so convenience to travel from one place to another and the free cell phone to be used during the entire stay. Booked a connecting rooms. They are clean but small. No complain as most of time we are out. Staffs very helpful. Good place to stay.

title: Recommended!
desc: + long swimming pool (towels would be nice though) + clean, well built and well maintained hotel; everything functions + friendly, efficient and helpful staff (particularly the lady from the reception, Felicia or similar, who types, smiles and answers questions of 6 of us simultaneously) + location, if you want to explore Chinatown, Clark Quay, financial district or even Marina Bay - lack of ‚Äòcharacter‚Äô and charm

title: Staycation worth mentioning
desc: Nice pool, comfortable bed, cool room... Room Service is tops as well. Good for travelers with a slightly bigger budget. Its a boutique hotel with a touch of class. Friendly staffs and accessible location to public transport

title: Nice hotel
desc: Stayed there for 4 nights in nov 17. Fast and efficient check in and out. Very helpful and friendly staff! Rooms are average, on the smaller side, nice and comfy bed. Clean room and very swift tidying while we were eating breakfast. Convienient location as it is on top of the outram MRT station.

title: Great Staycation!
desc: My fiancee and I came here for our staycation to celebrate our anniversary. We managed to book our room with the 52% off due to SG52. To cut the long story short, let's take a look at the pros and cons: Pros: + Because of our for our anniversary, we were provided with a complimentary cake, extended 1 hr to our check out timing and upgraded to balcony room with the view of the fish pond right outside our room! + Located right above Outram park mrt station + They replied email quite promptly, their counter staff are friendly and always serve us with smiles on their faces + Room size is just right for us + Bed is big and comfortable + Excellent sleep quality + Aircon setting is adjustable + Check-in was quick Cons: - Poor soundproof as we can hear people talking loudly outside

title: Holiday
desc: Nice hotel, reception staff are great and always helpful. Very convenient as MRT on your door step! Some things to keep in mind! No power point in ensuite ?? So can‚Äôt plug in a hair dryer Toilet paper roll holder located in very awkward position However all in all very pleasant overall and we enjoyed our stay! We had 3 rooms booked at your hotel. We will be back! Reception staff our extremely friendly and helpful. Thank you for being so nice and courteous.

title: Great hotel for business trip!
desc: Enjoyed my stay here for a business trip. Would recommend this! Pros: - Near outram park MRT - I personally love the surrounding area, lots of lovely colonial style buildings, not difficult to find good food within walking distance - Clean and comfortable - Decent sized pool and gym - Bathroom door! (Sliding frosted glass door but I'm not complaining, as doors are apparently not a common fixture for hotels in Singapore) - High ceiling - nice view from balcony Cons - Pool overlooking construction side (not hotel's fault) Neutral - room size: considered okay for Singapore. Depending on what room size you are used to, this is a little bit on the smaller side, but bathroom size is actually pretty good. It was acceptable for me!

title: Very convenient
desc: Loved being right on top of the MRT station. Room was small but well-furnished, and I seem to have gotten the Wheelchair Accessible one so the bathroom was quite roomy. It does seem a little pricey for a solo traveler, so might come out cheaper if traveling with others.

title: Weird bathroom gap!
desc: The front desk staffs "J" and her manager "M" were friendly and exceptional upon check in. I give them five stars alone for such professionalism. However the room itself is dropped to three stars. We had a deluxe room. I would return to the Dorsett if only they'd fill that weird bathroom gap (see pictures). I just can't seem to understand this modern open concept. The wide shower door also opens to 180 degrees to be used as a door to the toilet. If you didn't figure this out, someone can see you sitting in the toilet from the bedroom section. Why not just enclose this lame gap? Toiletries provided were standard and the beds were good (not hard as most Asian hotels). I didn't realize that one of their bath towels is an orange stripped color. At first I thought housekeeping

title: Unprofessional hotel staff not able to justify the high price
desc: Well, I stayed several days for business in Singapore and this time I wanted to try Dorsett. The flashy website caught me. Unfortunately, the hotel staff could not handle my expectations. The room I got after check in smelled like someone has smoked there for days. After I complained, I was upgraded to a larger room. The interior of the room and the bathroom was nice. However, the linnen were absolutely dirty- not only on the first but on several days. After several complaints to the regular staff as well as the manager, they granted me 1 (!) comlplimentary lunch at the restaurant. No learning curve on behalf of the cleaning staff whatsoever. The gym is small and basic. The pool is relatively large though. The good thing about the hotel is that the MRT-station Outram Park is

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
desc: Very happy with our stay at Dorsett Singapore. Room was spacious compared to some other boutique rooms in the same area for the same price range. Just a few steps from Outram Park station (via lift access). Best thing was the smartphone access, which we used as a hotspot for the whole trip.

title: Present surprise on return
desc: Had the pleasure of staying at this hotel before our recent cruise. Staff very friendly and most helpful. On our return one night to get a room with a lovely bath. Will return and stay again. Motel close to china town and transport

title: Bonus smart phone with room!
desc: This hotel has some quirk's like house keeping the room only having 1 towel on arrival and house keeping missing things, again like giving only 1 towel and other things but all issues are resolved immediately by the friendly staff. The biggest reason why we will stay here again was the complimentary smart phone. We used hotspot on it and had wifi and calls everywhere we went in Singapore. This is a great bonus that worked for the 5 days we stayed there. Breakfast was, hmmm ok. If u get a deal go for it but if you have to pay extra, consider your alternatives. All said and done though we recommend this hotel, quick walk to China Town and the MRT is under you with a lift going there from the outside of the hotel!

title: My review when stayed in Dorsett Singapore
desc: Dorsett Hotel Singapore is located near with MTR Outram Park, it's about 200 meters. Recommended place to stay, very clean for bed and bathrooms. Beside that, this hotel has modern concept with excellent hospitality...

title: Dissapointing
desc: I have stayed in this hotel almost every time I return to Singapore for business matters. Unfortunately my recent stay was disappointing. The first room which I got to has urine stains on wc seat and urine smell. I thought I will just clean the seat a bit and let housekeeping do the cleaning the next day but the smell was just bad that I had to request to move to another room. When I got to a new room, there were missing bath towels (3 pool towels were provided instead bath towels), hand towels and bath mat. Side table and working tables were with finger prints and dirt. What's most disappointing was one of the housekeepers who attended to my complains sulk and just walk in with no greetings and sulk, reluctantly clean the table. Next I discovered the shower rose leaks. Upon my

title: Perfect location, nice pool
desc: Booked this hotel for the location and the pool. For the price segment, this is hard to beat in Singapore. The hotel is directly above an MRT station and 300m away from Chinatown with all its great eateries... even closer to an outlet of Hawker Chan, the cheapest Michelin star restaurant in the world. The rooms are small which is normal for Singapore but since the ceiling is high, it never feels cramped in the room. Room was always clean. The pool is on the 4th floor overlooking the intersection (currently construction going on). It's one of the pools you find more and more in Asia : very shallow but long. This means you can still swim lanes while people that can't swim don't have to worry. It's very well kept and a relief after a long hot day. Didn't use breakfast. Service

title: Back again
desc: This is a busy hotel on the edge of Chinatown. I have stayed here several times. Normally just for one night or two as I was attending meetings . This time we stayed for four nights as we were here for a wedding as well. The rooms are clean and the air con very good. Nice carpets and a lap pool. There is a micro brewery opposite the entrance but we were disappointed in the food. There are many restaurants nearby and the hotel is conveniently located for the MRT. The staff are helpful - we managed to lose our wedding gift and they took great efforts to recover it.

title: Exceeded expectations throughout
desc: We arrived early - 9am - and we were pleased to find that the reception desk got us into our room immediately, as we had dreaded being made to wait for a 2pm check-in time. We were also upgraded to a larger room. Being Singapore, the hotel room wasn't huge, but it was plenty big enough, with an extremely comfortable super king size bed, a clean and well-appointed bathroom, and a powerful shower in its own large enclosure. The room came with a large flat screen TV, kettle, fridge, ironing board and iron. Limited hanging/storage space, and a few coat hooks would have been useful, but otherwise a good room. The rooftop swimming pool - rooftop on the third storey as there's a part of the building that runs at an angle to the hotel - is superb. Warm but not hot, and an

title: Price gouging at Dorsett
desc: There are differences between loft, balcony and standard rooms, especially regarding price. None of this is transparent. We booked through Booking.com and got caught out when we changed our booking to another day. Dorsett took advantage of this and gouged an extremely high price. This is very unfair and bad practice and we will never stay there or recommend them again.

title: Adequate for the price paid
desc: Very convenient location for MRT station which is under the building. Fortunately you cannot hear train noise. Within a few minutes walk of Chinatown. We tried breakfast on the first morning which we felt was overpriced and not up to standard. Room were clean and excellent shower and bathroom facilities. Very comfortable bed and duvet.

title: Nice and clean
desc: Hotel location is very convenient as it is just less than 1 minute walk from Outram Park MRT station exit H plus all sheltered walkway. Nice design walkway to rooms. Room size is ok. Elegant design at lift waiting area.

title: Nice Hotel
desc: This hotel is in a great place for site seeing. We walked a lot but also used the train which is just next door. The Hotel itself is pleasant and clean. Staff are polite. Wet arrived at 9am after a 12 hour flight to be advised that our room was not ready as check in was not until 2pm but we can have complimentary early check in in single rooms. We declined and waited for our double room. The only other critisim I have of this Hotel is the breakfasts are the same every day, would be nice for a bit of a change. Would still recommend this Hotel.

title: Very unclean hotel, would not recommend
desc: the room was filthy; the carpet was old and stained, glasses in the room were dirty and the remote control was caked with a layer of filth. The bathroom was much smaller than expected, and in general was dissapointed to see the hotel and rooms looked much better in pictures than in reality. Breakfast was good and staff were quite nice.

title: Was only just OK
desc: We stayed here in April and June 2017 as a stop over on our trip to Europe. The hotel presents very well on the internet, but when you get there it's not quite as advertised. The hotel is relatively small with small rooms to match. They were modern and clean, but just too little. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever had in a hotel, the shower was the biggest part. The pool area was simple. There are no shade areas and limited sun loungers. There is a construction site next door and the noise was unbelievable. The MRT is underneath, which was great and there were a few decent places to go to eat around the hotel. We found the location only convenient for the MRT. We wished we had only booked the hotel on the way over, as we would have chosen somewhere else had we

title: Experience
desc: Room choice was not offered during check in despite arriving at 2pm. Check in staff offer to give my room choice only the next day . Service was non existent . The buffet breakfast was also terrible . Limited food choice and staff who cannot understand and speak English .

title: Great location, good service
desc: Really convenient, right above the MRT at Outram Park. Staff took a bit of time to find our reservation, but it was fine - good front desk service. Rooms are quiet but a bit small. Smaller pool, but mostly quiet, so you feel that it‚Äôs your own private space. Could not contact housekeeping after 6pm for extra towels for the pool, but we made do. Fully equipped rooms. Comfortable for a business stay.

title: Great bath! Shame about the construction surrounding hotel.
desc: I stayed in an executive double room. The room itself was extremely clean, well laid out and spacious for Singapore. I especially loved the separate huge bath and shower. The air conditioning was a little temperamental. Only being provided with one bath towel was a little odd. The pool facility was closed for cleaning during my stay however my room overlooked the pool and I was not witness to any maintenance occurring. The hotel is well situated above an MRT and short walk to china town. Unfortunately there is a lot of construction being carried out surrounding the hotel. This is very loud and noisy and can be heard from the room. Service at the hotel restaurant leaves a lot to be desired! This really lets down the service standard of the hotel. I found in quite

title: A great experience from the hotel like our home
desc: We are a retired couple and we love travelling around.We were staying at another hotel during our Singapore trip when my wife suffered from a medical condition. We were referred to the Singapore General Hospital. Upon discharge from the hospital she required more rest in Singapore, a nurse recommended Dorsett Singapore for its location. We felt welcome when we arrived at the hotel. Mr Peter Chua, Director of Rooms,anticipated that we needed some help at the lobby as my wife looked tired. He was pro-active and very professional in making all the necessary arrangements. The General Manager ( Philip ) personally took interest of her well- being and wished her a speedy recovery. Room Service was friendly and efficient. A birthday celebration was planned for my wife at the hotels's

title: Decent hotel in convenient location
desc: Location: very convenience location, just 1 min walk when you come out from metro. There are some restaurants within 5 mins walk but didn't find any convenience stores nearby. Room: We stay in a twins bedroom, the room is a little bit small but still okay. Nice modern decoration which is also clean and tidy. Beds are okay with good conditioning, the surprise was that they offer a free smart photo which you can take it out with free network usage and call when you touring around Singapore. Bathroom: Clean and tidy, you will need to request towels if you go to swimming pool. Services: Nice staffs, we requested early check-in and our request was quickly being fulfilled. Smooth and quick check in and check out process. Hotel facility: We went to the swimming pool and it was

title: Quite place,good location and decent service.
desc: We came here for medical check up.We booked four days to stay.But how long stay here was depend on doctor's decision.So we informed hotel we can say how many day extend to stay can tell at over check out time.They accepted and wellcome for my extend to stay inform lately.So many thing they support me.Thanks for all of the stuffs.

title: Great location / Clean Room
desc: Stayed with Dorsett Hotel for a couple of nights. The location is very accessible to MRT lift, just on the opposite side of Hotel entrance. Hotel is also walking distance from Chinatown if you prefer to have a leisure walk. The room itself was extremely clean and spacious. Mr. Peter Chua was kind enough to provided us assistance during our check-in process. Although I was not able to check out the pool and the bar but would highly recommend the Dorsett hotel to any one visiting Singapore and will definitely be back.

title: Perfect spot to tour from.
desc: The Dorsett is a tidy stylish hotel with excellent helpful staff. It is situated right next to the Outran Park MRT station so you can get around very easily. You take exit H and it is even labelled Dorsett Singapore. The lift exit on L1 brings you out on New Bridge Road just to the right of the entrance to the hotel. The way down is five stairs. There is a lift there to bring your suitcase down by it wasn‚Äôt working when we were there. You can travel from the airport via MRT and while you have to do connections it is usually literally across the platform. The rooms are well proportioned - not Vegas big but not Paris small. The counter space in the bathroom is non existent and the bathroom door system is crazy and not that practical - basically the shower door swings around to

title: Great location and service, beautiful room, very friendly staff.
desc: We stayed in Dorsett Singapore for 4 nights. First the location straight next to, or on top of MRT station Outram Park was ideal. Very friendly and professional staff. The rooms were quite spacious and had a nice design. Hygiene was okay except some dust under the bathroom sink. Good bed and pillows. Nice swimming pool. Also a nice roof garden. Too bad there were no facilities to sit or drink something. We would definitely recommend it and go back. Thanks Dorsett for a nice stay.

title: Good and convenient
desc: I'm so glad we stayed here. Having stayed in Orchard Rd a long while ago, we wanted a place that was good and convenient. It's a great spot to go walking to Maxwell Rd Food Centre, short walk or taxi ride to Tiong Bahru Food Centre or a heap of other food joints in Chinatown to name a few. Getting around was handy as the MRT was right next door but we took taxis everywhere as it's cheap and quick. But be careful going to places like Gardens on the Bay to watch the light show as the queue was really long afterwards. The hotel room itself looks a bit aged but only just. My room carpet was badly stained near the bed but everything else clean. Don't expect Singapore hotel rooms to be big but this was okay. Bed was a king bed (upgraded from a double I think) and quiet. Staff were

title: Adequate but not overwhelming
desc: This hotel is perfectly serviceable however I wouldn‚Äôt recommend for more than a night or 2. It‚Äôs a basic hotel that doesn‚Äôt really feel 4 star, it‚Äôs very much the equivalent of a premier inn / travel lodge in the UK or Holiday Inn Express. We stayed in one of the largest rooms with balcony, which was still only 25m sq. Towels desperately need replacing, without delay. I‚Äôve read the same comment countless times about this hotel now and I totally agree, they‚Äôre very poor. You think the hotel would listen to guests and replace them. Lots of building work going on during our stay, we were not told in advance about this, drilling from 9:30am which was ear shattering. Location is good with MRT station below hotel, easy to get about the city. Free mobile phone in room also a

title: 4 star class-action questionable
desc: Personally I'd rate this hotel 3.5 stars. A couple of things disappointed me. No concierge so any questions had to be asked of Reception staff who are busy dealing with check ins and outs at usual peak times. Also, the restaurant / room service and restaurant close at 9pm. On a positive note, the breakfast offered is a wide range of hot / cold food buffet style so offered good value for money. The gym is small but adequately equipped.

title: Good business hotel
desc: Good standard business hotel near Chinatown. Nothing special but good for an efficient stay. Good -Easy subway access. - Good breakfast. - fast checkout - mostly well maintained - well trained staff Other - very small rooms

title: Functional and well-located
desc: Stayed with my three-year-old son for two nights in late August 2017 for short stopover on the way to Thailand. Our 1am check-in was thankfully efficient and easy. We were apparently upgraded to a balcony room when I requested the king bed room I had booked, rather than two single beds. The room was clean, tidy and fairly modern, with a small, shower-only bathroom. Block out curtains were effective and air conditioning proved good despite a slow start. Corridors very hot due to lighting etc, and apparent lack of cooling. Pretty good supply of English-language TV channels. Decent service (forgot to put the 'make up my room' sign out despite being encouraged to do so via a note slipped under the door; the room was made up nonetheless). Well-located near Chinatown and

title: Great staff, funky modern hotel, good location
desc: You can invariably know your service experience by just how easy the check in service is put together. Here there was obvious customer service skill and good organisation. The reception staff throughout our stay were nothing short of excellent - thank you. The rooms were on the small side but totally clean and functional. The location for us was ideal right above the MRT station so could easily get around with our pushchair and my broken foot! Also only a 5 to 10 min walk from hustle bustle Chinatown. On the downside for me there wasn't much of interest around the hotel although there are a number of swanky wine bars and pricey cafes up the hill 2 mins away. The only negative for me was the pool was closed for renovation and this was not advertised as such until I

title: Good rooms but the foyer and breakfast are not upto standard
desc: The hotel is located close to China Town and SGH (Hospital). The rooms are well appointed and a USP is the provision of a mobile phone that gives you free data and local phone calls - including free calls to the UK! Its a great touch. The pool is nice but the gym is not well equipped at all. Of the two running machines present one was broken for the 4 days I was there. My biggest disappointment is that the breakfast is well below the standard you come to expect from hotels in Asia. This really needs to change as does having a proper foyer. That said the front staff were very pleasant and helpful

title: Good location to Chinatown
desc: We can walk here to Chinatown easily. We enjoyed there to stay here. To ride on MRT, it is also good location. This hotel is clean, but the shawer room is small. The breakfast is buffet style. The menu was not much. The staff is good considerate. When my key was troubled, they supported soon.

title: Location wasn't bad
desc: We stayed at Dorsett upon a friend's recommendation based on its proximity to the Outram MRT Station. The room was clean and its size was decent. Airconditioning worked very well - a plus for the typical hot weather of Singapore. The concierge staff was very helpful in helping me book a taxi or grab. One of the managers kindly lent me their conference room when I needed a place to change our baby's nappy. Breakfast was decent but maybe only if you don't want to walk a bit to explore other nearby options. You just cross a driveway and you'll find the lift access to the MRT station. This was very convenient for us travelling with a toddler.

title: Not worth the price
desc: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for two nights. The staff were very friendly and serviceminded and the check in was smooth. We only had one shower towel so we use the towel ment for the pool instead.
