We were very disapointed the pool was out of order du to cleaning, and had been for a couple of weeks as this was the reason we chose this hotel. We had been looking forward to relaxing by the pool after a hard day downtown and to swim in it after going to the small gym. We would probably have changed hotel if we had been informed about the pool not working. The breakfast was very poor if you do not like rice, noodles or dumplings. The best thing about this hotel was the shower and the pineapple we had for breakfast.

title: Vacation trip
desc: You will be unfortunate if you are looking for nearby INDIAN restaurants. The Outram Park MRT Station is just 50 mts far from the hotel. This makes it pretty easy to commute to most of the attractions in the city pretty easily.

title: Convenient location but rather small room
desc: The location of this hotel is great, right above Outram Park MRT and walking distance to Smith street Chinatown. It has a direct elevator to the MRT but. Look for exit H, it will take you directly to that elevator. Outram Park MRT is quite a big station so it is quite confusing looking for the hotel if you dont know which direction/exit to take. The room is modern and comfortable but on the smaller side. The bathroom, unfortunately is very tiny and can not fit 2 people at a time. So if you are in a hurry, it is quite a problem.

title: One of the best middle range business hotels in Chinatown
desc: The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Chinatown, and right next door to a MRT station. The standard rooms are small but have everything you need: a comfy bed, hot water kettle, air-conditioning, iron/board, and fast wifi. A real bonus is the complimentary smart phone that you can use to make local calls, which is ideal for business. The front desk is efficient, knowledgeable, and the service is friendly. The hotel has a good coffee shop with a daily buffet offering asian and western choices. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice stay in simple hotel
desc: In a nutshell, my stay in this hotel was beyond my initial expectation. The location was just some steps away from Outram park MRT station, even there's a lift for hotel guess to directly go down to the station! The staffs were helpful and nice. They nicely help us to call the Taxi at 5am to Changi airport which only took less than 10 mins for the Taxi to come!! The room was rather small, as you could expect it to be. However, it was well equipped and very comfortable. A tip from me is that you should arrange a right time to check out, especially when you're in a rush. Because this may take a quite long line when in check out time.

title: Dorsett located strategically
desc: This hotel is located in a strategic location with the outram park metro right underneath it. This mrt(metro station is called) is a junction of three routes so you can pretty much go to every nook and corner of the City from here without breaking a sweat. The facilities provided by the hotel for the price are average in my honest opinion. They boast of a gym but nothing is in proper condition. They could have done well to provide a jacuzzi or some thing of that sorts. The restaurant menu on offer is very limited in variety. If not for the location I would not have given 4 stars for this hotel.

title: Great bday experience
desc: Got a cake, complimentary fruits and a free upgrade to a deluxe room! Super nice staff, great value and close to chinatown and MRT! LOVE IT! Has subway access to Outram Park station, 5 minute walk to chinatown where you can taste 1 michelin star restaurant! Love the location, the service and the room. Bed and pillows are so comfy!

title: Great location with good sized rooms
desc: My husband and I stayed here with my parents for 6 nights. Each couple had a double room on the 10th floor. The rooms were spacious enough and set out as pictured with a large bed, wardrobe, small desk, TV and ensuite. They didn't have a good view, only looking out onto a construction site from or side of the building. It was very warm for us in Singapore so we also utilised the air con which was great and the swimming pool on the roof - although this was out of action for our final 2 days. The location is really great as it is above a MRT line - which goes on the green and purple routes. It is also situated on the edge of Chinatown, so a short 5-10minute walk into the main streets of Chinatown for great food. Hotel staff were friendly. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel as

title: An excellent services Diana, Angelia ,suhabailah
desc: Very very an excellent services from housekeeping and especially FO staff Diana , Angelia and Suhabailah.. They're really friendly and helpful. Check in by Suhabailah and check out by Diana less than 5 minute. While Angelia helping with my bag and offering mento call my transport.. Well done ladies. Location super convinient , MRT outarm park just below the hotel. Room is big and clean. We had a joy while staying here. We'll be back very very soon. To management: please give an award or appreciation for those 3 ladies on behalf of me. Once again thank you so much Diana , Angelia and Suhabailah.

title: Generally very good
desc: We arrived late afternoon and were checked in about 5 minutes. Our room was a twin room on the 5th floor. The room was a reasonable size, but not spacious. Singapore does have space issues. I tend to judge rooms based on cleanliness, bed comfort and bathrooms. The room was clean. There were though some old spillage stains on the carpet. The room had complimentary water and tea and coffee making facilities. There was only powdered milk and this curdled one time. The beds were very comfortable and the air con kept the room cool. Maybe a bit too cool. Even after adjusting the room was quite cold during the night. Better than too warm though. The bathroom was a good size and had a shower. I do get annoyed when hotel showers leak onto the rest of the bathroom floor and this did a

title: Friendly staff. Nice experience.
desc: Stayed at Dorset hotel last Thursday for staycation. Was welcomed by friendly front desk rep. (Its a pity that I didn't get her name) Check in was quick n prompt. Was allocated a room at the 10th floor. Wasn't able to find my room number and was assisted by one of the housekeepers. Room cleanliness was there. Varieties of TV channel so you won't get bored at night. Amenities provided. Location at Chinatown where there are many eateries nearby. Downside: We have made the booking thru expedia and apparently, you can get to enjoy breakfast at half price. (Usual price is $32) We opted for the offer and paid for $16. We were relieved that we paid for half price for the breakfast as its not worth paying 32 bucks for the limited selection. Do also take note that the cups for

title: Adequate in many ways
desc: Central location. Next to the MRT station and main road . Great shower and sleep quality. Very efficient and fast reception for check-in and check-out ... And they give a mobile phone u can use to make local calls, use internet and hotspot it to use your own phone. Breakfast is not wow but just above average. Overall a great experience. *It also has specially designed rooms for the elderly.

title: Worth it because of the Singaporeans Staycation Promotion
desc: Got 52% off the actual room rate for weekends because #SG52 as a local. Booked the splash king room and was not disappointed. Room had comfortable beds, just be sure to rinse the bathtub a little before using. Downside - there are only two sockets/plugs available for use and it's beside the bed. This means if guests want to boil water, it has to be by the bedside. On top of this, one of them in room 1009 was spoiled and I can only use one side at any one time. Overall, not too bad experience, will come back if there are promotions. PS: They have a pillow menu but only available for pre-booking (contact the concierge before arriving - I made the mistake of not doing so because I wasn't aware of it earlier.)

title: GOOD RECEPTIONISTS BAD HOUSEKEEPING
desc: Front Office was superb! Check in by Diana was fast and smooth and she even gave me a complimentary upgrade to the deluxe room. Check out by Reuben, was fast and professional. However, even with the upgrade to deluxe room, the housekeeping was terrible. The headboard was so dusty, it seems like it's been there for a few months. The kettle was dusty and the toilet had a smell of dried pee. There were also a couple small stains on the sheets but it wasn't too bad as compare to the rest. Carpets were old and filled with stains all over.. even hotel 81 would be a better option...

title: A good spot in Singapore!
desc: I enjoyed staying at Dorsett Singapore. The location was perfect; right on the edge of Chinatown, 3 minutes walk from a metro. The bed was big and comfortable with many pillows, the room was spacious and the WIFI was good. They even offered a phone with data and free in-country calls you could bring with you when exploring the city. Nice, attentive and effective staff. The only downside was the price, but the price level is high in Singapore, so it wasn't worse than competitors. However, I would have expected free breakfast with that price.

title: Nice Hotel. Good location
desc: there is a tram station under the hotel. Take the new room nice pool, nice food stayed there for 2 weeks the Chef was very kind and helpful with Soy products there was a small problem - the first room was not very clean and i received not clean towels. it was solved the day after when i moved to a new room

title: One night in Singapore...
desc: First glance an overall well maintained place with helpful attentive staff. Rooms tiny, but good ise of space and extremely comfy bed and pillows to stesl away (I didn't), but when it comes to detsils: Sliding door of closet access from inside bathroom missing... Floor towel in bathroom shows clear sings of wear and tear... Swimming pool out of order due to repair / maintainance (don't remember seeing this at Booking.com)... Overall below expectation for a hotel of this price range.

title: Almost Perfect
desc: There are few things to highlight during our stay in this hotel. 1) The location is very accessible. Take Green lane, alight Outram and take Exit H. 2) Room is well maintained. Equipped with mini bar, fridge, complete with hair dryer, toiletries, toilet and bath is impressive with rain shower, iron board and iron, bath robes, slippers, and big size room. plus King size bed! 3) The receptionist - Ann (Korean) is polite. 4) They gave us complimentary upgrade since its my birthday. 5) They gave us another complimentary cake! and Its yummy! 6) I think the pool is too small for a hotel size like Dorsett. but we will consider coming back!! yey!

title: Convenient and great value for money!
desc: I had a fantastic stay at Dorsett while in Singapore. The room was very clean and tidy, with options for room service everyday. The staff were also very approachable and friendly. The only downfall was that while I was there, the kitchen was undergoing renovations so room service options were very limited. That said, overall a very comfortable stay!

title: This is a couples hotel-not for families!
desc: This is a beautiful hotel with lovely service- the front staff are very accommodating... however- we booked a room they tout as a family rooom and I'm not sure how open Singaporeans are- but having a bathroom with a door that is glass and only mildly cloudy in appearance and having said bathroom a step away from where the fold out couch is... well it's weird. I had to pee in the dark so my kids couldn't see my fat booty sitting on the loo. Everyone had to leave or turn around or hide behind the massive remote controlled curtains when anyone was showering. The fold out couch was wafer thin and despite the wonderful housekeeping staff bringing an additional doona to provide some thickness to the mattress on it- it was hard and the support bar could be felt through it. There is no

title: 3 Days in Singapore
desc: Hotel staff were friendly and helpful MRT was right next door and a 5 minute walk to Chinatown Hotel rooms while not huge but were spacious enough ,they were clean and fitted out with cable tv ,free wifi and also a pool towel was added to the usual bath towels While the hotel provides breakfast ,a short walk to Chinatown for some delicious yum cha was our preferred breakfast Very enjoyable stay

title: Good value
desc: Nice and tidy rooms with good size for Singapore. Friendly staff and decent service. Does the job and overall delivers in line with expectations given the price. Good location in happening area with good shops, boutiques and galleries. Walking distance to the bay.

title: Misses a lot
desc: Pros: - very convenient location right at Outram Stn. There is an almost direct access from the station to the hotel. - Room was reasonably clean and well maintained with a nice city view. - Wifi was strong. - Room was small but it was typical of Singapore. - Pool seems to be okay and command a fine view (opposite city). Cons: - Clock was set wrong, alarm was on at a very odd time, and was never corrected (not sure if I was supposed to be responsible to change) - Very few electric outlets available. One at the bedside and another at the desk, the setting was inconvenient. - A treadmill was out of order (there was one more which was occupied at the time). - most of everything including minibar was to be charged. Two free bottles of water were provided. - In general, no frills,

title: Singapore Stay with a smartphone - impressed
desc: We stayed here for three nights and found the hotel clean, modern and quirkey. It has a entry/exit to the outram MRT just next door so very handy in wet weather. The location was great for us, very close to China Town and still walkable to the city centre/Clarke Quay (if you like to walk), if you get tired then just jump on the MRT and train back. The first room we had was a twin room (after booking 9 months earlier they were booked out...disappointing) but the next night we were given a wheelchair accessible room so had lots more space. But what did put it high in our books are the smartphones that come with each room....your own GPS while out and about, local calls were free and even to some other countries (didnt try). Also had apps to book discounted tours. We found this

title: Good location
desc: The hotel is not bad but has one minus: the sink in my room was not clean enough, it had mold and the surface was not also clean. The carpet in my room was also not clean. I think for the 4 stars it is weird. The breakfast was the same for the four days of staying there. The people were all very pleasant, polite, and helpful.

title: Rooms
desc: Rooms are extremely small, and found my toilet dirty around the top. The cleaning was not very good. But the staff are friendly. You are about 5 minutes from old china town. They say it is a new hotel, but honestly, it looks older. Wall paper coming of the walls in the hall ways, and breakfast not much seating. It is not good for a family. The rooms are to small for me.

title: The Dorsett is an ideal base when visiting Singapore
desc: The Dorsett Hotel keeps drawing me back - I think this was my twelfth stay in the past two years or so. This time I was in room 917. The location is right above the Outram Park SMRT station - buy an EZ-link pass if you are here for a few or more nights - you can be in most shopping areas, Marina Bay, Orchard Rd and Harbour Front easily - Chinatown is one station along. I arrived last Saturday evening -- the staff remembered me - check-in and luggage delivery to my room was handled easily - well done. The room comfort is fine - nice bed - cleaned every day to a high standard - no complaints. A few things were fixed simply as required -- well done again. The hotel restaurant is undergoing renovations until August. Sunday morning it was a little congested due to the temp

title: Gem in Chinatown
desc: I commend all the staff as they are very accommodating and friendly. The hotel interior is fabulous! They are prompt with your request and can leave your baggage after check out to roam in the city. The room is cleaned and maintained with complete facilities and free mobile usage. The breakfast spread is just enough to fill you.

title: Splash Room, Short Stay
desc: Expedia‚Äôs ongoing MASTERCARD 12% DISCOUNT when booking rooms at (very) select hotels does come handy at times especially when using Expedia+ points. So when knowing that Dorsett Singapore is eligible for both, I decided to book a room for a 1N stay. At check-in I was given a free upgrade from their 22sqm Dorsett Room to a 25sqm Deluxe Room. But since a view of the busy junction below is not my thing, I requested for another upgrade. For an additional S$70.00 net, I got myself a well laid-out 25sqm room which comes with a bath and a view of the 30 meter pool ‚Äì the Splash Room. Having seen the earlier Deluxe Room of the same floor size, I really think that the narrower but longer design of the Splash Room is more practical. Squeezing in a stand-alone bath in small room is a bit

title: Rest days following 3 weeks in Vietnam
desc: We chose the Dorsett Hotel through an online site prior to our recent visit and really didn't know what to expect. However, from the moment we arrived we knew we had made a good choice. The location was perfect and we chose to walk everywhere as that gave us the opportunity to see and savour so much more of beautiful Singapore. If we had chosen to use public transport, the train and bus services were on the doorstep for us. The hotel itself was lovely. Our room was spacious, modern decor and very clean. Breakfasts were lovely and the restaurant well appointed. The young man who welcomed us at the door was very courteous and friendly. One of the female staff at breakfast was delightful and we wish we had asked her name to let management know how much we appreciated her. We would

title: Accommodating Staff, Great Location, Super Value!
desc: I had a one day stay here between flights. Got here in the morning and left in the evening. The staff managed to find me an "early check in" room which was very nice and I could wash up and sleep. Right by the MRT and Chinatown. Easy to go anywhere to. Staff was really helpful on the few questions I had. It is not the Shangri La but neither is the price.......excellent value. Would definitely stay here again.

title: My very pleasant stay
desc: I stay at Dorsett Hotell Singspore to celebrate a belated Father's day on 30/6/17 and this is one of my best stay in Singapore Hotels. The Dorsett Twin bed room is comfortable and have all the necessary amenities. I appreciate the aircon temperature is just nice for me and my dad to sleep comfortable. My initial request is to have a room of city view but the room is not available and luckily the staff of the check-in counter recommend me a room with good view of Bukit Pasoh. We manage to take very good pictures from our room. This room is better than what I expected. The pool, the gym and the roof-top garden are great. All the staff are courteous. Thank you Dorsett Hotel for making the stay for me and my dad so memorable and comfortable, your hotel will always be my top

title: Vacation
desc: Nice room, great location. Have pictures but cant post it have a family member in it. Wish could stay a little bit longer but only have a week of vacation. It may have been 5 stars if the food is great but dont like the food still a nice place to stay

title: Cheated by the staff
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights while attending a course nearby. Location wise it is right above the Outram Park MRT station; there is a lift from underground which leads up to the building adjacent to the hotel itself. Quite convenient; there is also a bus stop located a few steps away from the hotel lobby. Upon arrival, the bellboy was helpful and carried my luggage in. However, the staff at the reception desk checked me into a room with two single beds although I requested for one with a king-sized bed. Called the front desk from my room to ask for a change, and they arranged another room for me within half an hour. Here's the catch though, I noticed that the 'king-sized bed' in the new room was actually two single beds pushed together and covered with a king-sized bedsheet! That

title: Not impressed
desc: Not impressed with this hotel at all! Used it as a stop gap between Singapore and Bali and after receiving hands down the best service ever from Balinese people it was a shock to come here. BEWARE Singapore is beyond expensive (coming from a Londoner) you do not get value for money anywhere. ¬£100 a day budget blown on food and a few drinks First of all ¬£23 for breakfast?! Lobby was small and air conned to arctic temperatures to the point where I felt sick with the temperature difference, it must have been 14/15 degrees in there to go out into over 29 degrees outside not a pleasant transition from freezing cold to boiling hot Bar was shut, with no other bars around apart from the brewery across the road this was very fustrating. Room was tiny, T.I.N.Y barely enough room to

title: Great location, services and rooms but something doesn't fit....
desc: The best feature of this hotel is that it sits above the Outram Park MRT station. This provides easy access to anywhere you're likely to visit. Although technically in Chinatown the hotel is on the very edge of it. A 1 stop MRT ride or 5-10 minute walk will put in the heart of things. The staff are very good. Front desk, housekeeping, etc. are all friendly and quick to respond. The rooms are clean and well equipped. You'll find, powerful showers, a work area, TV, comfortable bed, AC, room safe and ample outlets for charging your devices. The curtain system also allows for a very dark sleep. I also found my room very quiet. WiFi was reliable and robust. With all this positive it is unfortunate that this property has a sore thumb in the form of the restaurant

title: 2 night stay
desc: We stayed for 2 nights on the way back from a trip to Thailand. We booked a mystery room, was meant to be minimum double, which it was, however that's all it was. The overall dimensions of the room were quite compact. The ensuite was smaller that we had encountered on cruise ships, very snug indeed. Overall the room was very clean, the bed was a tad firm but the pillows were very soft. There was tea/coffee making facilities, but only a creamer for milk. There was a safe. There was an iron and ironing board. There was a hair dryer. There was a smartphone for our use whilst in Singapore. There were ample toiletries for our stay. The location was very good for the cruise ship/ harbour area, one stop away from Vivo shopping centre which connects with the Sentosa Express. The

title: very good location and hotel
desc: i chose it for the price, the pictures on the website and the pool. I wasn't disapointed by any of it! the rooftop pool is great, the rooms were spacious and the service was very attentive. they allowed me even to shower after checking out and before taking my flight! location is great next to Chinatown preserved housing and close to the metro stop that takes you to Santosa island within 20min max!

title: Comfortable. Food let's it down. And the prepayment incident.
desc: Overall nice hotel. Beds comfortable, showers are great and a nice pool. They also give you a smart phone to use during your stay which is really handy. The breakfast however lets it down. It was worthy of a Express by Holiday Inn. Cheap bread cheese and meats. Hardly any fresh fruit. Could be a lot better. In addition and this is what really annoyed me - They charged my card before I got there. I got some poor excuse that it was a prepaid rate. It wasn't. The booked through my company booking tool and they kind of rate doesn't appear on the system. They just wanted the cash in. Not good. It smacks of sharp practice. Wont stay there again.

title: Nice Hotel
desc: We stayed at the Dorsett for two nights on our way to Thailand. The room was not large but big enough for the time we spent in it. The bed was very comfortable and both the room and bathroom were very clean. The staff were helpful and friendly. It was only about a minute's walk to the MRT station so very convenient for getting around. One stop away from Vivo City Mall. We found the MRT easy to use.

title: Great Location and close to everything
desc: I stayed at the hotel during my Business trip. Great location. Just next to the train station. The street at the back of the hotel is full of the good restaurants and cafe. Walking distance to Chinatown.

title: Solid business hotel in good location
desc: The staff were pleasant, the room was good value, and the location in Chinatown was walkable. They offered a complimentary smartphone which I used extensively for maps and when I got lost a couple of times. I enjoyed my 3-day business stay here.

title: Get Dorsett..
desc: We enjoyed our stay in Dorsett Hotel. We stayed for 5 days and 4 nights and loved every minute of our time. Here is my review: Rooms Regular sized rooms. Clean. Quiet room and privacy from nearby room. Soft beds and comfortable pillows. Rain shower. They will always replenish the complementary toiletries. They even have a free hotspot phone you can use all over the city. The only concern we have is that the room has 2 sockets available for use. Price Reasonable price comparing it to other hotels and even rentals throughh airbnb Convenience One minute walk towards the closest train station. Five-minute walk to Chinatown where There are a lot of affordable and great restaurants. You can also buy souveneirs at a low price..you can haggle for prices. Staff Friendly, corteous

title: Family Holiday
desc: Good Location.. Good Environtment n Facility.. nice, clean n convinient Hotel. If I Go back to Singapore again, I Will Stay in Dorsett Hotel Again. PS . They Gave A Very Very Good rate and Also I've been free Upgrade to bigger Room

title: Strategic location
desc: The room is comfortable and the location of the hotel is just above the MRT station. There are also plenty of restaurants in the surrounding within walking distance. The not so good thing is the breakfast area is too small and always have to look for a place to sit.

title: Enjoyed our stay
desc: Spent 3 nights in the Dorsett hotel on a short stay in Singapore. Bed was very comfy and the location is great, being just a short 10 minute walk to the heart of Chinatown. The in room Wifi is one of the best we have ever used and was quite fast. We also got upgraded to a different room which was a nice gesture when checking in. If we are ever in Singapore again we would certainly stay here again. Being directly above and MRT station is very convenient.

title: Good location but aircon's not functioning well
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip last April 2017. The aircon in my room is not functioning well. Temperature's always 23-25¬∞C even though it's already set to 12¬∞C. Called the aircon technicians but they told me that there's no problem. This continued for the rest of my stay. Even though the place is nice and the room is clean, I don't want to stay here because they can't fix the problem with the aircon. Staff even told me that it's cold but in fact it is not.

title: Avoid at all costs
desc: This is without a doubt the worst hotel in Singapore . It is dirty , inefficient ,run by idiots . the breakfast area is dirty food on the floor. No real cleaning system. Selection is limited. My wife asked for a boiled egg and they said no. 10 mins later we saw another guest with boiled eggs. If you like crowded,inefficient,dirty establishments that cater for the volume tour bus crowd and then have the nerve to charge you 5star rates then you will love it. I especially love people sneezing coughing right next to you at breakfast without even attempting to cover their mouth! My I suggest building an infectious diseases hospital next door save on commuting. I booked on booking.com and it is pre paid so I can't cancel the remainder of my booking. Can anyone recommend a decent

title: 5 night stopover on way to UK.
desc: Great hotel, staff very helpful especially Rueben .Very quiet and comfortable rooms. Loved every minute, not enough time to do everything .Convenient for MRT and Chinatown. Loved the free use of the Handyphone.

title: Good location. Cleanliness is an issue.
desc: Located above the MRT station and on the edge of Chinatown the hotel is in a great location. That is the end of the positives. When we went to our room we found a plastic bag on the floor and other plastic litter. These remained there for three days even though the room had been serviced. We had to ring housekeeping every day as there were cups missing, glasses missing, only one bath towel supplied, only one pool towel. Cups were left with used tea bags in them and not replaced. The common area outside the lift on level 5 had the same litter on the floor for four days. The bin outside the lift was not emptied. Eventually we spoke to the manager and our room was cleaned but the common areas remained dirty. Obviously not a high priority even though he assured us that he would

title: Excellent stay
desc: Hello everyone, I would like to share my personal experience with this hotel. I write all my reviews the same, talking about the most important things and pointing out good and bad things. Enjoy! Location (5/5) - Located between Bukit Merah and Chinatown, this hotel is not so far from the city center. I must say, the location and the nearby MRT station are the things that were deciding a hotel in Singapore and Dorsett was the winner. MRT station a few steps away, city bus in front of the hotel, taxi...you can choose. You are also not far from Sentosa Island where you should go and check out Universal studios and aquarium. Staff and service (5/5) - Upon arrival, staff were friendly, helpful and very well organised. During my stay they were always there for me, even helping with

title: Great value for money.
desc: Stayed at Dorsett Singapore for four nights in March. The Hotel was modern and neat, perfect for business travel. I believe this hotel offers great value for money considering the generally high cost of Singapore hotels. FOOD: We did not eat at the hotel. It had a restaurant which looked OK but we preferred eating out. ROOMS: Room was fair sized, neat and clean. It is a non-smoking hotel which I loved. Amenities was standard four stars. POOL: The pool area was great and was great to cool down in. There is no pool service though, so it is for swimming only. LOCATION: Upon booking, I was at first concerned with it being a bit too far away from restaurants but were happy to discover it was about a 10-15min walk from Clarke Quays. It is also located

title: Nice & a Smart Place
desc: Super conveniently located, especially for Indians as the Vishnu temple of China Town is located on the adjacent street. The hotel is super neat and well designed. The rooms are slightly less fancy compared to the lobby and other exteriors of the place but nonetheless our stay was quite convenient. We would love to stay here again.

title: Ok hotel
desc: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel it's ok it has mrt just near the hotel so makes it easy to get around. The rooms are clean and comfortable but the toilet lacks privacy with no door. Good swimming pool nice and warm.

title: Great experience
desc: Location! Just a 50m walk to a dedicated elevator access directly to outram park MRT station. We also had a seamless check-in process handed by Ms. Ann on reception desk, we arrived at 12 and since our room is ready we can directly checked in, our splash room was great also with a pool view, interior is also beautiful. Will recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fair rate with good services

title: Nice Hotel and Impressive Service
desc: I had a night stay at this hotel on April with my friends, and I really like this hotel because it's next to the underground, and 5-10 min walk to China Town. Room has a nice design, clean, and comfy bed. baht amenity is good quality. Room size is really OK. In addition, wardrobe has doors for 2 side, one side open from bedroom, and another side open from baht room, so it's easy to take some clothes when you're in bathroom. one more thing that i really love is about handy phone, it's a complimentary service from hotel and it's useful for us to call my friends. I'm really impress with hotel staff, room, and service so much. I really hope to stay at this hotel again for my next trip to Singapore.

title: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!
desc: Traveled frequently over the last 3 years and had some very good stays but this hotel and room was definitely one of the best I've ever been in. Positives: Very clean, huge room, free smartphone with data to use on your stay, centrally located, right next to train station (a direct lift to the train station from the hotel!). All amenities close by, trendy look and feel. Great service and friendly staff. Negatives: None! Staff were amazing and offered a free upgrade (much appreciated). Had a pool view as well. nothing more to say then this will be my only choice when i return to Singapore. Well done Dorsett and keep it up.

title: good hotel with bad restaurant,
desc: I have stayed at the Dorsett multiple times, because of it's location. Very Good: Staff, Housekeeping. Bad: Restaurant. Breakfast is not up to standard. I cannot advise to take a cocktail there or have diner there. This is way too poor. Needs a huge turnaround, management! weak weak weak. Watch out: Bathrooms with glass doors: Okay for solo travelers, but to stay there as a couple? i don't advise it. Small pool but well taken care of. Gym is also small but OK. The dark shower room next to the gym was offered as a change room... next to an open toilet.... sorry.... suddenly thaught that I was not that desperate for a shower anymore. A disgrace. Advise to management: The hotel basically is a dissapointment. It looks like a 5* but there are too many weaknesses. Change

title: Dorsett Hotel in Singapore
desc: I got upgraded to a 2 story loft with a king size bed on the second floor. I so enjoyed the automatic curtains. The rooms are plenty big by Singapore standards. Great location. I could walk just about anywhere in a matter of minutes! They even offer you a Handy phone to make international calls from. I stayed for 4 nights. I don't think the rug got vacuumed while I was there though.

title: Lay over for üáªüá≥
desc: The dorsett Singapore has everything you need for a Comfortable stay. Friendly staff make for a pleasant experience. Great pool and ok gym are good for those who need exercise after a long flight. Situated perfectly next to Chinatown it's in the hub of where all things happen. Easy walk through the sort of marina Bay sands area. Rooms whilst clean are tired and in need of a makeover. The blackout blinds are fantastic. The pillows and bed super comfortable. The shower had a dual head option and was superb. Great value for money.

title: Excellent hotel
desc: This is a very good hotel and excellent value for money! Rooms are not so big, but they are nice and modern and very clean. Pool and gym is small, but its sufficient. Breakfast was good. The free smartphone with unlimited calls/internet is awesome. You always have your personal hotspot along with you for free wifi! Location is also very convenient, right on top of a metro station and close to plenty of restaurants in chinatown! Overall this is very good value for money!

title: Enjoyed this hotel
desc: Spent three nights here in a room with a balcony. Good clean room, with excellent walk in shower. Room fairly small but expected that. Mini bar and fridge which you can store your own items. Good A/C and nice view from the balcony. Had some drinks in the bar/restaurant but didn't eat there. Lots of places within easy reach. On top of the MRT so very convenient for the airport line. Would recommend to all.

title: Extention of planned holiday
desc: We had stayed somewhere else in Singapore for 3 days, and decided at the last minute not to go to Malaysia, but extend our stay on the island. The Dorsett was perfectly situated next to a tube station, and 200m from Chinatown. The hotel is great, rooms are comfy, pool is lovely, but it is the staff who make it! Right from checking in, through help with getting around, meals, even to checking out and after, they were always so helpful. Can't wait to come back!

title: Slow check in, average rooms, average service
desc: Pros: Decent location, with a few restaurants within walking distance, though not as central as other hotels 3 blocks away. Relatively new, so the rooms feel clean and airy. The gym was small, but at least not too crowded. Cons: Check in was slow. I was there by 1 PM, just an hour before actual check in time which is at 2. My reservation was fully paid and I specified a queen/king room, but they didn't have anything other than a twin room until "exactly 2 PM". In which case I left my luggage and returned at 2:30 PM. Also a bit clumsy check in process. They had forgotten to return my passport until I reminded them of it. There was likewise a queue building up. The lobby was overwhelming in a not-so-good way (rather... flashy for my tastes), but the room was underwhelming.

title: Wonderful Experience
desc: My Singapore trip was superb and stay in Dorsett was a wonderful experience. Very nice decor and calm and quiet room with best of class room service and amenities. I loved staying a week here. Thanks team Dorsett.

title: A treat!
desc: We stayed here for one night and it was perfect! The staff is so friendly and nice. The rooms are clean, comfortable and big. The swimming pool and the gym were a perfect extra. Location is noce too, close to the metro and there are nice restaurants in the area!

title: Lovely Dorsett
desc: This hotel got its own lift or elevator from the MRT subway exit. You will see overhead signs saying Dorsett Hotel Lift. This is very convenient as you do not have to get wet when raining or walk in the sun. It is in a very good location close to the MRT, Chinatown and major shopping centres. Very nice, small but elegant modern lobby is the first thing you will see. The reception staffs are very polite and helpful. We stayed in a deluxe room which is spacious, clean, with large wall to wall window with a view of the city. The bed is very comfortable. The quality of the room and the service are very comparable if not better than to some of the 4 stars hotel I stayed in. There is free fast wifi and a beautiful swimming pool also with a nice view of the city. One thing quirky (or

title: Perfect place to explore Singapore
desc: First thing to like about that hotel is it's location. It is right above Outram Park MRT station : follow exit H, take the elevator then, once on the street level, turn on your left and the entrance of the hotel is a few meters aways. It is right next to Chinatown market with lots of shops to eat. We also appreciate the staff attitude : always smiling, polite and helpful. The rooms are spacious enough to our opinion. We got upgraded to Deluxe executive room which was very nice, with a big bath tube.We didn't use the restaurant so cannot comment on the food quality.

title: very good location, quiet
desc: The location is very good, just by the side of MRT station. You may take the lift down to the station and up to the hotel. At the same time, you may reach the hotel and go to airport via MRT very easily, room is small but quiet

title: Convenient location and fair $$$
desc: Dorsett is located in a very convenient spot right on top of the Outram Park MRT station. It only took 40 minutes to get there from the Changi Aiport. As we arrived during off peak hours, the trip costs less than S$3 per person which is much better off than shuttle or taxi. The hotel is also very close to Chinatown where all the yummy food courts and hawker centres are, all are within 10 minutes walking distance. One must go to the Maxwell Food Centre where you can taste the yummiest Hainesese chicken rice (stall 11 Tian Tian). Also you just go across the road where Peoples Park Complex is (use the footbridge from Lucky Chinatown Plaza) to have a nice foot massage - 45 minutes for S$18! You definitely need one after all the shopping you do in Singapore. I like their

title: Nice hotel
desc: We enjoyed 2 nights stayed there. The hotel is very convenient that it is located next to the MRT station. As told by locals, taxi fee is not much more expensive than MRT tickets fee for a family ( 4 people ). So I asked the hotel staff for calling taxi every day and find that they are helpful and efficient! The swimming pool is not big and the view isn't very nice as there is a construction site nearby. But the pool is free entrance that I think it is worthy to spend time here.

title: Great value for Singapore
desc: Booked this hotel online for a very reasonable price and was delighted to discover how much more expensive the standard rates were after we booked in. Extremely comfortable room with excellent pillows and towels although the bathroom was quite small. Location on the edge of Chinatown suited us fine.

title: uncomfortable service in restaurant
desc: The room cleaner is amiable but a short hair waitress with glasses in the restaurant is fierce.The location is very nice and the room smells good.The swimming pool is on third floor and the water is clean

title: Convenience is the name of the game
desc: The hotel looks very attractive as you walk into the lobby making it welcoming. Staff were polite and helpful. Room was clean. I requested a king size double bed, which was just a combination of 2 single beds. That was disappointing. The sliding door between the sleeping area and the bathroom was unusual. Would have preferred a permanent wall to block off the light coming through from the bathroom. The toilet and shower shares a swinging door. The hotel is very close to Chinatown, about a 7-10 min walk. So amenities were readily available. The hotel is above an MRT exit, but not directly above the MRT station. So expect some walking to Outram station.

title: Love it!!
desc: I stayed there for 2 nights Pro ‚úß next to Subway station. ‚úß1 station away from China town (walking distance) and Harbourfront station ‚úßClean room and staffs are friendly. ‚úß The hotel offered a complimentary smart phone to use during our stay. Con Don't have any really. ‚úß Don't recommend a duplex room to Family with kids, Senior citizen

title: Another good stay
desc: Had five nights here, checking out of room 619 26/3/17. Was greeted warmly by reception staff at check-in who advised that my room was upgraded to a deluxe room from my normal Dorsett room. I pleasantly surprised. The deluxe room has more space which made quite a difference. There was a welcoming letter from management a fruit selection. I think I prefer the bathroom layout in the Dorsett room. It allows more space for personal things and also has more separation between the room and bathroom which enhances privacy. During my visit the Director of Rooms introduced himself - he reminded me that this was my ninth stay at the Dorsett Hotel. It was a pleasant meeting and I thanked him for the room upgrade which also gave me a chance to comment on the bathroom as above. All in

title: Great Location & Awesome Pool
desc: We stayed at the Dorsett Hotel 2 nights ago and found it well located. Right next to the MRT, short walk to Chinatown, walk behind the hotel to restaurants and nightlife. The walk to Clarke Quay is about 15mins but nice and flat. The Hotel is like new, awesome pool. Rooms are a good size also. Will be back again soon.

title: Short business trip
desc: Was here on a business trip. The hotel is very centrally located hence why we chose it, within walking distance to Chinatown. Located next to Outram Park MRT which as two lines running through it. The entrance to MRT is right next to hotel's. Room was decent sized and staff was ok.

title: Fantastic Hotel in China Town
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights in a deluxe room, the room was big with a king size bed a huge window which had a great view of the city, universal plug sockets, nice bathroom with separate shower, fantastic location, direct entry to Oultram Park MRT. There was nothing I could fault about this hotel, just remember when arriving by MRT at Oultram Park take the New Bridge Road Exit otherwise you may end up on the opposite side of the road. We did not take the breakfast option so can't comment on that. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Also the pool was fantastic very long max depth was only 1.2mtrs

title: New, cozy establishment
desc: Wonderful for a chill out staycation with friends! - new furnishes, tastefully designed and good use of space -Within walking distance to all major Chinatown hawkers -quaint bars and bookstores on a street just behind the hotel - stayed on the third floor with easy access to pool and gym (well equipped with full set of dumbells) -walking distance to Duxton, pay $6 to get onto the Skybridge for a breathtaking panoramic view of Singapore city skyline -Handysmart phone in room to help tourists get around - no complimentary parking though, $8 for hotel guests (when we exited we're supposed to have paid about $33 overnight) Strongly recommended, the price is very reasonable too!

title: Clean hotel,friendly staff and nice location
desc: I stayed in Dorsett with my friends last April 2016 . Hotel room Price Met my expectation all the staff are accommodating and friendly , I love my room it was big and clean . They also give me a tray of fruits upon arrival . This hotel is near to the Train station walking distance to China town Lots of restaurant near by and there's a good restaurant across . I will recommend this hotel to my friend visiting SG.

title: Singapore business and pleasure
desc: I had a late arrival and found everything complete for my stay. The night registration clerk on duty was extremely helpful. I could not have expected any more. My room was 421 which faced the Police Commission Complex. Very nice blue glass building, but not much of a view. I found the room to be very clean and comfortable. I had requested a large room and the room would have been great for two people - King size bed. Rooms are always smaller at all hotels in Singapore. We needed an extra fold away bed so it was crowded for three people. The bathroom facilities were excellent. The bed extremely comfortable and made for wonderful nights sleep. The refrigerator well stocked a bit pricey so recommend you make a run to a close by convenient store. I found breakfast also

title: Surprising perk!
desc: The hotel offered a smart phone with free Internet and free local calls as well as international calls to some countries! This was great to have around the city and being connected and not having to purchase a local sim. Great service indeed! Rooms and hotel is comfortable though the breakfast can be improved.

title: This hotel is soooo unfriendly.
desc: This hotel at the end of china town, next to outram MRT is reasonably located, though not like those on riverside. The hotel room is small. No bed side table is there on left side of bed. There is no electricity point to plug in kettle unless you use the floor to keep the kettle. No point to charge tour devices on the study table haa been provided. The toilet is just the worst of all that i have ever seen. The door knob of the sliding door was missing and door could not be closed. The shower floor is of glazed tiles!!!!!. I slipped and broke my back. The hotel staff is non cooperative and the complimentary breakfast is not served at room. Front desk is ok. Diana was helpful. Avoid the hotel. Singapore has many great hotels.

title: Must be better places to stay in Singapore
desc: Had a awful time with the reception staff over the use of a Visa debit card instead of a Credit Card.Staff would not take a deposit to cover expenses such as room service or dinning at their restaurant.Made us feel terrible.Have traveled all over the world and this has been the first time that this has been a issue.Staff were almost robotic and lacked any empathy.Their buffet breakfast was too expensive at $S65.As I work in the travel and tourism industry I will Definitely not be recommending any of my clients stay at the Dorsett.

title: location, location, location !
desc: Stayed at the Dorset hotel for 5 nights during a recent visit to Singapore. The rooms were clean and quiet and the staff very helpful and attentive. Breakfast was adequate but no more than that. This hotel wins, however, on its location. It is next to the Outram park MRT station and only a few minutes walk from the centre of the Chinatown district which makes getting about the city easy as well as being a great location for good food.

title: Great location
desc: Great location to get around the city and especially China town. Hotel is just right above Outram MRT station Room is well presented and the shower is perfect after a long day. Staff are friendly. Hotel provides mobile phone (with 4G) for tourist to get around Singapore. Good and nice hotel.

title: Quick Stopover
desc: At MYR Outram Station. 35 mins on train from Terminal 2. and less than 3 Singapore dollars. Room quite large. Comfortable and clean. Easy MRT to Bay of Gardens and Chinatown. Easy commute anywhere from this Hotel. Large pool. Upper median price

title: Saavy Singapore
desc: Stayed at the Dorsett Hotel in Singapore for 3 nights. Location is terrific for finding many, many restaurants plus the Chinese market (an education in and of itself). You can eat as lavishly or as simply as you would like as dining can get quite expensive-- even small, thin pizza & 2 beers was $57cdn without tax or tip. Hotel has small size rooms but is quite a lovely hotel with an amazing roof top pool. Beautiful with the lights on at night. Included breakfast was very substantial with many Asian & American options. Staff very friendly and helpful. Within walking of a fair bit of shopping plus a good walk will get you to the Marina Bay Sands & the gorgeous gardens...beautifully lit up at night. Fantastic 'food court' at the base of Marina Bay Sands hotel or go to the top for

title: Short stay in Singapore
desc: Great room, amazing shower! Really helpful and friendly staff. Great location prefect to get around the city and especially China town. Room really well presented and cleaned every day by very helpful staff. And a wonderful view from the roof garden! Can't fault it at all!

title: excellent
desc: The location is really nice. It is very near to China Town where we can find anything regarding chinese foods and nice gifts of Singapore with affordable price. And the Outram Park MRT Station just the next building from the hotel. The hotel service was good and they served us with king size bed. Hotel's ambient also nice, cleanness was excellent. I have also recommended this hotel to my friends and they were there at the end of January, ofcourse their testimony for this hotel was also good. Me and my family have plan for visiting this hotel for our next trips to Singapore.

title: Disappointinf
desc: I stayed here for a recent business trip and was disappointed by the Dorsett. Customer service was ok but while the room was sufficient it was rather dated and had a 'well used' feel about it. Unfortunately, to top it off, the breakfast available was terrible! I wouldn't recommend this as a good hotel for business travellers and wouldn't stay again. There are much nicer hotels available for the price.

title: spent two weeks with mixed report
desc: Arrived day after Christmas. First few days we had a rough time with the air conditioning system, housekeeping ( not enough towels ). The Manager (Jean) was VERY understanding and moved us to a corner room, very quiet and filled with light. The hotel restaurant food was a bit high priced, good tasting but compared with the thousands of local eats it was no contest. The front desk was VERY accommodating and responsive to repeated towel shortage. The rooms are very quiet and compact. Good mattresses and adequate restrooms. Good value overall and the location was superb. Close to China town, MART subway/ train bus cab Etc. Again , super good staff. Carpets in hallways were not kept up. Executive office was well equipped. Internet was fast. Liked the free smart phone with free

title: Lovely Weekend in Singapore
desc: We spent a lovely weekend in Singapore staying in Dorsett Singapore. And overall we enjoyed it very much. The hotel is new and modern, with well designed rooms floors and lobby. Is located near Chinatown that can be easily reached by foot. We got a rather small room that was quite comfortable. Highlight is a feature called "handy" which is a complementary offer of the hotel. It enables you not only to make international calls to selected countries, its you personal 3/4g hotspot for the trip. The outdoor pool on the third floor offers refreshment during the hot day and has a comfortable size to swim. Currently it's not too relaxing as a lot of noise comes from the construction site on the other road side (no worries you won't hear a thing of it in your room). Only

title: vacation @singapore
desc: this hotel is located in a good location(near outram mrt) the room is new and clean. staff is friendly. but no supermarket around here ,need to buy before you back to the hotel. the hotel provide mobilephone to connect4g. from hotel can get to changi airport directly

title: Confortable Stay
desc: Had a 5 days working visit to Spore. Checked into Dorsett at 11.30 am. I was given a room straight away even though there was a sign saying check in time is 2pm. Room was clean enough for me. Breakfast was good. It has a beautiful swimming pool and a well equipped gym. Was impressed with the gym as the equipment there are all high end type. They also provide a handy smart phone where you can carry it along with you anywhere, local call are free with that smart phone and internet data can be connected to your own handphone. The smart phone made my life much easier. There was no need to buy a prepaid phone number.

title: Good, but not much character.
desc: Very handy for the MRT and the direct line to Changi. Everything here is very efficient and business like, but hasn't got the usual smiley faced staff that you see in most other hotels in Singapore. Our room was good, comfortable and a great bathroom. The pool was good with a nice area to sit and the fitness room was reasonably equipped. We picked the Dorset due to the proximity to China Town, but we'll probably stay in a different part of the city next time and use the MRT. We thought the hotel expensive when they put taxes on.

title: Great Hotel and near Chinatown
desc: Stayed at the Dorsett in late Feb - still had the Chinese New Year regalia in New Bridge Road and all round Chinatown The Dorsett is modern style (If a little tired in places) and friendly - got upgraded to one of the rather quirky Mezzanine Floor Rooms with the bed raised via a stairs and glazed - it was OK but would actually prefer a single level room... The real beauty of this Hotel is that it is literally a 5min walk down to to Central Chinatown /Pagoda and my favorite shops and restaurants..

title: Average Hotel
desc: The room was fine but the cleaning service need to be more detail. The room carpet has a lot of stain and it did not seems to be properly vacuum. The bathroom has a bit of mold on the door seals.The good things were bed was very comfortable,TV is flat screen and the hotel is located above the outram MRT station.Staffs were very friendly too.

title: One of Best hotel with good quality and value; Great hospitality
desc: Great experience for our 2 connecting rooms - from booking time to before arrival and staying there, the staff showed attention to details and took nothing for granted. My elderly parents were warmly welcomed when they opened their room to a pleasant surprise. We were indeed grateful to the team who set the room up so hospitably to celebrate my parents' 55th wedding anniversary in a private manner plus mum's 80th birthday, We want to give the team a big 'Thumbs up' for that. So glad we chose Dorsett. Rooms were cleaned and well taken care of. The downside for us was that the 2 pillows per bed were a bit too soft - I guess it is a personal thing but caused a bit of neckache the next morning (could do so with a 3rd pillow then to prop it up). Thank you, Dorsett and the team

title: Not a business hotel
desc: Stayed here three nights for business... and while all the traditional elements of a business hotel exist, do not be fooled, this hotel is filled with tourists; not business travelers. Hence, there is a bit more noise in the hall ways and common spaces. Budget and price are "you get what you pay for" style. There is not a bathtub or vanity sink with space to spread out in the bathroom. Closet and storage are tiny and there is no hair dryer in the room. There was also NO hot water (perhaps this is Singapore style "warm" water) since its always necessary to take a cold shower in this city on the equator. The bed and linens were comfortable and housekeeping came punctually every day. AC controls worked very well and lighting in the room was very decent. Water was on offer as a

title: A disappointing second visit
desc: Unlike my first visit to the Dorsett, this was not an enjoyable stay. It was like staying at a completely different hotel. The staff / management were not as friendly, I felt like their whole attitude had switched from a friendly, caring hotel to a corporate style, money making vibe The room was small and poorly designed, there was a gap in the wall large enough that you could see directly into the bathroom, not such a huge problem given that the bathroom door needed to be open so that I could enter and exit the shower. Poorly designed room, what a mess. The tiles on the wall of the shower were not cleaned properly, I removed black dirt with my nails to see if it was permanent or just dirty, it was the latter. The towels provided were old and ragged with marks on them. The

title: Close to MRT
desc: The Dorsett is a modern hotel and the front desk staff were professionally friendly. The room we had was adequately sized and adequately appointed with a large, firm bed while the adjoining bathroom contained a shower and separate spa bath. The hotel is in a great location to access the Outram MRT, the entrance to which is from the lift that goes to the Dorsett Residences and is located on the opposite side of the car entrance to reception. For some reason house-keeping came at 8am, despite our advice to reception for a later visit. Nice views of the skyline from the Level 7 roof garden.

title: Business short stay
desc: Early of Feb 2017, My company was booked Dorseet hotel. The Room is clean and got free upgrade room from superior room to the reception Deluxe room. Free Wife access and comfy bed to stay in this hotel. Easy access to China town.

title: Spend my NYE here!
desc: Dorsett has a luxurious architecture with all the glasses and shining floors. Room was little bit small for me, however Dorsett try to fulfill every needs of the customer. The bathroom was a failure yet unique. It has very limited space so, it was pretty hard to move around there. Another failure was the door cupboard also work as the bathroom partition between the room and the bathroom. Although, there was a small gap between it so when I was doing my "business" there I had to kept on eye to that gap made sure nobody was peeped on me. Lol. Front office staff was awesome. They were really attentive to us. Thank you very much for the Duty Manager, Jean Low whose arrange a complimentary birthday cake for my Mom and Sister. üòÜ Sadly, all of those experience was undermined by

title: Good value for Chinatown hotel
desc: Great location for the value price: subway station entrance is located a stone's throw away. There's a 24h MacDonalds down the road. Better choices just 10 mins' walk away - try the wide selection of superb local food at Chinatown complex Smith St (2nd flr, no aircon). If you prefer a mall setting, walk to nearby Chinatown Point with its many restaurants. The hotel is clean and relatively new but there is a musty smell in the room. Bathroom comes with a modern translucent glass door.

title: Great Location
desc: We stayed for 3 nights before a cruise. The check in and room were well worth the money, clean and comfortabel, The beds were very good. Some mentioned the bathroom and sliding door as an issure, no problem for us. The view is good, as we could watch construction of the new MRT stop. Being close to Chinatown and on top ot the Outram MRT stop was great. Now if someone cannot walk a lot, this would not be a plus. But we used the MRT for two days. We did not have breakfast incl. and it was not worth it to us to spend the extra $ for it. Also easy to walk to Maxwell Food court and then to Chinatown. The staff was friendly and we had no issues at all. One could spend triple at other hotels, but one cannot beat Dorsett for what they offer. We did not use the pool or exercise room, but

title: ROOMS TOO SMALL FOR 2 AND 2 SUITCASES
desc: We booked the Dorsett being a new hotel and heard some positive feed backs. The location fitted as also since we hadn't been for long in China Town and it is sitting on Top of the Outran Park MRT station giving you full access to Singapore if you know how to use the MRT system. The rates looked very attractive as well but the location is just not Orchard Road area and as such it has to be cheaper. The rooms are a complete disappointment wit a size of about 350 x 350 cm for the room with two twin beds , plus about 120 x 150 cm for the entrance and about 200 x 200 cm for the shower bath. Sitting at the writing desk one could not even put the chair back since the chair was blocked by one of the beds. We missed power points , the lighting in the bath room much too dark but the

title: Easy, Comfortable & Convenient
desc: We had one night in Singapore & wanted to be near Chinatown. We were also traveling as a family so many hotels don't have large enough rooms or connecting rooms. The Dorsett was chosen based on connecting rooms. We requested an early check-in & received a standard 'we will check when you get here' answer. I thought this was fair, we were not willing to pay to get in early. Luck was on our side & we were able to check in at 9am! The staff was overly friendly, booked our taxi for the next morning, made sure we knew where we were going when we left that evening. The pool is relaxing & when we were there it was very quiet. I normally don't spend this kind of money on a hotel but it was very last minute & we needed connecting rooms.

title: Nice!
desc: The location of the hotel is really good, near from China town, and lots of local and international restaurants, the gyn is OK and the outdoor swimming pool is really nice, the staff is friendly! Check on line the week deals that they normally do.

title: Convienent to Chinatown plus easy access to Outram Park MRT.
desc: Checked out of room 324 yesterday 1st Jan 17 after a quick four night trip to Singapore for New Year. . This is a pleasant hotel, with welcoming reception staff, housekeeping looked after the room ok although there was no bath mat left after Sunday's clean, concierge and bell hops are cheerful and assisted with taxi's as required. Upon checkout I left a feedback form about my stay including comments on the towels, since then I have received a nice response from the Director of Rooms - much appreciated. On Friday night I went up to the rooftop garden on the seventh floor ..it's an open area with views mainly to the North and South of the hotel - the view is ok although there are taller buildings around - it's interesting looking over towards the expanding Outram Park MRT

title: Dorsett Stay
desc: Friendly Staff. Quick check in. $8/- per exit car park fees. Good location for Chinatown walk Gym on 3rd Level. 2 Treadmills. Next to subway for easy access downtown. Free wifi. Good restaurants in the vicinity.

title: Small rooms
desc: Two things worked best for me 1.MC donalds was at a bit walking distance 2. China town. Loved the camera style bell on the door side and over decor of the hotel.The concept of mobile phone provided by the hotel was excellent. Room sizes too small and bathroom style i didn't like.

title: Comfortable and convenient
desc: The hotel is very conveniently located, it's just beside Outram MRT and it even has it's own lift directly from the station (you will need to walk a very short distance to the entrance though). Staff are very friendly and helpful. The room is also very clean, including the toilet and bathroom. Only downside is that the queen bed in our room is actually two double beds placed side by side, but it's hardly noticeable. The Handy smartphone is also very helpful!

title: Good location MRT and Chinatown
desc: Walking distance to Chinatown and MRT. The location was so suitable and having a MRT station across the road was the biggest advantage. Not only it saved me lots of transport money but it also gave me access to many places in Singapore. A side note - be prepared to walk lots and have a drinking bottle of water with you. The room which I got was away from the lift and on a higher floor. Both of these were a big plus. The bed was a two single bed placed side by side and became a double bed. The middle of the bed could be felt if one spread across. The bathroom was small and had no privacy if you were sharing the room with a friend or friends. Housekeeping was excellent. Little touches such as robes and slippers were a welcome. I used them. I will visit and book again. Thank

title: Comfortable family stay, with all the facilities you could need.
desc: The Dorsett hotel was our second choice, after we checked into our first hotel and swiftly left again as it was horrendous. The Dorsett staff are very polite and accommodating, helping you with anything you could need, from taxis and ticket bookings through to a money exchange service available at the front desk. The hotel itself is modern with a classical twist, with beautiful chandeliers and a grand piano in the lobby. The rest of the hotel is kept up with a similar theme and we found it to be immaculately clean and well kept. Facilities available on site include money exchange, restaurant, 24 hour front desk, mini bar, swimming pool and a gym to name but a few. The location of the hotel we found to be excellent, with it being almost on top of Outram park MRT station

title: Cute Concept and Comfortable Bed
desc: I had a Christmas celebration with my friends over the weekend, so I booked the loft room. It was really cosy. The hotel is conveniently located near the train station. There are lots of chill-out cafes near by. The upper level of the loft consisted of the bed and a TV. I loved how comfortable the bed was. There was also a hanging TV in front of the bed, so it was nice to just chillax and watch TV. There was a sofa-bed on the lower level of the loft which I felt looked dirty. The bathroom was spacious, and there was a rain shower, which was nice. Breakfast at the Papasan restaurant was just so-so to me. It was too small, and did not have enough table during the peak hour. Food was replenished frequently, so thats a plus.

title: Really nice hotel in good location
desc: I stayed at the Dorsett hotel for 3 nights in November 2016. The main reasons to pick this hotel was the good room rate and the location close to MRT station. At check in they gave me a room facing the main road. As there's a big construction site just opposite, it's not a good idea to stay on this side because some of the construction noises were REALLY loud. So I asked front desk to change to a room on the other side. Staff was very helpful to find a new room and just a few minutes later I was able to change the room. Which was really quiet :) The room is everything you'd expect from that hotel category. No complaints at all. Room size was very good for Singapore standards. There's a nice roof top pool (that specific part of the roof isn't on the top of the building, it's on

title: Near Singapore General Hospital & Chinatown
desc: Chinatown has changed to become a heritage area replete with old style houses functioned as pubs, restaurants, shops, bookstores besides the usual wet market, the usual Chinese stores, and Chinese medicine shops. Dorsett has an ideal location to take advantage of that change. It provides the free handphone for you to bring along although I never use it since normally I subscribe to 3 in 1 package provided by my phone provider. When you stay here, you can skip the breakfast option since there are many great cafes in surrounding neigbourhood. The only drawback I can think of is the bed which can be quite hard for some people and he cold air-con. But I have no problems since I have back problem so I can use the bed, I can just use blanket to cover me up, and I can just buy bottled

title: Beautiful hotel,mrt downstairs
desc: Nice hotel with the best bed I have ever slept on!!! Staff are amazing and will do anything for guests. The Dorsett has access directly to mrt via dedicated hotel lift. Room service is fantastic and priced really well. 711 around corner, beautiful little parks behind the hotel with private homes and cafes.Would highly recommend the Dorsett hotel to any one visiting Singapore.

title: Great value for money hotel
desc: Took the connecting rooms option since came with family of five. Rooms were good enough. Room cleaning service was also good. Location near to Chinatown and Outram Park MRT is a big advantage and plus for this hotel! Service personnel at counters were friendly, helpful and nice. Checkin and checkout was smooth. Pool was clean. Really value for money hotel. Will recommend to friends for sure!

title: Decent hotel in a decent location
desc: Now I stay at the sister hotel in Shanghai a lot and get the VIP treatment so my stay here may not be the same. This hotel is in a decent location, I do prefer the more central area around city hall, and close to Chinatown. I know Singapore is Chinese why do they need a Chinatown! That said its an interesting look back to the origins of Singapore. Remember its really a piece of Malaysia, not really China. In terms of price I would say its very very good. In terms of access to the MRT system and restaurants its also very very good In terms of rooms and cleanliness I would say its on par with all hotels in its star range. The staff are good, efficient and hardworking I was mildly disappointed. In fairness, as I mentioned at the opening, I am used to the VVIP treatment for

title: Wonderful Stay!
desc: First of all, the service is top notch. We were allowed early access to our room and were able to store our gear and go out for the day. Anything we asked of the staff, they were happy to assist us with. Our room was clean and reasonably sized but not large. Beds were comfortable and AC and WIFI worked well. The loaner smartphone made it really easy to get around with gps and we could look up restaurants and attractions on the go. Also it offered free international calls to the US and some other countries. The rooms are reasonably priced. Super easy access to Outram Park MRT station right outside. The location is very close to Chinatown and Tiong Baru neighborhoods where you can find some great local foods in restaurants and hawker centres. Highly recommended.

title: ‚ùìis it a 4 star?
desc: I wonder if it meets what I find as one who entitles 4 stars? The great location asks for a quite room . The staff is kind and busy. The food is in breakfast is tired...yes looks like from yesterday . So it might work for you to sleep and commute at the town.

title: Worst Christmas eve
desc: How can express my feeling when I saw this dirtiest bed sheet and pillow after my midnight check in. Cleanses is key to any hotel not an exceptional for this overdecorated style one. Worst hotel experience ever ! And today is Christmas Eve ! Á≥üÈÄè‰∫Ü„ÄÇÊ≤°ÊúâÊØîËøôÊõ¥Âä†Á≥üÁ≥ïÁöÑÂú£ËØûËäÇ‰∫Ü„ÄÇÈÖíÂ∫óËßÜÊ∏ÖÊ¥Å‰∏∫ÂÑøÊàèÔºåÂú®ÂÖ®‰∏ñÁïå‰ΩèËøáÂæàÂ§ö‰∏çÂêåÁ±ªÂà´ÁöÑÈÖíÂ∫óÊ∑±Ê∑±ÁöÑÊáÇÂæóÂπ≤ÂáÄÊ∏ÖÊ¥ÅÊòØÈÖíÂ∫óÈóÆÊàëÂÆ¢‰∫∫Â∏¶Êù•ÁöÑÊúÄÂü∫Êú¨ÁöÑÊúçÂä°„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúËøûËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÊú¨Ê∫êÈÉΩ‰∏¢ÊéâÁöÑËØùÁúüÊòØÂæàÈöæÊàêÂ∞±‰∏ÄÁï™‰∫ã‰∏ö„ÄÇ

title: Highlights of stay
desc: I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone. Very good service!!We have been able to check in early without any charges and the amenities of the hotel is excellent. staff very welcoming and very helpful!! Hotel room in excellent condition and attach details so that the visitor can feel comfortable. Overall very nice stay Keep up your excellent work

title: Thank you for making us feel so "christmas"
desc: Thank you for making my one day trip in Singapore so "Christmas". Was impressed with the Xmas tree and decor. You guy make so much effort to make us feel "Xmas". Service at check in and check out was good and fast. Xmas Tree is very well decorated (as compare to others that I have seen so far). Nice and clean room. Will come back again

title: Fantastic hotel with excelletn staff
desc: We were booked for 2 nights and advised them that we are arriving rather early around 9am. One of our guests is in his 80's and they obliged and provided a room straight away. Staff were nothing but the best during our stay. Will recomend anyday and will stay again. thanks Dorcett

title: Very nice hotel. Good value. Easy train access.
desc: The Dorsett is a well appointed hotel. Ideal for business travellers and tourists. Modern and with good facilities. Nice rooms and an outdoor pool. Access from the airport by train is very easy as the hotel is above an entry to Outram Park MRT station, 2 stops from the main CBD area.Only $2.50 by air conditioned train from Changi airport. prices are very reasonable and the staff very helpful. For those catching late evening flights they will store your bags for free and also give you a bathroom pack with a fresh towel and body wash so you can shower at the swimming pool bathroom before changing to travel. The only downside of the hotel is food options. Having read reviews from other travellers that the breakfast was disappointing, I looked for options outside. There are none

title: 1 night, nice pool
desc: A relaxing swim in the pool. Room very comfortable, trendy and good use of space i think. Very convenient, on top of subway. Breakfast buffet slightly expensive, so I ate enough to skip lunch. A quieter part of town, which was nice too.

title: Centrally Located Hotel in Chinatown
desc: Excellent location with the MRT below (Ourtram Park). Walking distance to Chinatown. Plenty of food available in Chinatown but I would recommend the Maxwell Road Food Centre which is behind the Chinatown Food Street (Smith road I think). There is parking in the next block (the lift is the same lift that goes to the MRT). They still charge Hotel guest for parking (its not complementary). They charge 8 dollars per entry (unlimited hours) or 2 dollars for first hour and additional per hour etc. Check-in & Check-out experience was excellent (friendly, fast & efficient staff). Hotel rooms were as expected for a 4 star. Its clean, good bed, fittings, pillows etc. A bit small for a family of 3 (2 adults & 1 kid) as the bed is either queen size or 2 x single beds. Super single will

title: Very convenient, well appointed
desc: Clean, modern, helpful staff, the location was very convenient- listed above Outram Park MRT. The only issue we had was the pillows weren't great. However, they loan you a smartphone for the duration of the stay which was so helpful when we were out and about- using Google maps, looking at ratings to decide where to go for lunch etc. would absolutely recommend to anyone.

title: Good value for money
desc: Stayed for 4 nights and found the staff very pleasant. The location to Chinatown was very close and handy, however the MRT around the corner was very convenient anyway. We took the $20 pre paid breakfast each morning and was more than happy with this. The room was on the smallish side although the king size bed was great!!! The shower/toilet set up was awkward with shower door doubling up as the shower screen door and toilet door. Overall the room was clean and tidy and was happy for what we paid.

title: Dusty! Im here now while im writing my review
desc: No words to say i am too sorry i am staying here right now Dusty bed Dusty kettle No tea or coffee provided! Poor service I hate this place! It just like they put me inside the storage room! Please anyone just dont come here!!

title: Great stay in convenient location
desc: My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights. The room was great with enough space for our needs whilst exploring Singapore. The pillows were flat and when the room was serviced they were a little haphazard with the towels, but it was always clean and tidy. We used the pool to cool off in the evenings which was great! Being right above the Outram Park MRT was very convenient allowing us to get around very easily. It was a short walk to Chinatown, hawker markets and shopping. The inclusion of a smartphone was invaluable - we used it the whole time we explored to look at things to do, places to eat, where to shop and double check our location if we got a little lost. The phone also allowed for wifi on the go so we could update our social media and check emails away from the hotel.

title: Smart hotel. Great location
desc: Good, comfortable hotel with brilliant proximity to chinatown, Duxton, Tanjong Pagar roads etc. Great if you want to be nearby some cool bars, cafes and restaurants. My room was on the small side but loved the rain shower. The pool area is satisfactory, although faces onto busy, New Bridge road and there is also a large, quite noisy construction site going on right opposite. Great for a dip though if you just want to cool off. There was no noise from construction in my room at all however. Only on the pool deck. My tip: don't do breakfast at the hotel, though I'm sure it's fine. Instead, turn right out the front door of the hotel and walk up the hill a couple of hundred metres or so until you meet the cross street. There you'll find a great (western) cafe/breakfast option

title: Well-located, well-appointed residences
desc: First, location. Right next to the Ourtram Park MRT and Chinatown, with shops, cafes, restaurant and a greenway. The residences are efficient with surprising storage. Kitchen, living area, bedroom with comfortable bed and lots of storage, bath with great shower. On the third floor, there's a patio that goes to the swimming pool. Decor is spare: mirrors are the only decorative item, but it's clean, modern, and everything works. Kitchen has an oven and convection heating surface, two-burner. No microwave. We have stayed here twice and would come again. There's a gym and doorman.

title: Conveniently located
desc: We found this hotel conveniently located near Chinatown and all the opportunities for dining and very affordable compared to other Singapur hotels. Rooms were stylish and had a view and offered everything we needed. We found the mobile phones in every room very convenient. As we travelled in a group of 4, it made communication much easier.

title: A Great Choice
