desc: Booked room type ‚ÄúDorsett room‚Äù Good size room, 22 sqm with a very comfortable king size bed and 40‚Äù LED TV. Free Wi-fi was excellent. Hotel has its own MRT access to Outram Park station. Included in the room is a complimentary smart phone device which has free data included so you can take outside the hotel to using as a map and shopping guide. Staff were helpful, friendly and professional. The only issue I experienced was the fridge was not functioning however a minor glitch and easily fixed. I will stay at this hotel when next in Singapore.

title: Great Place to Stay
desc: I have stayed here several times now and it never disappoints. The rooms are fine and very clean. The staff are fantastic always smiling and willing to help. I had dinner in the restaurant attached to it, good food and great staff too. I had chance to use the pool and gym, very nice indeed. It has a great location it is in Chinatown and if you want to get about the tube station is 1 minute away. Particular praise the general manager and hos two assistants who helped me with storing some equipment there while I was away from the hotel for a few days. Always happy to stay here. See you soon

title: 2 Night Stay
desc: Stayed for 2 nights prior to going on a cruise. The lobby of the hotel is fantastic, very smart and fancy. Downstairs restaurant also very nice. Our room was on the top floor. Found it a little small, however very nice. Bathroom very clean and a good shower. Hotel is across the road from a subway station and within walking distance from Chinatown. Singapore as a city was fantastic, just a shame we only stayed for 2 nights. When we return we will definitely consider the Dorsett again

title: Birthday celebration
desc: Not bad. Celebrated my birthday staycation here. Staffs were very friendly! Even wished me happy birthday. Swimming pool open till 10, hotel room was spacious and well designed. There's malls/food nearby if you're hungry in the middle of the night. Worth the price and recommended!

title: Located in the Quiet Side of Chinatown
desc: I stayed in Dorsett Hotel for 3 nights after moving from the next door hotel. It is your typical business hotel - rooms are clean and functional and the staff very efficient. I stayed in the Dorsett Room. The size of the room is ok for 2 adults. It's more than enough for me as a solo traveler. A bit cramp between the bed and the work station table but not too much that it bothered me. I find the sliding doors that separate the bath area from the bedroom ingenious. It's a design concept that is very popular with many modern hotels these days. But I liked how they utilized it at Dorsett since they have none of those glass snowed-out doors that really do not give enough privacy. They have the doors in dark wood, which goes well with the decor of the room and provide the best

title: Cozy place, easy SMRT access
desc: The best thing about this hotel is the access to SMRT, which you can take elevator from the station directly to the corner of the hotel. The location is in Chinatown, which is around 10-min walking distance to major attractions. The room is clean and comfortable. Nice stay here.

title: Just another hotel
desc: Nice and clean design hotel. The room quite spacious. Small bathroom but nice. Near to MRT station. Nice calm neighborhood and not many things can be explored. Good value as I got insider deal promo from Agoda.

title: Good hotel and good location
desc: We stayed in Dorsett for 2 nights. The hotel has impressing entrance and reception. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was good size and clean. There is free water every day and you can take outside their special phone with applications which help you to locate places in the city. Hotel has a good location, very close to Chinatown and you can access underground from the hotel lift. Nice pool, however the view from the pool is not amazing. Reasonable prize. We would stay there again.

title: Newish hotel near Singapore General Hospital.
desc: There are some places you sty where you know something is not quite perfect but it is hard to put your finger on what. This is one of them. Standard rooms are small, airconditioning requires a PhD to control, cleaning staff unplug the complicated digital clock for some reason so you have to reset it every day and the bathroom is tiny. Nevertheless, the bed was comfortable, the location was perfect for a meeting at the Academia, located in the Singapore General Hospital complex and the Outram Park MTA station (on both the East-West [green] and North-East [purple] lines) is right next door with Chinatown a short walk away. Desk staff were extremely friendly and cheery. For a new hotel, it was disconcerting seeing workman with ladders all day, replacing lights in every room (the

title: Good hotel convenient location
desc: Stayed at this particular hotel on our last trip to Singapore. Nice rooms and facilities but it was its location that made it so good. You could access the underground rail system from their lift and it was virtually on top of the closest station. Rail made it so much more convenient and comfortable to get around the city especially to all the local attractions. The hotel was also located just 100 metres from the Chinatown with its bustling markets and busy eateries. The hotel itself was very nice and has all the amenities that most people look for and the staff were very helpful with any enquiries. We will stay here again without a doubt.

title: Exemplary service!!
desc: We stayed there for 3 nights to celebrate my wife's birthday.. Service was awesome! location is very accessible! near to vivo city and chinatown area.. Thanks ms jean for your awesome service and hospitality!

title: Not bad, but not great
desc: If you're looking for a place to stay in Singapore that is reasonably priced, clean enough, with good facilities and located a short walk from the main sights then the Dorsett isn't a bad option. As a 4 star hotel though in a place like Singapore it just left me wanting a little more; the buffet breakfast was disappointing and extremely overpriced, room service was disappointing and service was lacking, housekeeping seemed to cut a few corners, and the rooms were not always properly cleaned. However, the staff were always friendly and the pool was rarely in use and very well maintained. I'd recommend to anyone who didn't want to spend too much but still wanted to stay in a nice setting within close reach of Chinatown and an easy 20 minute stroll from Clarke Quay.

title: Fine rooms, terrible breakfast
desc: I come here sometimes for work. Pretty decent hotel with friendly staff. The breakfast however is terrible. Not much to choose, terrible coffee, no healthy options. This is the reason I'm considering moving to a different hotel when I have to be in Singapore.

title: Convenient to China Town and Train
desc: Good for short stay. Construction across the street. Very convenient to and from Changi airport, Vivo Mall, China Town and subway line. Rooms fine, but service a bit hit and miss, with general attitude that it wasn't a priority. Still, we found it to be good value.

title: Value for money
desc: What i love the most about this hotel is their "Handy". I found its really convenient throughout my stay since i need to use the data for maps and to check my email all the time during i'm out from the room. by having such facility, my stay become so much enjoyable. Besides from that, i do admit their room is very nice and spacious enough for me who stay alone. The bed and pillow are comfortable, overall i don't have any issue staying at this property. The location is very convenient for those who going to use the public transport, Outram park is just 1 minute walks from the hotel. highly recommend for those who going to Singapore in the near future.

title: Good Hotel good location
desc: The hotel is right on top of a MRT station which makes getting around the city very easy, which is a huge benefit. As for the hotel, the staff are very friendly and willing to assist. Our room was very small which requires planning of every move, there's hardly room to have a suitcase open and two people moving around. The toilet and shower are tiny and separated from the room with a sliding door , which is also the cupboard doorI don't exactly understand this idea. Breakfast is ok, not too much selection for westerners but certainly sufficient. They have a beautiful pool with a sun deck, and a nice gym

title: Free wifi
desc: Wifi is free and fast Hotel is located near the Singapore General Hospital and Chinatown and MRT is also nearby Room facilities ok and staff friendly The only downside was the breakfast buffet which is poor by Asian standards

title: Best Convienent Hotel.
desc: One of a great convenient hotel accommodation in Singapore. Surrounded by lots of amenities, good restaurants, pubs, caf√©s, wine& dine and places of attractions. Emergency health facilities is just a street away. MRT station next door. Hotel staffs very friendly and pro active. Clean and nice hotel. Good wide spreads breakfast. Free "portable" WiFi.

title: Nice hotel
desc: I stayed there because it is near Singapore General Hospital. Right on the MRT from Changi Airport. Outram Park station is just below it. So, as you have guessed, I wasn't in Singapore for fun! The hotel? First impression was good. Nice front office people. Helpful. Pleasant. Efficient. Walked me to the lift until I told them to leave me alone. It's all American. Confusing. They don't have a Ground Floor. That would translate as 1st story. I lived on the 9th floor. Or Ninth Story. Why don't Americans leave stories to authors? Why can't they spell 'autumn'? They have to use 'fall' instead! But I do love my US cousins anyway. Room. Very nice. It had everything. Tea and coffee facility. Good TV. Bath robes. Safe. Usual amenities. Iron and ironing board. Even a 'free mobile

title: Excellent Hotel, great location
desc: Stayed for 3 nights. Price was unbelievable cheap. Spacious room which was particularly quiet. Bed was very large and comfortable, large TV and bottled water provided. Hotel located right above Outram Park station and close to many restaurants and bars. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay and would come back again.

title: An Average Property
desc: An average property . Only plus is it is located just above the MRT station (Outram Park). Bathroom was very small . Breakfast was just OK. Staff were just good. Overall experience is below average and less value for money.

title: Great location
desc: Very near to all important places. 25 minutes walking to merlion. Very close to business centre. Lots of eating options nearby. Somerset mrt station is just a hop and skip. Overall the rooms were great, breakfast spread was also good, not very good for vegetarians.

title: Good value, funky hotel in a great location
desc: Nice hotel with excellent roof top pool and very friendly staff. Funky decor adds to the charm and it's only 5 minutes from China town and lots of independent shops and restaurants. Very close to the metro.

title: Liked it enough to come back
desc: My first stay in the Dorsett was in April 2016. The rooms were very decent with a good strong shower. Location above Outtram park station was ideal. But, all that aside without doubt the helpful, obliging and generally delightful staff are Dorsett's best asset. Hence I am coming back again next week! This time on a business trip. Looking forward to it. Liam McCabe

title: Average Hotel but Good Location
desc: Room : Stayed in a twin room for 2 nights. The room is really small and I do not like the fact that the bathroom entrance is just next to the bed. The room is clean but unfortunately the pillow and the duvet smells bad and the pillows are too soft for my liking. Facilities : Did not have the time to utilize any of the facilities so no comment. But they do provide a smart phone in the room with unlimited data, unlimited local calls and unlimited international call (to certain countries) which we can bring out from the room. Breakfast : The breakfast selection was limited, not much varieties. Staff : Pretty helpful Location : Awesome location which is right above Outram Park MRT Station which make is so convenient.

title: Modern boutique hotel
desc: The hotel is very clean and new. The room is exactly the same with the picture. The staff are very nice and helpful. Easy to get to the subway in 2 minutes and to China town in 5 minutes. The location is great. I enjoy the 4 nights stay in this hotel. Comfort, relax, clean and easily to connect. Recommend!

title: Comfy hotel, convienent location for your stay
desc: This was my fifth stay since October last year, checked out of room 824 yesterday morning after a five day stay. Have booked a "Dorsett" room each time and I must say that the presentation and cleanliness of the room is always consistent. Nice to walk into. The welcome by the porters and reception staff was great - they are motivated, friendly and most definitely helpful. The housekeeping staff responded promptly to any query and are cheerful as you pass in the corridors. My hotel rating of "very good" is a downgrade from excellent in previous reviews. The reason being trays for room service meals were not cleared away promptly after being left outside doors for collection. I checked in around 9pm on the 25th Sep, walking towards my room there were two trays outside of

title: Good hotel, if a little impersonal
desc: I stayed here for two nights as part of a family group. There is a lot to like about this place. Attractive (although pretty small) rooms and public spaces - all spotlessly clean! I also thought it was very well priced for the location and the quality of the rooms. So why only 4 out of 5? I have struggled to put my finger on it, but I think the problem I had was that there is a distinct lack of personality to the Dorsett Hotel. Largely, this is due to the single food/drink space having to work as breakfast room, bar and restaurant and is not really doing any of these well. The slightly industrial decor, uncomfortable furnishing and harsh lighting really don't help. Likewise, the service in this space is a little amateurish and not overly friendly. To underline this

title: Great location, nice for a weekend stay, a few disappointing points
desc: Pros: - Great location, literally above metro station - Nice looking hotel - One of the most amazing things I ever saw is that you get a handy (mobile phone) for use around Singapore with free unlimited internet (+free calls to a few countries) which makes tourist stay so much better - Pleasant and helpful reception Cons: - Nobody cleaned the room/changed sheets/towels during our stay (2 nights). Not a big issue for 2 nights, but disappointing from a 4star hotel which costs this much. I had to call to request clean towels during our second day - On our last day some hotel lady woke us up by knocking and ringing a bell like crazy just to say she needs to check did we use the minibar because it's our check out day, 3 hours before checkout!!! That was very rude and unexpected! -

title: Good location and room, service could be better
desc: The hotel location is great if you want to take the MRT. The room is small and compact but comfortable. Service is okay. The shower temperature fluctuates between hot and cold so I could not enjoy my hot showers after a long day at work. One disappointing experience - I was in a hurry the morning I was checking out and accidentally left my expensive toiletries in the shower. When I called back that night to get them returned to me, the hotel staff said housekeeping had not found my items. Someone is clearly not being honest because I knew exactly where I had left my things and it was not found? I am glad it was not something more valuable or sentimental as I would be very upset about not getting it back.

title: Great hotel in Singapore's Chinatown
desc: This hotel is conveniently located just above an MRT station and is a stroll to the Chinatown precinct of Singapore. You are close to cafes, pubs, restaurants and shopping. Check-in is efficient, the rooms are clean and room service dining is fast. There is a rooftop garden, gym with swimming pool and outdoor jacuzzi, and guests can choose to make free use of a smartphone during their stay.

title: Great hotel but breakfast hmmm..
desc: Pros : Great location, near MRT, nice room and lobby interior and most importantly, they have a handy phone where you can make free international call and use it for internet hotspot. Cons : Breakfast needs to improve. More spread if possible. Highly recommended and definitely will stay here again.

title: Great Location
desc: The best thing about the Dorsett is the location, the staff a very charming. I didn't back breakfast in the attached cafe Papasan because on arrival i wasn't that keen on the food. The pool is lovely, my room was upgraded to an executive and it was plenty large enough and had great free wifi. The carpet in the room was the really poor, i didn't want to walk barefooted in the room and i certainly didn't entertain doing my morning yoga. That said given its proximity to public transport and China Town this is a really great hotel and great value.

title: A glitzy star of a hotel showing a little age unfortunately
desc: Dorsett Singapore is one hotel which dazzles both literally and figuratively. Located near the Chinatown area and right atop Outram Park MRT station, the hotel lobby is outfitted with an ensemble of carefully curated chandelier designs which illuminates the immediate reception area in a sensually warm fashion; this is neatly complemented by a cast of polite staff, ranging from the meticulous porter (whom we encountered on the way in and was ushering a Thai couple to a hailed taxi before wishing them godspeed with a humble traditional bow) to the attentive, cheery staff ( special shout-out to a Miss Angelia who served us with great care during both checking in and out). Even the duty manager paused to send a greeting our way despite obviously being seen rushing to someplace else.

title: Love this hotel!
desc: Very clean and room size is just nice. Very convenient to get around by train as it has a connecting entrance to the MRT station. China Town is around the corner, good access to food. The only draw back is the gym is a little tiny and it is quite pack in the morning.

title: Highly Recommended!
desc: Arrived at the hotel a little past midnight last 3rd of October but the check in is still very efficient and fast. Came from a very tiring flight and I must say the room that we were upgraded in was clean, nice and really made us relax and comfortable. Thanks to the friendly and accomodating front desk team especially to Kenny and the receptionist that check us in(forgot he name bec of tiredness) for the hospitality and the Upgrade! Checked out yesterday but will definitely be back! Highly Recommended!

title: Very nice hotel
desc: Good hotel, modern, clean, nice rooftop pool, good AC, friendly staff. Best thing is that it's right above an MRT station so access to the rest of Singapore is cheap and easy. Rooms were quiet and comfortable, not huge but very luxurious.

title: 'Handy Andy' unexpected bonus
desc: Wonderful hotel with very friendly staff. The MRT station Outram park lift was within 30 metres of the hotel which was great. The biggest unexpected bonus was the Handy which was a free smartphone with unlimited calls, data and can be used as a personal hotspot for your own devices. We had no idea this would be in the room and in this day and age of having internet access this proved invaluable as we explored the city and didn't incur costly roaming charges as we are from the uk The room was comfortable, clean and modern. The roof top pool was lovely even though it was unheated it didn't matter in the 30 degree heat. Only minor downside was not a massive choice at breakfast Singapore itself is an expensive city but immaculately clean and a very calm and chilled atmosphere.

title: Perfect Hotel
desc: It is a perfect hotel with a beautiful swimming pool (+ panorama) Best Rooms I have ever seen Best Services I have had Super Position Super Staff In Singapore best choice Next time I will stay in this hotel for sure

title: Good Access to the MTR
desc: The room was small, the restaurant was adequate, but the Roosevelt around the corner provided good value, but was not open for breakfast. There was easy access to the MTR providing access to Chinatown and Downtown. As noted, the room was small but adequate. The staff was helpful and was able to provide directions to places to visit.

title: Standard and Loft rooms are tiny.
desc: I had used Booking.com to reserve a best room available on arrival deal. Check in said I had ordered a standard room. After referring to a senior colleague I was given a second floor loft room(their most expensive) which was tiny. They showed me a standard room on a higher floor which was also tiny. They said that the deluxe rooms were all booked.The downstairs Loft room had a small two seater sofa next to a small fridge and next to a sliding door which contained the toilet,wash basin and shower. It was just wider than my outstretched arm span. I wanted a wake up call but the phone was not working. Someone came promptly to fix it but said that it would take time to re-charge. He also showed me how to operate the air con. After 2 hours the phone was not working and a

title: Regular business hotel, superb location.
desc: I bumped up my 'Average' rating to 'Very Good' because the location of this hotel is unbeatable. There are plenty of MRT entrances nearby (although they all lead to the same Outram Park MRT), and you're within walking distance of great food in a relatively well-established hipster area (think Tanjong Pagar, Tiong Bahru, Keong Saik Road). It's also 10 minutes by foot to Chinatown. Unless you're extremely pressed for time, skip the breakfast buffet - it's a tired affair but at least it comes with an egg station - because a simple 5-10 minute walk brings you to great eateries nearby. A quick Google Map search will show you the different F&B outlets and there are PLENTY around the area.

title: New Hotel at the edge of Chinatown
desc: Booked a 'mystery room' and was pleasantly surprised when we checked in as we were offered a room with a view of the pool. The front desk was very professional and quick with the checking in. Spacious bathroom with a rain shower and a tub to soak in. A lovely basket of fruits was already in the room when we arrived. The room was very quiet even though the hotel was along a major road. The hotel is conveniently linked with the subway, so even if it rains there is no problem getting to the hotel. Eateries galore around Neil Road, Chinatown and Cantonment Road. For some Peranakan inspired food, the Michelin starred Candlenut is literally next door.

title: Location location location
desc: Right where u want to be to explore Chinatown and try the Michelin rated hawker food. You will be spoilt for choice too when it comes to restaurants, bars and cafes. Transport is a breeze as the hotel is located right above Outram train station.

title: Perfect Location
desc: Was in Singapore for a a few days on business and stayed at this property. Its 5 mins away from my office and vety convenient. The hotel is right next to Outram MRT station, so travelling around is no problem at all. Club Street is a 2-3 min walk away so you have enough eating options. The rooms were smaller than the ones at previous places I stayed in Singapore. Breakfast spread is limited and the gym is very basic.

title: Average at best
desc: Stayed in Dorsett in July as a group of us organised a durian tour which required us to meet really early the next morning. Decided to book a staycation a day before till the next morning. Initial impressions were bad, with a lack of air conditioning at the lobby and a never-ending queue thanks to a lack in manpower. We were eventually served 30 minutes later and while the staff was really courteous and helpful, the damage has been done. We proceed up to the room and it was a cute little room, to put it nicely. The day went by without anything else significant, thankfully. We proceeded to check out really early next morning.

title: Staycations
desc: Stayed in this hotel in september. Hotel lobby is nice and brightly lit , alot if chairs available to sit. Reception is prompt with and greeted me with a smile . Stayed in the loft room . The room is very nicely decorated toilet is also nice with standing shower . Work desk available for you if you need to do any work . Bed is also comfortable to sleep in . A few things that can be improved on are the sofa seats in the room could be changed looks abut run downed . Towels also could be changes looks really old . Other than those , it is a great hotel that i would recommend those who would like to explore chinatown to stay in.

title: Nice hotel near Singapore Chinatown and MRT but....
desc: The Dorsett Hotel is a nice hotel. The rooms are on the small side though. We had two twin beds and two suitcases and had to maneuver around the suitcases to walk to the bathroom or around the beds. The bathroom has a frosted glass sliding door. So, if you prefer more privacy, this may not be the hotel for you. Plus, one of the beds is about two feet from the sliding glass door. The Breakfast is more Asian than international. Out of the three hotels we have stayed in for our SE Asia Tour, this one offered the least international fare for breakfast. Also, for the two days we had breakfast, one day we we ate around 8 and the food selection was ok. The next morning we ate about 9:30 and the food selection was pretty poor. Most of the rolls were gone, the bread was gone,

title: Excellent Customer Service
desc: My wife and I stayed at the Dorsett Singapore for a few days in May 2016 en-route to Europe from Australia. The staff were excellent. The room was a little smaller than we would have liked but was ok for a short stay. The hotel is very close to the subway system which made getting around a breeze. On the day of our departure we accidently left my wife's insulin in the room's fridge and did not realsie until we were at the airport. the concierge jumped in a taxi and delivered the packages to us at the airport. That's customer service.

title: Nice hotel
desc: The location is very convenient close to Chinatown and MRT is just right next door. The room is not too big but very clean. Each room had a cell phone for the customers and free wi-fi. The staff is very helpful, but terrible breakfast.

title: Lovely hotel in great location
desc: We had a great stay in Singapore to end our holiday. The hotel is in a very central location, easy to walk to Clarke Quay, and very close to the underground station. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and helped us order taxis whenever we needed them. The biggest plus for this hotel was the smartphone each room got. Unfortunately my phone broke while on holidays, so this was a lifesaver for me allowing me to check emails and check in for my flight. Being able to take it outside of the hotel allowed us to use google maps, and search for restaurants we wanted to visit. A great place to have a base in Singapore!

title: Convenient, modern hotel that's also reasonably priced
desc: Location: very convenient. Literally above Outram Park MRT station and faces the whole Singapore General Hospital area with its associated buildings Check in: prompt. Booked a "Mystery Room" package for a good price. On check in I found out that I was allocated a Superior Room with a bathtub. Room: spick and span. So clean it was faultless. The room is large especially by Singapore standards. The bathroom was also large and spacious with a good pressure shower. There is a complimentary cellphone in the room that is completely free. And that includes international calls to certain countries like Malaysia, Hong Kong, China etc. Did not avail of the recreational facilities at this hotel so can't comment. Overall a good stay at a good price. However I was slightly annoyed to

title: Nice hotel close to Chinatown
desc: We arrived very worried about the recent reviews about the service. I felt thet what needs attention is housekeeping. Towels are indeed very old and even shredded. I've asked for new towels twice, but they never came. Had to use the wet ones. On the other hand, the reception personal are very helpful. We got an early check-in, and they also storaged some sweets tor me in their freezer. MRT station is next door, allowing us to go around easily. Breakfast is vast but not tasty.

title: Centrally located !!
desc: This is a centrally located hotel with easy access to SMRT. The room was nice and clean as well. THe city view from the window of the room was great as well. However, when we reach there for check in, they informed us that they don‚Äôt have room available with big bed although we had mentioned clearly while making reservation few weeks earlier. Later, they sent a staff to connect 02 single beds. When I sleep first night, I had serious muscle pain next morning and went massage for relief. Then, second night, I separate the bed again and sleep alone. I am hopeful that this type of mistake will not be repeat in future with any other customers.

title: Sounds better than it actually is
desc: We chose this hotel for a one-night stay (solely because we wanted to enjoy the food nearby) and we thought the loft room sounded like fun. The good: location-wise it's right above Outram Park MRT which means you've got good access to two lines, and you're in close proximity to interesting places like Chinatown and Harbourfront. The hotel is also well-served by buses. The bed was very comfortable; and the toilet is quite well-designed with direct access to the closet. Hotel service was generally bad, however. There were 5 or 6 of them at the reception when we arrived but they were engaged in private conversation and couldn't be bothered to serve until we called for attention. We were asked for credit card for payment twice during check-in because the staff couldn't get the

title: It's very convenient!
desc: The location was very convenient which was close to Chinatown and only 1 min walk to MRT Outran Park station. The room was not too big and the bed was comfortable. However the pillow sheet was with dirt and the bedspread was broken. We stayed for 3 nights but we were short of towels everyday. Each room had a cell phone for the customers and we could connect it to use internet, so that we didn't have to buy a sim card for wireless. Overall it's very convenient and we'll consider to stay there again!

title: 9 days stay
desc: the rooms were too small and bathroom as well for my expectation. otherwise it was neat, clean and tidy. also good location. near to MRT and at the junction of china town and outram. easy to access SGH. but one thing that annoyed me was tiny sized room and bathroom

title: Great location and very nice hotel
desc: My partner and I stayed 2 nights in Singapore at the Dorsett. One of my considerations for choosing the Dorsett was its location on Outram Park MRT station. My partner has a dodgy knee and is unable to walk long distances. On arrival we were upgraded to a splash room which was a lovely surprise. Bed comfortable and room nicely appointed. Room is not very big by Australian standards but worked perfectly for us. The Dorsett is close to Chinatown - great for a meal and a bit of shopping. We were tired on our first night after a full day's travel so ate in Papasan (hotel restaurant). Club sandwich and steak sandwich, both with fries, were fantastic. Security is good with room key card needed to access floor buttons in elevators. Assistance from front counter always very

title: Solid service but not great location
desc: I stayed with my two children at Dorsett Singapore last week. PROS: (1) The receptionist staff as well as some of the housekeeping staff were courteous and helpful. The staff let me leave my luggage with them and gave me access to the gym area before we head to the airport; (2) The rooms are generally clean; and (3) You can get to the hotel from the airport by taking the green line to Outram Park. The ride takes about 35 minutes. To get to the hotel, head to Exit 'H'. CONS: (1) Yes, you can walk to Chinatown in about 10 minutes, but that's about it. It's easy to get around the city since three subway lines run through Outram Park; however, it would be much more convenient if there were supermarkets or a variety of restaurants (other than Chinatown) nearby; (2) The room

title: Good for short business trip
desc: The location of this hotel was convenient for our business trip there. It was also near the MRT, this allowed us to travel back and forth in visiting other towns with ease. Their service is good. Unfortunately, we didn't had much time to explore the amenities since it was just a short visit. They also serve a breakfast buffet. About that, they usually change one or two kind of food from their menu and the rest are just the same for the whole week. This is not recommended for people who likes to eat something new everyday. LOL.

title: Average hotel, poor food
desc: Stayed for two nights in a room with balcony. Room was well equipped and appears to have been recently refurbished, but was a bit cramped. The worst part was the food. Nothing was good and/or tasty. I tried out 4 meals, all prepared of poor quality. Breakfast buffet also was very elementary. Limited items in limited quantities. The only good thing was the hotel is located directly over the MRT station. I will never stay again at this property mainly because of poor food option.

title: A great stay in the heart of Singapore
desc: I stayed at the Dorsett Singapore for 2 days. The hotel is modern, stylish and quite comfortable. The staff are friendly, professional and helpful. The rooms have high ceilings, earthy tones and modern features. The hotel is conveniently located above a MRT station, so getting around town is extremely easy and fast. In addition, the traditional Chinese quarter is literally right out the hotel's front door. Overall, I had a very relaxed and comfortable stay.

title: Tiny room
desc: The hotel lobby is nice and clean while the room is so tiny as well as the bathroom. Breakfast is fair. The location is very close to China town and other shops. Easy access to other things around town.

title: Very nice stay and very convenient location
desc: I have an IHG membership but given the price of IHG hotels in Singapore, I thought I'd balance great comfort with affordable price. So I booked a 3 night stay at Dorsett Singapore. [no regrets] Was very pleased with the infrastructure and level of service. Hotel is extremely close to Outram MRT. Can't beat the convenience of being on the Green MRT line, means you can use the MRT from the airport to the hotel. (approximately 45 minutes MRT ride) Didn't go for the breakfast option because I found it a bit pricey. Slight lack of a convenience store close by. Really appreciated the room upgrade to the loft room. A great way to use a small space. Shower, toilets, TV, etc all worked well and were clean. Some free toiletries were offered and that was cool. Didn't get a chance to use

title: Small room with few towels
desc: Good things: Nice position, in front of the MRT station, in Chinatown. Very good the idea of Handy (a smartphone that You can use all around in Singapore in VPN mode so You are always wired). Bad things: small room, very small toilet. We booked a triple room but they assigned us a double room. Only 2 towels (we were 2 adults and 1 9-years Old child).

title: Good location
desc: Dorsett hotel located above Outram Park mrt station so it is very easy to get to the hotel from Changi airport if you use MRT. Just take the green line to Joo Koon, stop at Outram Park, you will find sign to Dorsett. The room and the bathroom is very small, but the bed is comfortable. The hotel is close to Chinatown, just walk about 7 min, you will find street food and market. Don't be afraid to get lost, because if the hotel provide us mobile phone which could be taken during a stay at the hotel.

title: Small Room Covinient to MRT
desc: Hotel is much smaller than expected. MRT is righ next door and Chinatown area is nearby. Modern design but not impressive. Dinggy towels that needs to be replaced. 3rd time visiting Singapore this area and hotel disappointed me. Definitely not the charm and elegance of singapore. But since its at chinatown its suited for its location. hotel amenities is shared with the residents at the same buiding. Its not exclusive for hotel guest. Hotel is good for business travel/solo travel i will not recommend for families its too small and not convinient enough to any grocery or eatery. MRT is convinient but some hotels are embedded with the MRT connections and mall undergrounds for serious restaurants. This area of Singapore lacks charm but for serious bargain hunters and boredom this

title: Nice hotel for a short stay
desc: This hotel is located on the edge of Chinatown but directly above outram park mrt station so getting around is pretty easy. The mrt line from the airport runs through this station, but it's a slow trip and necessitates a change. The hotel itself is modem, but rooms are a little small, particularly the wardrobe space. Ideal for the solo traveller but not so good for couples. Not many western eateries close to the hotel so taking the breakfast option offered by the hotel is worthwhile, however it's a pretty average breakfast.

title: Housekeeping needs to be improved
desc: We stayed in a Delux room which is reasonably spacious for 4 nights. The location is conveniently connected to other places in Singapore besides there are no convenience stores closely nearby and the building is right above the Outram MRT. For foreigners, you may not know that there is a traditional hawker food centre 5 minutes away for local breakfast. You can ask the hotel staff who are friendly and helpful. The only shortfall is the housekeeping staff who do not seem to be well supervised. Everyday, apart from just tidy up the bedsheet, they do not check whether the room supply is in order and given to customers. On Friday, there is no drinking water given in my room. On Saturday, the drinking mugs were not replaced with clean ones. On Sunday, the shower room rubbish

title: Good Location
desc: Good location, however the hotel is pretty much standard, although it offers good facility. Breakfast was very standard, and definitely can be improved. Within walking distance to MRT, and if you like to go sightseeing in Chinatown, this hotel is a good option.

title: Small rooms but good location
desc: Loved that the hotel is literally connected to the MRT and the bustling Chinatown is just less a kilometre away. The rooms are a little small but more importantly, it gave me a decent place to rest for two nights. Pleasantly surprised to find that they give you a mobile phone for personal use (and selected international calls for free!) although it wasn't the most user friendly of phones. Basic amenities provided: mini bar, toiletries, bathrobe, ironing board and iron, coffee and tea-making facilities etc. I liked that Dorsett was clean, comfortable and peaceful. Front desk service was efficient and we checked in and out without fuss. Service wise they were indifferent but not rude. (A smile would be nice and doesn't cost extra!) On the downside, the bathroom needs better

title: The most helpful reception staff anywhere!
desc: This is not the first time that a stay at a hotel has been made special by the staff at the reception desk but I have to say that the staff on the desk at the Dorsett went above and beyond. My check-in was smooth and I was given all of the information I needed for my stay, and, just as importantly, none of the information I didn't! The room itself was clean and comfortable - nothing really to write home about. If I had one criticism it would be that the grouting between the shower tiles was a little grubby which made the shower feel dirty, even though it wasn't. The bed was comfortable (I slept well) though the air-conditioning seemed a little too aggressive, even turned up to 24C. Again the reception staff excelled upon check out. Upon returning to the hotel at around 5pm

title: Great location
desc: Stated here for a Friday and Saturday night as a break on a business trip to China and indonesia. Great location right next to China Town and above the MRT station. Clean rooms great AC. It's an easy walk to the Maxwell hawker centre. This is my third stay here and am yet to be disappointed. The outdoor pool is wonderful.

title: Great Experience
desc: Great location. Outram Park MRT Station (intersection line, so you get anywhere quite easy) is right in front of the Hotel Entrance. Nice and Clean Room with complete ammenities (Thank God we got upgraded.. YEAYYY!!). The Handy Mobile Phone from the hotel was soooo helpful to make FREE local calls (Grab, etc) and Unlimited Internet Access. Overall, we are satisfied.

title: Convenient Base for Exploring Singapore
desc: The Dorsett Hotel is 20 minute, S$30 taxi ride from the airport. It is located above Outram Park MRT station which gives access to all parts of the city in a matter of minutes. The hotel is on the edge of China Town, and one MRT stop from the attractions at Sentosa. This is a relatively new hotel with well designed comfortable rooms. The rooms and public areas are clean and in good repair. The hotel has free wifi. Although some have complained that the speed is little slow, I found it fine for web browsing. The hotel also provides a complimentary mobile phone, which you can use to make free local and international calls. The staff are friendly and efficient, and the security is good. Although not five star luxury, the hotel is very comfortable and has a pool and a gym. I has

title: The housekeeping services and the toilet is a disaster
desc: So I stayed with my one of my partners in the same room, there are supposed to be 2 bathing towels in my room. However, they only give us 1 towel every single day and I have to tell them too give me one more every single day, I've told the housekeeping team directly, on phone, even go to the reception to report this but nothing changes. Also, the design of the toilet is just terrible

title: Pleasent view at Dorsett
desc: +Super close to the metro leaving the city so accessible +MRT cost $5 for 2 people to get from the airport to the hotel//just have to swap trains once and it took around 40 minutes +very clean hotel, gorgeous smell when you walk in +cutest door bells to the rooms, a few other unique characteristics to the hotel +close to china town where we got the hop on hop off bus +helpful staff +free mobile phone for calling - stay in your room. +lovely pool on 3rd floor -the entrance to the hotel isn't super clear - the rooms are smaller than expected -the view we had wasn't really a view some construction happening outside -Small bathroom(not enough storage space for my makeup) the mirror in the room not good enough to do makeup

title: Convenient location, reasonable price, room is clean
desc: the location is very convenient, just above the MRT Outram Station. Also, the location near Chinatown, walk about 5-10 mins to get there. I visited the swimming pool and gym room. The view of the swimming pool is not very good, but the gym room is quite good with many equipment. Moreover, the staff are very nice and helpful. I arrived early at 11AM on 18/6 and the staff let me check-in. (the normal check-in time is 14:00) If I go to Singapore again, I would choose to stay here again.

title: Convenient location, hotel itself a bit hit & miss
desc: As first time visitors to Singapore we loved the convenient location of the hotel, being right above a MRT station and so close to China Town and short walk to Clarke Quay. The staff were very friendly and we arrived to discover we had been upgraded to a king bed room. The room was cozy, enough room to get around OK, and that's what we expected after some research. The issues raised by others re the shortage and placement of the powerpoints, and the shortage and poor quality of towels are correct. We also discovered the air-conditioning was a tad erratic, providing arctic-like conditions at times. The bathroom lighting was poor for doing makeup, and the quality of workmanship when installing the bathroom vanity was very ordinary - silicon everywhere. However the room was

title: Great 'above and beyond' service
desc: Great hotel in a convenient location near Chinatown and MRT station. Excellent service. One of our party become ill after we had checked out in the morning and the hotel staff reopened our room and let our sick person stay through to late afternoon to recover (at no extra cost). Brilliant as we had no where else we could go and our flight wasn't leaving until later that evening. Also, the restaurant in the hotel was excellent with great food and very friendly staff. We will definitely try to stay here again next time we are in Singapore.

title: Close to MRT and Chinatown and reasonable rates for Sing hotel
desc: The fit out of this hotel is super quirky and fun. This is my regular business hotel when staying in Singapore. I will admit the rooms are pretty small, but they are very fresh and modern compared to some of the other hotels in Singapore. MRT is so easy to use, and right next door so makes it a great hotel to get around from. Breakfast buffet is large and generous and with Chinatown a couple of blocks away plenty of cheep and cheerful food options.

title: Cosy at its best location.
desc: I've recently stayed at Dorsett couple of days back for 2 nights. Here are my comments. 1. the hotel appearance is good. Located just above the Outram Park mrt station. Very convenient to all access. Few mins away to chinatown and clark quay. 25mins to changi airport. 2. Room was cosy. Clean. Comfortable bed and beddings. Aircond was super cool. The shower in the bathroom was great. It has a rain shower too. I just hope the hotel would keep a constant change on the towels. It was a little old. 3. Star winning : Handy phone that comes with unlimited local calls for free. City guide map for tourist. Awesome! Just be careful not to lose it! 4. Check in and out was good 5. Slow response for requests. Needed reminder. I called several times to the reception no answer.

title: Breakneck Check-in process
desc: I'm currently waiting for check in and with only 3 couples in front of me, I don't understand why I have to wait 1 hour for check in to be done. They have a long reception table but with only one serviceman on a busy weekend. Efficiency a definite no. Will update again on the room quality.

title: Great hotel, excellent price
desc: My friends and I stayed here for one night during a stopover in Singapore. The room was small but very nice. It was furnished with high-quality linens and towels and the bathroom was very modern with a rain shower head. The pool area was great, although construction across the street made it a little noisy. We also loved that a cell phone with free data and free calls to the US was included with the room. It was so helpful for navigating the city! Finally, the hotel is in a great location. It is literally above the Outram Park MRT (goes to airport) and only a short walk from the Chinatown MRT stop.

title: stories about their towels are true
desc: I loved the location of this hotel. It's right above Outram Park MRT, and my favorite restaurant in Singapore - Candlenut - is right on the premises. Hotel offers a free local phone with mobile internet access. Very handy for travelers who don't wish to pay roaming charges. The room I stayed in was comfortable and clean. What I didn't like were the bath towels in the bathrooms. They were rather thin and flimsy, and as others have reported, they edges were frayed. I have never seen this at a decent hotel that I have stayed in, and honestly there is no excuse when one is paying the kind of price the hotel asks for. The other complaint is the placement of power outlets. I needed to iron a shirt, so I borrowed an ironing board and an iron. The only place I could plug it

title: Mediocre at best
desc: We have had many stopovers in Singapore and opted this time for what we hoped was a good 4 star hotel. First the positives: A great location, one of our favourites, on the edge of Chinatown alongside some pretty streets for wandering and eating, and so convenient to the Outram MRT and for the airport. When you ask staff for something, they do their best to oblige. Bedding is very comfortable and it is a non-smoking hotel. Some negatives: We had booked a standard double with request for upper floor on the side of the building away from the major current construction zone. When we arrived we were offered first one then a second upgrade room, and though of course upgrades are always to be appreciated, both upgrade rooms were on the construction zone side. We opted to stay

title: Great Location Good Value
desc: Located in Chinatown within walking distance to all that the area has to offer, has a MRT station literally under the hotel. My only negative comment was that the rooms were rather small and cramped. Staff friendly and overall good value for money except for significantly overpriced mini bar.

title: Amazing and perplexing times at the Dorsett Singapore
desc: Dorsett Hotel, New Bridge Road, Singapore - Allegedly 4 star. Fine foyer. Booking made about three or four months prior to arrival. Booked twin bed Standard Room which was advertised as follows: "22 sq. metres. Free toiletries, Toilet paper, Electric kettle. Free WiFi is available in all rooms." Nicely photographed for internet advertising which features a 'brown' room, their "Singapore-style" room apparently. And so my travelling companion, a colleague of no close relationship, and I arrived to check in. I was somewhat taken aback to be asked if we wanted a King Size bed - for obvious reasons - but taken aback particularly given that a twin bed room was clearly booked and confirmed several months prior to arrival. Clearly the receptionist had absolutely no knowledge of

title: Nice hotel
desc: Nice hotel with very helpful staff situated in Chinatown, the MRT station situated below hotel. Facilities slightly outdated: stained carpet, sheets with some holes, shower drain so-so. The restaurant quite bad, food choices very poor, luckily the Chinatown restaurants are close by and you can find some nice food in there.

title: Extra mile
desc: I was back home in Singapore for a few days and decided to stay here again. It is not as easy to impress me when it comes to hospitality as i worked in the hotel industry for about 3 years but the staffs in this hotel was great which explains why i went back the 2nd time. The front office team has always been efficient, warm and friendly during both check-in and check-out process. The hotel is also located conveniently near the metro and the city centre. Room is nice, cosy and affordable with fast speed WIFI. I will no doubt return again.

title: Mostly comfortable
desc: Professional staff and great location directly above Outram MRT. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area, and close to Chinatown sights. Facilities are decent. The gym is conveniently located next to the pool, and I liked the water dispenser and handy anti-bacterial wet wipes available. Room is small but cosy. For a three-year old hotel, however, the room looked a little worn and could be cleaner. For example, I saw a lot of dust collected on top of the toilet paper roll holder, and one of the spoons was dirty. There were only amenities for one person when we arrived, so we had to call the reception to send up towels. They were efficient about it though.

title: Average at most
desc: Outlook of the hotel is rather promising, decor and concept seems to hit it right, location is convenient with MRT next door, and walking distance to Chinatown as well as bars, pubs and restaurants. However, the room is rather small, bath linen of bellow average quality, hot water system is a hit or miss, lack of power points for charging devices in the room.

title: A proper business Hotel
desc: I stayed here for almost 10 days in December 2015. This place is the perfect business hotel, with a very courteous and helpful staff everywhere and that no nonsense business demeanour which is not in your face but at the same time is highly attentive. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and quiet, though I was a bit unnerved by the separation between the basin area and the room itself. Probably works for times when you really cant miss that show on the TV, but otherwise can really throw you off guard. But, I guess I'm just being picky about a really comfortable room. The breakfast spread was big and you can get spoilt for choice, especially with the baked section. But being there for 10 days, I pretty much could predict the spread every morning. But then, that's the

title: Very good hotel
desc: I stayed there for 2 weeks during business trip to Singapore. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Room is comfortable- minibar, shower, conditioner, iPhone dock station. The breakfast was rich and tasty. Room was cleaned every day. I really enjoyed my stay there.

title: Good Place
desc: Stayed here for a week. Very nice location. Convent access to the MRT. Rooms are well lit and decent size ( although the one we got was a triangular shaped room) - we were three ( two adults and a child of 10) Breakfast options are limited. Staff is extremely helpful and very courteous. We were well guided on the best ways to reach a location. They also helped us book local tours. The swimming pool is good and so is the gym. The free handset and data sim was an added advantage. Local calling and 4g data was free. Overall it was a very comfortable stay

title: Fun, Accessible and Friendly service
desc: Without doubt it is already one of our favorite hotels stayed during our time in Singapore! Upon arrival and checking in, we were warmly welcomed by the front desk staff, check-in was fast and efficient. When we got inside our designated room, we were amazed with the bedroom view (Loft Type). A cozy and relaxing view from your bed through the huge windows upfront. After we enjoyed the rest of the room facilities, we decided to go for a swim, and yes their swimming pool was clean and the view from the pool was astounding too! We really had a great time swimming with our kids there. We had a great evening here, which obviously also added up to the experience. And Oh, the hotel provided a handy phone which we think is really a plus for tourists like us. The handphone comes with

title: Modern, clean, cozy room, fast WIFI and friendly staff
desc: I will definitely come back to this Dorsett hotel. Modern, clean, spacious cozy room, fast WIFI and friendly staff, great location. It's right next to Chinatown so there are a lot of things to see and eat.

title: Good mid-range hotel next to metro station
desc: We have stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon trip. Before coming to Singapore, i did a lot a research to find a positively reviewed hotel with a good location and decent sized rooms at a reasonable price. On paper, Dorsett was one of the few that did fit the bill. Location of the hotel is next to an MRT metro station which made getting in and around the city super easy. Also getting to and from the airport was convenient with only 1 transfer needed. In the direct neighborhood of the hotel there is a street with some restaurants but overall there's not that much to do. Since our flight arrived really early, we tried to check in around 7 in the morning. This was not possible but we could leave our luggage in the lobby and could come back for an early check-in at

title: Attention to Detail!
desc: The Dorsett Hotel is ideally situated to the Outram Park MRT, easy walking distance from Chinatown, and surrounded by good restaurants. It rates very high in service, our every need was attended promptly. Don't miss the Pappasan Restaurant downstairs. A very nice amenity was a cell phone with international calling capabilities as well as assistance with local attractions..

title: Great location
desc: The hotel is just a few step away from public transport. The room is just nice and clean. There were larger room with extra money though.There were pool, Jacuzzi, small gym, and rooftop garden. Pool cleanliness is just average especially on seating area.The door bell is made look like a camera.It look so nice

title: Great location to explore Singapore
desc: We stayed at the Dorset Hotel for 3 nights. It is very easy to get to from Changi Airport by train. Will cover off on the hotel to say that we were very comfortable there. The hotel is above Outram station. There is even a lift that goes to the hotel. All the major tourist spots are an easy train ride away. Very close to China town as well. 1 station or a nice walk.

title: Good hotel in Singapore
desc: Hotel is conveniently located being right next to train station (MRT). I love the fact that they loan you a phone to use while you are staying there- free calls to US, UK, Australia, ..... Staff was friendly. A nice treat was the fruit that greeted me in my room

title: Heartwarming Service and Awesome Stay
desc: The overall experience is brilliant. The staff is friendly and helpful, and very thoughtful too (especially those at front desk). They really made you "feel like home". The Handy phone service with Wifi is truly handy and very convenience for visitors in Singapore; you get connected to internet anytime and anywhere with stable network. Room is clean though is a little bit packed, but the facilities are good. Location is extremely convenience with MRT station just by steps. The swimming pool is nice and clean and it is very thoughtful that it opens from 6am till late night. Only few items that I want to comment would be the rooftop garden and breakfast. It would be much appreciated if more variety of food could be provided on each day, it was a little bit bored having the

title: Third stay...room good - location great....recommended
desc: Stayed here in late October 15 and again in December 15. This time I was in room 823 for six nights, checking out today. The rooms are fine, the bed comfortable, breakfast is filling and I definitely get spoiled by the omelette chef. The location suits me just right...above the Outram Park MRT interchange, I zoomed around each day on the metro...its so easy...the network takes you all over Singapore. The hotel is recommended.

title: Excellent hotel for the price
desc: I stayed at this hotel because it is near my office and what a nice find this is. It is right next to the MRT station and Outram Park MRT is such a good location because it is one stop away from Vivocity with all the nice shopping and dining options. Or can walk to Maxwell centre and have a nice local meal there. The hotel itself is good, but the service is definitely top-notch. I found on their website prior to arrival that they offer a free Handy phone with unlimited data so I mentioned it at check-in. It turns out the standard room which is what I booked does not have this feature but guess what, the staff was so smart and upgraded me to the nicer room with this feature without even telling me first. She just said yes to the phone feature and then found me an upgraded room

title: Good place for a one night stay
desc: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for one night. The hotel has a good location - close to Chinatown and metro. There is a great swimming pool where you can relax after a hot day. The staff was friendly. Free wi-fi throughout of the hotel. Nice decoration (rooms, lobby, corridors, swimming pool). Comfortable king-size bed. We were frustrated by dust on the table and bedside chests. Breakfast was not included into the price of the room. The door separating bedroom and bathroom was made of matte glass, though it did not make us feel embarrassed.

title: Brilliant Stay
desc: Hi everyone, My names Farhan. I had a brilliant stay here at Dorsett Hotel. It was well designed. Very bright and energetic lights,really impressed. The swimming pool and gym were great. Perfect! Also the rooms were comfy. I think its one of the best places to stay if you are looking for a great hotel room. Cheers! Yours Truely, Mr.Farhan

title: Excellent location, near China Town
desc: We stayed for 4 nights in February 2016 and found it very comfortable, especially the bed. The rooms are not huge, but there is all you need including an iron. We were in a room on the front, facing a big road junction, but we were not bothered by any noise. Its closeness to China Town was a bonus for eating and drinking. Out of the front door, turn right and walk for 5 minutes and you are at Smith St. Outram Park mrt station is just outside and plenty of busses passed up and down New Bridge st. All was kept clean and the staff were very helpful and cheery. Recommended.

title: Below expectation
desc: Check in was smooth. The room has weird smell, dusty and the carpet is dirty. Toilet and shower not very clean. Stained sheets and ripped towels. The only advantage is they provide free handy smartphone where you can make free local and international calls to certain countries. Also work as portable hotspot. Expensive hotel indeed.

title: Excellent location and Great service
desc: We love this hotel. Very close to outram mrt station. We use Mrt from Changi to this hotel. Make sure u choose exit H in Outram station. We only need less than 10 minutes from hotel to Vivo city by MRT. Hotel staff was really helpful and friendly. The room size medium but comfortable. There is also a good Chinese restaurant not far from hotel named Swis ling. The have bakut teh, fried beehon and open from 8 am. We would definitely gonna stay here again.

title: Average stay but still good
desc: Quite a average stay but still good. Concierge is good and hotel room size is reasonable. But the toilet is way too small. Lost my beanie in the hotel and called up the hotel. Sadly they mentioned it is nowhere to be found.

title: Not as expected
desc: I had a chance to stay for one night in this hotel. I do not know what to mention as good experience, probably service on reception. The rest like not very clean bad linen, not clean toilet, and overall a bit dirty room that really requires to be refreshed are just bad experience.

title: Smart, efficient and very very helpful
desc: Dorset is the kind of hotel you must stay in if you're on a business trip. At one end of ChinaTown, it's half a minute away from the subway station and yet is an island of calm. THe lobby with its crystal Chandelier is somewhat grand. The lobby staff are very very helpful. In fact I had left my shawl in the breakfast room once and came back to collect it 3 days after check out and the staff was just as helpful as if I was still a guest. THe rooms have everything you need for a comfortable stay. One tip: If you're going in for the buffet breakfast, arrive early. The fruit disappears faster than anything

title: A mixed bag
desc: I was "upgraded" to a loft room. These will not be too everyone's taste - the bed is its own little area up a set of wooden stairs, with the bedside table at the foot of the bed, no spare power outlet for charging a phone, and - critically for many, I suspect - a precarious descent down a narrow stairwell in the event that nature calls in the middle of the night. Breakfast was, quite frankly, one of the worst hotel breakfasts I have ever had, with a poor selection of hot and cold food; doughy bread for toast and - extraordinary for Singapore - a really mediocre platter of tired looking fruit. The straw that broke my back was the absence of room service after 10pm - I was advised that I could order online from McDonald's if I was hungry! I was; I reluctantly did (after

title: Great location, very accommodating
desc: We had 2 short stays here either side of a trip to Bali. The hotel is great as a Base as it is just above the Outram Park MRT Station, so only one change needed from the Airport (approx 45 min travel). The rooms are compact but with everything you need. Each room comes with a Smartphone ("handy") which you can use to during your stay - we managed to find some great places to visit and it helped us get around the city. You can also make local and some international calls for free! The gym has all the basic equipment and the pool is lovely, but don't expect to relax by it at the moment as there is loud building work across the road which looks to go on for some time. Breakfast is ok but there is not a huge amount to chose from. The staff are all lovely and accommodating and

title: Has good cost-performance! A hotel I would like to come back.
desc: If you are a person who wants to spend less money but wants to stay in a decent and comfortable hotel in Singapore, I suggest you to stay at Dorsett Singapore. Very good location(they actually have a lift straight to the hotel from MRT station!) Friendly reception, Two-bedded room is cosy and compact but big enough for two people and our luggages! Dorsett Singapore offers you free smart phone for international call and wifi hotspot which is very helpful for tourists. Before the stay,I asked them to change my room from double-sized bed to two beds. They responded to my request very quickly and friendly which leaves a good image on me. If I have chance to come back to Singapore, I will definitely stay in Dorsett again! Thanks for your hospitality. ÈßÖËøë(ÈßÖ„Åã„Çâ„Éõ„ÉÜ„É´Â∞ÇÁî®„ÅÆ„Ç®„É¨„Éô„Éº„Çø„Éº„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÇ)

title: Good location but nothing special
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of October. Although there is nothing missing or major to criticize, we just didn't have a great stay here. There is no love to detail which would make guests feel all the more welcome and improve the stay. The rooms are tiny and already looked quite run down, although the hotel isn't open that long. I believe it is due to the cheap wood furnishing they chose. The pool is nice, although the sun beds and floor were always covered in leaves, nobody seemed to be responsible for tidying up. Service is ok, check in and check out are very impersonal, you can feel that you are just one of many many guests... Asking for directions and things to do we received a quick and impersonal reply. The location is great, walking distance to china town

title: Well located
desc: Nice hotel, clean and quiet. On the edge of Chinatown. The Outram Park MRT station is underneath the hotel. You need to ask the doorman to show you where the access elevator is. The hotel provides you with a cell phone for use. The 'add-on' breakfast buffet at $20 was overpriced. We stayed 3 nights in May.

title: Good Hotel and Good Cooperating Staff, Next to Metro Station
desc: Rooms: Very Good rooms in that budget. Clean. Locality: Next to Metro Station Outram Park, which makes life very easy for Day-to-day commuting. Staff and Service: They respect guest and goes extra miles to help and serve better. Overall very good experience during my stay.

title: Favorable Place to Stay!
desc: Stayed at this hotel from 16 April till 18 April with double bed 20sq ft room. Able to check in earlier as I have reached the hotel earlier. The hotel is beside Outram Park MRT. Near Chinatown shopping area.

title: A nice business hotel near singapore General hospital
desc: I stayed there for a day. The reception staff was nice. They greeted you well. A bell boy will take you up to your room. They gave local information regarding Singapore. The rooms were nicely laid out. Clean sheets . I liked the fact that they provided you with a mobile device with 4G activated which I could take around and use as a guide in Singapore. I booked tickets to Sentosa and night safari . Also it had a lot of features about what is there in Singapore to visit, eat, drink etc. They provided me with details when I asked for . The breakfast was inclusive . Nice place to be. The rooms are small and there are many space saving designs you can see there like in the photo the shower is embedded into the ceiling.

title: BEST HOTEL OF CHOICE!
desc: This review is past due already as we had visited this nice hotel last year of November.. Pros: 1. Convenience factor: Very close proximity to the mrt.. purple line outram park. From the mrt, follow the purple line. You will see directional sign going to dorsett hotel. Take the elevator up. Hotel is on your left. Like 2 to 3 minutes walk from mtr : ) 2. Perfect for family Easy access to mrt going to harbour front, sentosa station.. etc 3. Value for money Considering the fact that the facilities here are superb! Hotel smells so good once you enter their lobby. 4. Accommodating front desk officers 5. Free luggage storage Cons: NONE :)

title: A great loft hotel
desc: We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary. It was located conveniently at Outram Park MRT station. The service was great!! The rooms were clean and well kept. There is a restuarant just at the lobby level. They provided great service there too. Overall we enjoyed our stay there very much.

title: Decent hotel, convenient location
desc: This hotel is close to our offices, but may not be convenient to all. Perfect as a work hotel, rooms not massive, but perfectly good enough, decent pool, somewhat random empty roof terrace (without a bar). Helpfully they supply a mobile phone with free 4G mobile access (and tethering) and free calls to some countries. Only downside was the restaurant, I'd definitely skip breakfast and go to one of the local places, we really liked Luxe which does a decent Aussie breakfast

title: Super convenient location for leisure travellers
desc: Stayed there for 4 nights with my partner. I've been in Singapore for almost 7 years, but first time to realised that this hotel had a super convenient location. It's directly connected to Outram Park MRT station, great access to Marina Bay, China Town, Sentosa & more must-visit places! The room was compact yet comfortable, just that the washbasin was too small to place my cosmetics. Not sure if front desk staff was too tired...I hardly saw they smiled to customers. Overall my stay was fantastic, strongly recommend to those visiting Singapore for leisure.

title: Convenient average hotel
desc: I stayed here in a double room with friend for few days . The location is very convenient , on top of Outram Park ( 2 MRT lines stop here), few minutes walk to Chinatown. About 50 mins fm Changhi airport on the green line. The room is small but manageable considering I am only here to sleep. The bathroom also super small , one of those with little shelf space to put your toiletries or to hang clothes. The cleanliness is very avenger considering this is Singapore. The breakfast also average but sufficient basic food types . If you arrive after 10am there isn't much left to eat. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They also hv a great service of a free mobile phone loaded with Singapore sightseeing info and fee internet usage so it saved your roaming or hassle of buying a card .

title: Free smart phone during your stay
desc: Stayed here for 2 weeks. They give you a free android smartphone with unlimited data and free international calls to certain countries! Located just above the Outram Park MRT station. Also 10 minutes walk to food centres like Maxwell, China town or Tiong Bahru so it's very convenient. Also some higher-end restaurants right behind the hotel. Room was comfortable with free wifi, except the design of the toilet/shower could be more spacious. Also got a nice swimming pool.

title: Thanks for the free upgrade!
desc: Came here for an anniversary staycation. The hotel upgraded us to the Splash Room FOR FREE! I am glad that they did as the swimming pool was down for maintenance. Apart from the staycation, we were intending to bring my 9 months old son to the pool for a swim, well at least he gets to swim in the bath tub and he really enjoys it! The hotel is nicely decorated, staffs are of warm and pleasant personality. Check out their door bells! Buffet breakfast can be of more selections. Try to go early for the breakfast as the restaurant has limited seating. THUMBS UP FOR DORSETT SINGAPORE! this is the best staycation i have for the past few years. Will recommend to family and friends, definitely!

title: Satisfactory stay but will not book again
desc: The Front Office and Pappasan staff were great. The location of the hotel is strategically located due to 3 MRT lines traversing Outram Park station. You have to go out of the hotel, walk 2 mins to reach the lift leading to the MRT station. The only thing is, there was no bell service to help us with our 3 trolley luggages when we checked in. I also asked if we can avail of the free handyphone but I was told I am not eligible because I got a twin room. I was surprised because in their website, it said all rooms and we stayed on a weekend. Maybe it's because I booked through Agoda and not directly at the hotel. It would have been great if we were able to use one because it would help us get information on the places we want to visit and a map to know where we exactly are.

title: New and Good Location Hotel
desc: The hotel was very new and good connecting to "Outram Park" MRT station. The hotel was also near the China Town. You could walk to China Town. The room was new and clean, but the room's window was too small and too high. The room size was just ok. If the front desk did not upgrade our room, it should be small. The front desk and bell boy were nice and friendly. Some front desk staff can speak cantonese and Korea language. There were many restaurants near this hotel.

title: Good Location but room is small
desc: Good Location but room is small, Location is super convenience, right just next to the MRT station and just 5 mins walk to china town and night life place. Room is small but clean and facilities are quite new.

title: Good location and value
desc: The design of the hotel is more on the chic side. Reception was fast and efficient. Room is more on the small side but comfortable enough. The swimming pool was closed for maintenance during the time I stay but that's ok. Outram park station Mrt is underneath it. About 10 mins walk to Chinatown.

title: Dirty
desc: We arrived around 9.00pm on 3rd March for a one night stay. The staff at reception were lovely however on entering our room we found the carpets dirty and the bathroom filthy like it hadn't been cleaned since the hotel opened 18 months ago. We complained in the morning and received a letter of apology and had 3 staff members come to clean the room.

title: Convenient Staycation
desc: Located in Central Area and easily access by public transport whether bus, train or taxi. A good swimming pool and a small gym to relax. Lot of Foods and Beverage outlets whether casual or fine dining. Probably run by 3rd party, the breakfast in the hotel's only Restaurant is on high side.

title: Fantastic hotel with great transport links.
desc: The reception area is lovely and there is a lift directly from Outram Park MRT to the hotel to save you walking across a busy road. The staff were both friendly and helpful when we arrived. The room was compact and clean, it had everything you would need in it and is a little bigger than other Singapore hotels. Again like other hotels in the area the bathroom (specifically the toilet) isn't private and whoever you share with will know all your toilet habits! Not a problem for us but guess if your sharing with a friend it could be a little strange. In the room there was a free smart phone to use during your stay which had the Internet on - this was great for us to help us navigate around Singapore as we used the MRT or walked everywhere. You could also use it for free local

title: Excellent location & service
desc: The appearance of the hotel did not impressed me. However, we had a very comfortable stay at the Dorsett. It is next to the Metro (MRT) Outram Park station. It is within walking distance to China Town and a little further to Clarke Quay. It is also easy to get to the major malls along the famous Orchard Road. Service is very good and efficient at the hotel. We had a large and stylish room with a spacious wet room for shower. Adequate storage for clothes as well. However, after a trip to Penang, we got a very small double, like many a place we have stayed in a big city. Overall, we are happy with the hotel and would stay again if the price is right.

title: Good location
desc: A very good location. Just 5 min walk to the subway. The room is clean and new. The double bed is big and very comfortable. Free wifi. The room is not big but acceptable. Staff are nice and helpful.

title: Could do better
desc: There is a huge construction site across the street which dominates the feel of the hotel since it faces it. The pool looks over the construction and is far too low being only on the 2nd floor (European/3rd Floor Singaporean). The pool area is not someplace that I would like to spend time. It is just off a busy street and the huge construction site. I found the room design to be bizarre. I got a loft room. The bed upstairs literally just fit within the glass box containing the bed. I was travelling alone so this was not such a problem, but there is absolutely no way to have a second person climb out of bed without going over the other sleeper. I have no idea how they change the sheets because it is so tight. The hotel is relatively new, but already some of the furniture in the

title: Good location, close to China Town
desc: The hotel is located above the MRT station and just 15 minutes walk to China Town (or one station away from it). The hotel is quite new and the service at reception good. The restaurant downstairs serve good food and beer. You can buy the MRT mutli-travel card to speed up your travel in Singapore. For those who like shopping, I highly recommned that you can take the MTR to Vivo City (one station away) where you can find the huge supermarket and many brand name shops. You can easily spend one whole day at the Vivo City shopping mall.

title: HouseKeeping not in Sync with FrontDesk
desc: Booked 2 rooms for one night in March 2016. Arrived promptly at 2:00pm and was told that only one room is ready. Frontdesk was doing a pretty good job with a smile all the time, however can over hear the irritable voice of housekeeping rudely and abruptly telling the frontdesk that no more room is available to check in. We patiently waited til 4:30 before my other room was ready. Wonder if Dorsett would extend me the same courtesy if I were to checkout 2:30 hours late without giving them prior notice and reason??? There are several other Hotels within the same location that I will definitely try the next time I am in Singapore.

title: Comfortable for a Business & Family Trip. Great Location!!!!!connected well by MRTS
desc: I visited SG on a official trip!!! The overall experience at this place is awesome!!! First the service at Dorsette is great!!!! This hotel is well connected to all the main locations by MRTS. Taxis are also readily available on demand at the front desk. Most important locations like MBFC, Ferrer Park(shopping), China Town(Food & Shopping) are just a reach away by 2 to 3 stations away.Sentosa Island is just 2 to 4 stations near by.
