Food at the hotel is great and the spread is also good, The complimentary breakfast is great to kick start a busy business/holiday trip schedule for the day. Awesome swim at the pool and front office is helpful and they are just helpful in everything you ask for. Though the overall SG has a demand for such skilled staff they are passionate about

title: 5th but last time
desc: This was our 5th stay. The last 2 times we had difficulty to get the room we wanted. But the worst part: the swimmingpool was closed. Needed of course but we did not get any notice. Next to the price, the not so appealing breakfast we will not return a 6th time.

title: Enjoyable stay
desc: Booked the deluxe room and I must say it was more than what I expected. The view was amazing,the bed was soft and comfortable and the room is big though the bathroom is a little small. And the location is wonderful though there wasn't any convenience store or supermarket nearby. Overall, I did enjoy my stay in Dorsett and will definitely return for another stay.

title: Great location!
desc: We are on our honeymoon and the Dorsett in Singapore was our 1st stop.. 2 night stay.. from the airport you can get a shuttle ($9SGDpp) or taxi ($20) it's so close to China town and malls for indoor shopping. People at the hotel are very friendly, the rooms are spacious.. highly recommend.

title: Sensational Location
desc: This was a great hotel, we loved the location so much - right over the train station at Outram Park which is sensational as a tourist to get pretty much everywhere. Found the staff to be lovely and helpful, we received an upgrade to a balcony room with a gorgeous koi pond outside. Room was gorgeous, the only downside was the bed was too firm which left my hubby and I sore after long days of walking and exploring Singapore. The pool was so refreshing and a beautifully set out area. We will definitely be back to the Dorsett when in Singapore :)

title: Comfortable hotel, good location
desc: Stayed here for three nights. Hotel room and bathroom reasonable sized but lacking in storage space. Comfy, large bed. Singapore is an expensive city to stay in and for the price & location this was good value. Outram Park subway was on the doorstep and Chinatown a five minute walk away so great location.

title: Comfy Hotel with Great Location
desc: I love this hotel. Located on the top of Outram Mrt and near the road makes us easy to go anywhere in spore. The staff are friendly and educated The bed is super comfy and the city view is great. The only thing I dont like is the door of the bathroom that can not be locked, that makes the bathroom feels very cold and there's no mirror in the room, that makes quite difficult using the hairdryer which plug in on the room while the mirror is on the bathroom.

title: Fab Location
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights on our way home from Australia. On check in we were upgraded and when we entered our very spacious modern room we were greeted with a birthday cake for my husband. Very pleased with the room,however must point out that there are not enough electrical sockets,a massive mirror but no socket anywhere near to dry your hair,this was a struggle for me trying to stretch the wire from the side of the bed to the bathroom mirror. We found all the staff to be efficient and helpful. The main plus however is the location which is great,we had a 3 day tourist pass which allowed us to travel unlimited on public transport and we used the MRT all day everyday,so convenient having the OutramPark station virtually attached to the hotel. All in all would recommend and

title: kitch and nothing else
desc: Room too small and expensive, bathroom door is not a real door (couples avoid it),, king bed are too single beds put together, lamp near the bed doesn't work and noone repaired it despite the demand, bathroom flooded wtith water after each shower etc. Breakfast choice very limited. Decor very very kitchy

title: Great Hotel
desc: I spent 5 nights at the Dorsett and had a great time. The hotel is very good, very welcoming staff, made me feel right at home. The rooms are good, I was upgraded, I was a bit worried that as the hotel was on a busy junction the noise would filter into the rooms but no. The rooms are very quiet and well laid out. Plenty of space in the rooms and good for both business and holiday stays. There is a restaurant on site where you can get breakfast, very good choice of food. Pool and gym facilities are good. Had a chance to talk to the General manager there, he was very helpful and obviously takes a great pride in his hotel and staff, well done. I'll see you again later in the year. Close to Chinatown and you could walk to loads of restaurants in Clarke Quay of you want.

title: Very nice hotel
desc: Singapore is not the cheapest hotel city in the world and when traveling alone I often find it quite hard to find nice room by reasonable price. Dorsett fulfilled all my needs. The location is great: SMRT station exit is just next to the hotel and by the line coming straight from the airport so no changes between lines is needed. River side areas can be reached by foot in about 15 minutes. China town located nearby is interesting and there are amazing restaurants nearby. Public areas are decorated in funny way. The room was spacious, clean and decorated in simple but elegant way. The bed was very good and room was silent and peaceful so I really slept well and that is of course the most important thing. The staff in this hotel were very friendly and pleasant.

title: Best hotel in Singapore for wheelchair users
desc: Room s 931 and 331 I have used on two separate visits to Singapore. Spacious tool in shower and toilet have plenty of room for commode. Soft beds leave no pressure sores, even on the least protected areas. Close to hospital, Chinatown and MRT stations. Some hotels here say they are wheelchair friendly but have steps into shower. Not here. The Dorsett is truly accessible, even for a high level quadriplegic like me. plenty of transfer room next to bed. 2x showerheads. Rates are great. If you are in a chair or have mobility issues then this is the hotel for you. Room even has a complimentary cell phone with unlimited free wifi and 3g mobile data all over Singapore and free local calls plus free calling to USA, UK and China for the course of your stay. Excellent, modern Hotel and

title: 2 night stay
desc: Staff are very helpful and anything you ask for (like towels etc) it'll be at your room in 2 seconds, they take your luggage up for you. They pretty much do everything for you! Pool area is nice and clean the only down fall of this hotel is the building site opposite but once that's done it'll be fine and they don't mention you have to pay 200S$ deposit incase you break anything. It is located next to Chinatown right next to the underground. Clean modern quiet hotel. The free water is a big help, ask at reception for a bottle when you're out and about! Highly recommended hotel

title: Could not fault
desc: Just spent two nights at the Dorset would have liked it to be longer , first contact says a lot about a hotel and our first contact with reception was outstanding ,courteous, afficient ,informative and speedy . The room was great , good view adequate size and very clean . Breakfast was good ,not a large selection however ,more than adequate Just a short walk to china town and shops ,railway station on the doorstep all in all a fabulous stay have already got some friends booking in later in the year great value for your money considering costs in Singapore

title: Not a present experience with a small local brand
desc: Not my usual choice of hotel brands, but I gave it a go anyway. So, I got myself an executive double room with bath tub and walk-in rain shower for 4 nights. On the 1st night they put me into a room with barely wifi coverage and they suggested a change of room. However on the 2nd night in the replacement room there was no water stopper for the bath tub, so I called the front desk and they send a technician up to check it out. He took off after a glimpse, he didn't return after 45 mins so I called the front desk again to check on the status. After 5 mins or so, the technician came back with the manager saying 'they don't have a replacement stopper to spare' and suggested a change of room again the next day, meanwhile they will use duct tape for a bush fix. I turned down their

title: Great Location on the MRT so close to everything
desc: The Hotel is clean and in reasonable condition. It is exactly what it says it is, a 4 star hotel. If anyone was to criticise the standard they do not uderstand what the star rating is about. Unfortuatly the pool was closed for the durtion of our stay for maintenance purposes. A little unfortunate given the hot weather. Otherwise exactly what I expected.

title: Very unfriendly reception, not got what I booked
desc: This never happened to me before but there seems to be a first time for everything. I boooked via booking.com, 2 rooms, 3 nights, one extra bed for my youngest son. Booking was confirmed and deducted from my credit card months before the trip. Arriving at the hotel I was told that an extra bed was impossible and there were no other solutions because the hotel was fully booked. Even a money refund was not possible ! Only after intervention with the great help of booking.com I managed to get a solution. Suddenly the extra bed was possible. Be carefull when booking this hotel online ! Rooms are somehow OK, but it looks like no major renovation was done for some years already. Not too bad but definitely not 4-star. Breakfast buffet was rather poor. Never again.

title: A touch of Luxury
desc: We spent 3 nights here on our way home to Australia from India. We were so tired when we arrived and staff went out of there way to get our room organised as quickly as they could. The room was absolutely lovely and far more than we expected for the price. Room was quite big with a great view, King bed and even a rain shower in the very nice bathroom. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble for the staff they were so helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great. Hotel is easily reached and is literally on the Outram Park metro stop with access to that metro from the hotel. Easy to get to Orchard Road and Santosa from the metro. Hotel itself within walking distance to China Town.Would highly recommend to anyone who wants a bit of affordable luxury..

title: A New, Clean and Modern Hotel
desc: The hotel is beside to the exit of MRT station. The exterior is quite cool, and the interior is also very new and modern. Rooms are clean, not very small. Since we have booked the deluxe twim room which has a balcony, we could really enjoy the beautiful view of Singapore. There is an open garden (forgotten about which floor located) that are worth to have a walk to relax and enjoy the scenery.

title: great hotel perfect location
desc: stayed here on jan 2016, the room is not too big, but great, comes with complete amenities.. the room's wifi is great. perfect location, walking distance to chinatown..just 7 minutes walk to chinatown, ver close to MRT.. will be back again

title: Fair hotel
desc: Overall well appointed hotel in convenient location to Chinatown and mrt. Smaller rooms than expected and I had a few issues:- fridge not working light bulbs flickering / out. Sink was not draining However all were rectified in no time at all.

title: Great location but average rooms
desc: The location is great! It's right next to the subway line and adjacent to Chinatown. The food street is less than10 minutes away by foot. Tons of restaurants around. Close to Singapore General Hospital (irrelevant to most). The rooms were small and very basic. The air-conditioning in my room was not working properly but they fixed it. Breakfast was okay. Not bad for a neighborhood hotel!

title: Great Stay, Great Location
desc: This hotel is located right about the MRT station which made it super convenient to easily get around Singapore. It's a 10 minute walk from Chinatown (train station and food centre). The hotel is big but the staff was friendly and the room

title: A very mixed bag
desc: This was recommended as a business hotel (and that‚Äôs what it calls itself), but based on this experience I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs more of a package holiday destination, mainly for people from China. The restaurant experience was a nightmare on occasions. One morning the holiday makers were swarming over the breakfast room and one group of these folk actually moved all my breakfast onto the shelf when I went to get another coffee and took over my place ‚Äì the waitress just said I should sit somewhere else! One night the restaurant was closed for a private function so I was told to go eat somewhere else, which is not what I expect as a business traveller after a really tiring meeting that lasted 10 hours. But on the nights that I could get into the restaurant it was good tasty fayre at a

title: Unhelpful staff and management. Inappropriate for business travel
desc: Staying at the Dorsett for ca. 2 months due to company travel. 2 weeks in I had to travel back to Europe due to an emergency. Hotel staff and management refused to store my luggage for 2 weeks, because I did not have a confirmed return booking and they were low in storage space. Very unaccomodative and inflexible,especially considering my long stay and the fact I pleaded with them due to the emergency. I spoke to the manager who repeated to me the policy and did not offer any practical solutions. Additionally: Gym is very small and with only very few and basic equipment. Pool is very small and very poorly lit which does not allow for evening exercise. There is no business center Room service closes at 22.15 Restaurant at hotel last order 21.45. Menu is also very limited and

title: With Family
desc: We were placed to connecting rooms. Cleanliness and Location were great! No complains at all. Walking distance to Chinatown market, easy to get to any food court. Friendly distances to many places, Outram Park MRT station, taxi easy to get. Personally like the two sided sliding wardrobe.

title: Comfort, clean and friendly stafff
desc: The room is very clean and comfortable with friendly staff. It location is near a lot of attraction in Singapore and can getting around very easy by metro line. They have swimming pool and gym for free for staying guest. I like this place a lot.

title: excellent
desc: Very close to Chinatown and directly above MRT. Staff was kind and provided all requests promptly. A small issue with the room was promptly fixed. I would stay here again and at other Dorsett properties happily. The gym closing at 10pm is a bummer but I think it is to keep people from accessing the pool which makes sense(ish) strong wifi but limited English TV options

title: Recommended.
desc: Singapore was the third country that we visited during our 9 - day trip. We were very much looking forward to it despite being utterly exhausted. Dorsett Singapore is very accessible from the Changi Airport. You can either pick a taxi or take the train; either way, it's very convenient. Initially, you would be mesmerized by the glitter of the hotel's lobby and facade. It's very well - designed and well - maintained. The friendly staff welcoming you from the front door and accommodates you fully that ranges from your inquiries before going to the hotel until you check - out. Though I don't particularly consider this a very big deal, (having been to Dorsett Malaysia before going here) I could definitely compare the size of the rooms. But that was it. The buffet was also okay.

title: Excellent Service and great Location
desc: Situated ten minutes walk from Chinatown and twenty minutes walk from the river the Hotel is in a great position with an MRT station right on its doorsteps and is well serviced by Taxi but be warned Taxi in Singapore is not cheap the Mass Rapid Transport System is excellent and very reasonabley priced. My room was top class spacious and modern with a great standard of housekeeping, Breakfast was good with a wide variety of Western and Oriental Food, the food in the restaurant was also varied and of a good standard. A spacious swimming pool and roof garden are also a nice place to sit and relax, a very enjoyable stay and would highly recommend the Dorsett

title: Average
desc: We booked a night at the loft room for a staycation. I liked the concept of the room - you'll need to conquer a flight of stairs before reaching your bed. However, the room doesnt feel too clean with very dated carpets and sofa. The bathroom had a nice rainshower although it takes alot of time and skill to get the water temperature right. Breakfast was really bad. Only have it if its complimentary. Oh yes, be sure to check the room's alarm clock.. Ours was rang at 6am by default!

title: Third time a charm
desc: Dorsett has been our favorite hotel for a short stay in singapore. Check in was seamless and we re allowed for early check in, which was nice after taking 6am flight from Jakarta. Room was small but nicely lit and designed. Bed was comfortable. Tried the swimming pool, i think 30-35m great for laps, though not wide enough for more than 3-4 people doing laps. Access to MRT was great with both lift and escalator outside going straight to outram park MRT station. Food is aplenty, china town is 5mins walk and behind the hotel at keong saik road, plenty of restaurant and bars to dine and drink. Overall, another great stay at Dorsett.

title: Great location.
desc: Traveled from Johor by coach crossing the Causeway and exchange at Kranji Station by 961 bus and reach just opposite the hotel after advises from the bus driver. Very nice guy as he accept the difference in fare in RM. Walking distant to China Town and plenty of pubs behind. Also there is an MRT Station is just beneath the hotel.

title: Nice design, comfortable rooms
desc: Nice hotel located right above the MRT. Very comfortable beds and good service from the staff. Really liked the design of the hotel and the rooms. Free wifi provided. Value for the price! Good for both family and business

title: Stay over for Oz
desc: Spent 3 nights here staff very friendly & helpful. Hotel room modern, clean and compact with all that is required for a city break. Breakfast quite expensive but not a lot on offer outside of hotel. Within easy reach of China Town and taxis good and drivers very informative.

title: Comfortable stay
desc: My partner and I, young professional couple in our early 30s, spent four nights over a weekend at the Dorsett in early January. We picked the hotel we want to stay close to Chinatown for the weekend but want to stay at a full size business hotel rather than the boutiques hotel in convert heritage shop houses. The price for a room at the Dorsett was quite a bit cheaper than other comparable options, so we opted for it. We had a pretty decent one. The location of the hotel was quite good. It is right on top of the Outram Park station, just on the edge of Chinatown, which makes it very convenient but also not as chaotic/messy as the actual Chinatown. We went out and stayed out quite late, well into the early morning, but always felt pretty safe walking in the area close to the

title: Bad experience
desc: Booked a room with king size bed but ended up with a twin room- reason: hotel fully booked... Was wondering what's the reason to book in the first place...Waited for 3 hours to get a room ready. Though check in time is 3pm, but only managed to step into a room at 4:30pm...

title: Sg 15
desc: Dorsett singapore..... The this hotel chain was really good. The staff are nice, the place was really good. Near attractions and the room are clean. Also it was kinda good for a budget trip. I would definitely go back to this hotel. As a solo, couple or family trip.

title: Close to Chinatown and MRT station
desc: The hotel room was good enough, but there was not really any place to put my big suitcase, so it ended up a bit awkwardly just inside the door. The shower was very nice, clearly equipped for persons with disabilities with a ledge to sit on and hand-held shower. The room was nice with the usual amenities and complimentary water which I appreciated. Wifi is complimentary. The only thing that stood out were the glasses, which were plastic. I'm sure there is a good reason for that, i just felt a bit at odds with a four star hotel. The pool was very refreshing in the Singapore heat. There is a lot of construction going on around the hotel, but you can't hear anything of that inside the hotel. Next door is exit H of the Outram Park MRT station, so it's easy to get around the city and

title: Could have been better
desc: Booked 3 rooms for a business trip to Singapore based on reviews given but was disappointed with a couple of things. Firstly, upon entering the room the chair next to the desk had a disgusting sticky residue which had been left by the previous occupants and had not been cleaned before our arrival. Spoke to a member of staff who was apologetic but not a great first start. Before we started our meetings the following morning we thought we would relax by the pool - nope, from 18th until 22nd January - the pool was being cleaned (the entire duration of our stay)...great(!) Moving swiftly on to the room...standard twin sharing with a weird design of the bathroom and cupboard which is kind of a slide design and the toilet door and shower door were interchangeable swinging between both

title: Small rooms and bad toilet shower layout
desc: Understand this is an older hotel with smaller rooms than some of the more pricier newer ones. However, the layout of the toilet and shower area is super painful. Door swings open that conflicts with getting in and out of the shower if the door is closed. Basically no privacy going in and out of the shower if you are sharing a room with only just a friend. Not only that, but the water can leak out of the shower area and into the toilet basin area as well. Beds are quite small but comfortable. Air conditioning is super cold as well.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service.
desc: Spent a few days with family getaway in Singapore, found this nice hotel just walking distance to Chinatown, and right on top of Outram Park MRT station. Upon check-in, the hotel staff was very courteous and professional. Was not expecting such kind service, especially when I was used to the casual environment here in the US. Room was not huge but very cozy and comfortable, and all the amenities were provided. During the stay, I need to print an email urgently, the front desk helped us out immediately. That made the entire trip ran smoothly. Highly recommend this hotel for any type of visitors and tourists.

title: Good Location, near to MRT, Clean & Excellent Services
desc: We stay here for 3 nights. This hotel near Outrampark MRT station, only one minute walk and near Chinatown. Rooms clean & bed very comfortable. Polite receptionist lady helped us with the taxi reservation to airport. Definitely will come back again.

title: Good value for the money. Very good location, in China Town, and next to Outram Park metro station.
desc: We had to change rooms and I noticed that the twin bed room didn't look as good as the matrimonial bed one and it was smaller. There are plenty eateries in the area with very good food. Located in China Town, besides eating well one can also do some cheap shopping compared to malls. All in all we had a wonderful experience.

title: Slightly dissapointing stay
desc: 1 night stay on 26 December 2015 to 27 December. Was keen to check out the place since it was newly opened not too long ago. However, the stay was nothing fascinating. Apart from its central location, the experience was just average. 1) Waited 20 mins to check-in as room was not ready. 1.40pm, went to ask for check-in, was told that room was not ready, they will inform me again. 2.05pm, had to head back to counter to ask for check-in, only then another staff assisted to get a room the soonest. Staff did not have the initiative to ensure that guests waiting to check-in was served (not something that I would expect from a 4 star hotel). 2) Bed linens are not changed everytime. They place a card on the bed to inform guests that bed linens are not changed everyday to be

title: Liked it much
desc: Extremely friendly staff but who is not very friendly professionally in Singapore? Very good and central location in the old city center next door to the metro. Very reasonably priced although rooms are small but who comes here to stay on the hotel room? Very much recommended.

title: Good location.
desc: Stayed for one week, room is slightly bigger compare to other hotel with similar price range and age of hotel. Air conditioning is super cold, however the pillow and quilt makes it really comfortable. Decent swimming pool, and OK fitness center however the gym has an odd smell. Excellent location, less than one minute walk to mrt and is just one station away from vivo city and chinatown. Not much place to buy food or convenience store nearby. Overall, for the price and location is good value.

title: Clean and near MRT
desc: The Dorset hotel location near Outrampark MRT station only one minute walk and near chinatown , bedroom clean but small , AC not too cold , bathroom too small , but overall ok , the staff very helpfull , breakfast at the resto (papasan) is perfect

title: Central
desc: Stayed in this hotel as part of a staycation with easy access to Sentosa and Chinatown. Was upgraded to a duplex suite which was a nice touch (unfortunately the room does not come with a bathtub). It is just beside the Outram Park MRT station, making travelling around very easy. Will highly recommend.

title: Does what it says on the label
desc: Third time staying here and I will return. Good value for money, good location over MRT and stones throw from Chinatown. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean, bed very comfortable and sound proofing good as you cannot hear the busy traffic outside or the construction works.

title: Lovely hotel and nice area
desc: Good standard four star hotel with very friendly helpful front desk staff. The standard rooms are large enough ( weird bathroom lay out but ok if your comfortable with your partner! ) The location was perfect for me and my girlfriend as its right next to China town, train station and all that wonderful food. China town food street is 200 meters to the right of the hotel and maxwell food court is also very close. Both have wonderful tasting street food. The hotel breakfast is $20 each per person per day so we opted to go outside and we did not regret it.

title: Conference stay
desc: The room is small but cosy. Was really impressed that all rooms are soundproof, and we cannot hear any sound from the heavy traffic just outside the hotel as well as from the construction ongoing nearby. The breakfast is decent but variety is limited. Location is perfect as the Outram Park MRT station is just below the hotel.

title: Fuss free stay & very good value.
desc: We like this hotel because 1. It has direct access to the mrt station. ( Outram park , north east line) The covered access to the mrt exit meant you won't get wet esp in tropical Spore. If you are exiting the station look for exit h. There is a dedicated lift up to street level where hotel is. 2. Clean rooms, well designed to make use of the compact space. Honestly it was quite spacious considering how expensive Spore is. We had a king bed which was great for 2 adults & a young child. Bathroom was pretty big. Aircond temperature was easily adjustable. Modern, clean lines. 3. Very near Chinatown where there is plenty of eateries. Too lazy to walk , we just hopped on the mrt and the Chinatown station was just a stop away. 4. One mrt stop away fr Harbourfront which is the gateway

title: Lovely place to stay..!
desc: I stay here for a liesure in Singapore, My friend book this hotel for one night and all i can say is it's a fantastic and perfect location for the tourist like us. Very convenient for any types of transportation. The room is perfect very comfy, The frontdesk staff is friendly, responsive and very approachable; i cant forget her name she's GINGER a pretty cute smile. Housekeeping staff, waiters are the potential staff of this hotel. Its a 4* hotel but 5* service. Planning to get back soon and definitely will stay in this hotel again. Thank you dorsett for giving me a memorable stay in Singapore.

title: 2 days of good stay
desc: it was great to be back again here... ease of transportation buses/mrt and taxis near to chinatown only thing is need more bell hoppers to attend to our bags. all in all another great stay here will be coming again soon

title: Good location
desc: Had 2 nights here in October - location was good for us. Walking distance to Chinatown, MRT station. Our room was clean and comfortable. Staff friendly. Breakfast was good (look for the egg station outside). Nice pool.

title: Small but complete my stay
desc: I just had the short stay there but two times for Singapore trip , the hotel room is small just like overall hotel in Singapore But it is clean and bed quality is lovely. Also the location is very convenience to go everywhere by MRT , Location also nearby Chinatown by walking :)

title: Relaxing and wonderful hotel
desc: Been here last three month, service excellent as usual. Room and linen bed clean and comfortable. Room amenities great. Great location near Outram Park MRT and Chinatown area with local food that can find easily. Definately will come back again.

title: Good hotel but definitely a lot of rooms to improve
desc: Stay here only for 2 nights, on a business trip. I pick this hotel just because they provide a corporate price. And quite near to my office and chinatown. Chinatown means a lot good food open till late. Its only 5-10 mins walking distance. The location is great. Few steps from Outram Park MRT Station. Reception was okay. And room was just as standard size in Singapore. Not easy to find a spacious room in Singapore. The room was not spacious, but very functionality. And quite complete amenities. I'm not sure what is wrong with the bedsheet, but for sure it is very itchy. Too bad, the bedsheet just ruin the comfortness of the bed itaelf and the pillow. My biggest dissapointment are on the breakfast resto, Pappasan. They just not ready for full capacity. I have to wait 20

title: two day stay
desc: w we arrived very early 6 30 am and although check in is 2pm we were in our room by 10 am the staff were very helpfull fantastic out door pool good breakfast good service the mrt is right under the hotel, the green line chinatown the best way to get around

title: Relaxing rooms near the bustle of Chinatown
desc: The Dorsett Singapore is one block away from the Outram Park metro station (I never understand why upscale hotels don't seem to want to let that information out - why should we spend much more on a taxi if we don't mind public transport?). Very clean, quiet, relaxing. Beautiful rooms, if a little small. There is what looks and smelled like a superb restaurant on site; however, I did not eat there.

title: Marvelous service and convenient
desc: Stayed here over the weekend with friends and the hotel itself is very conveniently located (Outram Park for green and purple line interchange). The room size is considerably big for Singapore hotel and the bed is big + comfy. The swimming pool at night is very cooling and breezy. Would love to stay here again!

title: HOTEL RIP OFF
desc: I booked into this hotel for a one night stay whilst I did business in Singapore I arrived late. My check in details were all good and the staff were efficient. HOWEVER why is there always a however with hotels. I had prepaid for the night including breakfast. I was asked for a security deposit and being 1 am in the monenig i was not thinking clearly. The hotel wanted to swipe my card - I always use a debit card and normally refuse to pay any security deposit as the hotels are fully paid BEFORE you arrive - its insulting and suggests that all travellers will do something to the hotel. I to speed things up offered my debit card and advised the staff that is was a debit card. The card as DEDUCTED and not like a credit card takes about 7 days to come back. Next morning

title: Clean room with good location
desc: This is my first time staying in Dorsett Singapore. I am a big fan of Dorsett Mongkok. Location wise, it is very good and directly on the top of outram park station. Staff performance is great. However, there is not much surround the hotel and if you need to walk to buy some food, it is better to take a train. Their wifi is free and fast. Their swimming pool is just fabulous.

title: Gem in Chinatown
desc: Clean, comfortable room. Walking distance to chinatown and a train station next to hotel. Even though it is situated at the corner of a cross junction of a busy road, it is not noisy when you are in the room. Service was excellent, the room was neat & tidy.Don't expect it to be a 5-star hotel but it's worth it being a 4-star. I would go back there whenever I'm back in Singapore.

title: Great Location!
desc: This is a nice hotel and in a great location. It's across the street to Outram Park MRT and close to Chinatown restaurants and bars. The rooms are comfortable and staff is very nice. The pool and fitness centre are nice as well.

title: Great stay
desc: I had booked into their Dorsett room for 4 nights in December 2015. The room size was perfectly adequate (remember this is Singapore). The bed was comfortable. Free wi-fi is great. The only minor complaint I have is that on some days housekeeping was patchy (forgetting to replenish towels, and tea and coffee), but the friendly staff are always on hand to solve these problems. I did think it a little strange that no coffee cups were provided (I had to drink my tea and instant coffee out of a glass, a little challenging given it was too hot to pick up for a while). There's a small gym and pool. All very helpful if you need to get the blood flowing after long flights and hours at the desk. Or just to burn the calories from hawker food binges! The hotel's location close to

title: There sure are better options
desc: We were traveling with our kids, up front asked for interconnected rooms or rooms next to each other. Of course, it was not the case when we arrived. On top of that one of the rooms we were given smelled terribly so we had to change. The water stayed in the sink in one of the rooms, we reported it the first night. During our 3 nights stay it has not been fixed!!!! even thought we remained the reception couple of time. We strongly recommend to avoid the Pappasan restaurant in the hotel. The food is average at best but the service is absolutely horrible. After we finished our meal, we were waiting for 15 minutes for a waiter to remove empty plates. It only happened after we remained her. Nobody asked us if we want another drink or desert, she simply took our empty glasses and

title: Classy and in the city center
desc: Visited Singapore for work, the company put me up at Dorsett. This is a fairly new hotel, looks decent from the outside but the rooms are quite contemporary in the way they have been done. The rooms are really nice and cozy. This is a NON - Smoking hotel so if you are a smoker then you might want to look out for another option. This place is 10-15mins walk from China town and quite accessible to other locations like beach road which is a nice place to hang out after being done with work. The hotel is right outside Outram park MRT so if you are a little cautious about spending on taxi since Singapore is quiet expensive that way then MRT is the best way to commute. Down an app called Explore Singpore which will give you the blueprint of the MRT in Singapore. Overall a good

title: Great location
desc: Location of the hotel was just nice, with lots of restaurants and bars nearby and linked to the underground train station as well. Stayed in the splash room, small but comfy. Maybe housekeeping needs more eye for details; soap bottles were still left in the bathroom from the previous guest and some amenities were not replenished.

title: Nice, comfortable and stylish place to stay.
desc: Literally over a MRT station (with it‚Äôs own lift to it), very friendly and helpful staff (nthing is a problem). Great rooms with large beds and all-you-need amenities. Comfortable beds, all clean and smelling nice.

title: New Modern Hip Hotel Near Outram Park
desc: Just a short trip to stay in Singapore for major International event in End of October month, I have had a chance to stay at Newly Hip Hotel name "Dorsett Hotel". This hotel is newly renovate for about 2-3 years ago. Hence, everything is quite nice and new!. A theme of Hotel is decorate in colorful and jazzy. If you love to stay with kind of Hip Hotel, Dorsett Hotel is recommended for you!, Dorsett hotel is located at a New Bridge Road easier for transport to any majors location in Singapore, If you want to travel by MRT, you can walk at 100meter distance to Outram Park MRT station (EW16/NE3). This is very convenience for everyone. Check-in and process took you not so long, all staffs are very nice and friendly. Rooms is limited as Hotel has 10 storey only. Design for room

title: Good location, comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff.
desc: Made a last minute booking two days before travelling to Singapore on a solo trip. Stayed in room 526 from 21 Oct, checked out today 25 Oct. Due to short booking time the room had twin beds, would have preferred a double however in saying that the single bed was really comfortable and I slept well each night. The room would have been crowded with two occupants. The amenities provided in the room were good, the free wifi was excellent and the cleaning was ok. The room was extremely well insulated, it is right on the intersection of two busy roads... I slept like a log. For the price paid I think breakfast should be included in the cost, saves having to worry about paying extra. Breakfast each morning was good, a reasonable selection available, The egg station was great, the

title: Too Good
desc: Everything was perfect just a lil suggestion that to extend the room size else it was a great stay in the end i will recommend you for sure..! and MRT (metro) is very near..! staff is also cooperative..!! and breakfast buffet is also perfect..!

title: Great area and good room design
desc: Hotel location is very cloce to Outram Park MRT station, close to Chinatown which have many food centre and resto, surounded by old shop houses heritage building, Nice area. Very good room layout design, very eficient, specially how they arrange to locate the 1 door for shower and toilet.

title: 10 Day Trip
desc: We stayed at the Dorsett for 10 days for a family reunion. Medical facilities & Police are on the next block. It is on the edge of Chinatown with buses close by, taxis ordered for you by the concierge & the MRT is basically below it. The rooms are quite small but comfortable. The staff are very friendly & go out of their way to help you.

title: Great location and service
desc: We had a two night stop here on the way back from Thailand. As mentioned in other reviews it's very close to Outram Park MRT so very easy to navigate your way around, one stop to Chinatown, two / three to Little India. The hotel is modern and smart, the room was clean and well designed. As big as you'd expect. Breakfast was ok but for $20++ (normally $28++ apparently) I probably wouldn't bother next time. The service throughout was excellent, particularly Angeliah on our check out day who was particularly helpful. Would return.

title: Great area, close to MRT and Chinatown
desc: Second time staying in Singapore and this time was our favourite. Great location, close to the MRT and Chinatown. Great staff. Room was more than sufficient. We stayed for my birthday and they even gave us a birthday cake in our room on arrival. Would definitely stay at the Dorsett again and recommend! Thanks for making our stay so pleasurable!!

title: Great new hotel. Improvements needed.
desc: Hotel is very well situated near Outram Park MRT station. Private lift to MRT. Great plus point. Honestly staff are friendly, and i do get an early check in and late check out. Hats off. Now there is only one person on the concierge when i arrive, hence i had to take my 29 inch and 22 kgs luggage from taxi to reception and to room. This needs improvement. Rooms are not to big.. But nicely decorated. Bathroom is good size. Hot water good. Nice 40 inch led tv.. Nice. Plus point is the bed, pillows and blankets.. Very.. Very.. Very comfy.. I am picky on the bed i sleep, and believe me when i say dorsett has great beds.. Did i say comfy too? :) Woke up to an excellent mood and late.. Blame it on the bed. Didnt try breakfast so nothing to comment there. Locality situation. Near

title: Nice city hotel
desc: We stayed for 3 nights at the dorsett and were basically happy with the hotel! The good things: great location (mrt station right under the hotel, very close to chinatown - just a 5 minutes walk), clean and comfy rooms (rain shower, big bed, silent a&c), fitness room (not very new, but better than nothing). The not so good things: the whole hotel is a little worn and not very well kept, the staff isn't very obliging, the breakfast isn't worth a dollar (very limited choices, no refill - so go there at 7 otherwise you won't get any bread, fruits or cheese)

title: Great location
desc: The hotel is located at a superb location just above the MRT station. Very close to Chinatown within walking distance. Upgraded to a deluxe room with city view, which was comfy and clean, with good wifi network indoor. Will come back again.

title: A relaxing great staycation!
desc: Dorsett Singapore is a 4 star hotel conveniently located at the corner of the road junction between New Bridge Road and Cantonment Road. It is also situated right beside Outram Park MRT. The hotel exudes an artistic atmosphere and is well maintained. The hotel rates are very reasonable considering how comfortable and nice the hotel rooms are. We booked the Splash Room even though it‚Äôs a tad expensive compared to the other rooms because I felt that the difference in price is worth it for the bathtub. The bed was pretty comfortable too! Overall, the staycation experience at Dorsett was nice as we felt that the hotel is stylish, modern and clean. Its strategic location beside Outram Park MRT is another plus point and the price of a night‚Äôs stay is also reasonable. For a

title: They try hard but still do not get it right
desc: Dorsett seemed to be a perfect fit: New, close to China Town and in walking distance to the MRT. The international staff seems nice on the first sight but if any problems occur they lose the professionall facade. This happened when I complained about the obviouse smoking smell (in a non smoking hotel) in the room they gave me during check in. Ok, they booked me into another room. So far so good. The bed sheets however had black/brownish stripes. Slowly they send someone to replace the sheets. There were several tourist groups staying on my floor. This meant loud noise on the floor in the morning and the evening. I checked out after 3 days since I was not happy with the hotel.

title: Great price
desc: We used to stay at the park hotel, loved it But it has become pricey, so we tried the dorset, the room was great size for singapore, good price, staff great, mrt station situated under hotel. If you book in advance and pay you get a good deal. Make sure you dredge down the online booking sight to get the best deal

title: Nice and decent hotel
desc: Dorsett hotel has a really good location in my opinion - next to Chinatown, short walk away from Clark Quay area, metro station is just underneath the hotel and it's not too far away from Sentosa island either. The staff is really friendly and helpful. Breakfast was OK, nothing extraordinary. The room I had was very comfy and nice, with a great view to a small pond. Bed and shower were a bit short for my height, but it didn't disturb me really. Only thing I was not pleased was the noise made by other hotel customers. Had to wake up almost every night because of that. It disturbs a lot when you are on a business trip with early-bed-early-up schedule. But generally speaking, everything else was exactly like it should be and once again, would like to thank the staff for their

title: Great Stay and service fantastic!
desc: Back to Singapore and stay again at Dorsett Hotel Singapore. The stay is great and the service is fantastic compare last time we stay here. Housekeeping is great with clean room provided daily. Friendly chambermaid and reception staff. Breakfast at Papasan restaurant got slightly improvement. Location still the best nearby Chinatown area. Thank you and will come again in the future.

title: An excellent hotel at a strategical location! Great value for money!
desc: Had a complete satisfaction with this modern hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights as a transit. The location was excellent, just a few minutes walk to the station and many shopping centres, including Chinatown. The room was very spacious for the two of us and our huge luggages, and the bed was super comfy. We love the fast free WiFi. The most important thing was the customer service. I could remember the polite receptionist lady greeted us each time we walked through the entrance door or when we walked out of the elevator. She even helped us with the taxi reservation to airport. Just could not understand the behaviour of some guests who chose to smoke just in front of the entrance door knowing that it was a non-smoking hotel.

title: Good local food near Chinatown
desc: Hotel has a great lobby - rooms are a little small. Was upgraded to a loft style room with bed upstairs. On the first level - hardly any room to put two suitcases. Staff was ok not super friendly. The location was great - right next to the subway and a ten minute walk to Chinatown for some great local food.

title: Good location with improved services
desc: Returning due to the location and rates. Services felt much better than the last which was a few months ago. Managers has changed and offered room extension due to flight time as was not given a double bed but twin bed instead.

title: Good location
desc: We have spent 3 nights in Dorsett, Singapore. We arrived at night. The staff was very kind. The room wasn't too big, but it was enough for us. The bed was very very comfortable, we wanted to take home, but we hadn't got enough space in our suitcase. The hotel located in Outram Park MRT station with own lift straigt to the hotel. You have to fallow H exit. The room was clean. So my opinion: great hotel with good location, and great for that person who don't want to stay all day in the hotel.

title: Great Hotel But..
desc: Stayed for a leisure trip to Singapore. Love the interior, the bed is really comfortable, quite spacious room for a solo traveller, near Chinatown and just within walking distance to train station. Tried the breakfast and it was ok, not too many varieties but enough for a breakfast menu. They have nice swimming pool overlooking the city and a fitness centre. But when I used the toilet near the pool, ewww it was really dirty.. and no staff stand by to clean it up. Overall experience was satisfying, especially the helpful and professional services of the staff (Concierge, Bellman and Front Desk staffs). I wish the service at the restaurant during breakfast was as good as the other departments, I remember I still have little food at my plate and there was a lady just picked up my

title: Comfortable & accessible
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights and loved the fact that it has access to the mrt station (it's actually right beside it and has its own lift going to the station) . The bed was comfortable, staff was friendly and kind enough to extend our stay for a couple of hours at no cost. It's also in a relatively less busy part of the city so congestion wasn't that bad.

title: F1visit
desc: This is the second time I have stayed at the Dorsett Singapore but this time I have brought my son and daughter . This hotel is perfectly placed for exploring the city as it's situated right on the MRT (underground) the staff are always polite and friendly and the hotel is scrupulously clean . Mid range priced hotel which will not fail to act as a base for your holiday. Enjoy üòç

title: Recomended palce to stay.!
desc: A pleasant hotel in the middle of city, pretty great location adjacent to MRT Station. Clean and modern hotel. Well priced for hotel in Singapore. Recomended to stay if you are on bussiness or short trip. Btw i came to stay in Dorsett hotel with my wife and daughter, we stay here for 5 nites. At this very moment is our 3rd nite and Dorsett had me to write and gives rate allready in Tripadvisor. Will comeback and stay again at Dorsett Hotel.

title: Great Accommodation in China Town
desc: Booking in and checking on our return stay booking for following month by staff was easy, handled very professionally and happily. Staff were considerate & helpful, especially when giving information or booking a Taxi, The rooms were very clean & comfortable with good size bathrooms, everything a traveler needs including scales. We stayed 2 days on the way to Paris & 3 days on return to Australia, both times the weather was extremely hot, the room Air-conditioning bought temperatures to very comfortable levels. With double glazed windows noise levels were so quiet. I would recommend this hotel especially anyone wanting to see China Town & the real Singapore.

title: Slightly over rated 4 star
desc: Visited during the F1 period so cannot comment on value for money as rates are high as expected. Location: slightly off the main China town line. It is about a 10 minute walk to both China town area or Duxton hill. Don't expect to find the bustle of Singapore like Orchard street or Bencaloon or Clark Quay at your door step. Has a couple of MRT stations nearby but not much else walking distance. Rooms: relatively modern but small and the bathroom very poorly designed and cramped. I personally hate a WC sandwiched between a sink and a wall and a slightly bigger person would have had a hard time using it. Amenities in room very basic but above average wifi. Overall functional and more business driven where one just uses the room fir a nights sleep. Would not recommend

title: Mediocre hotel
desc: This hotel had good reviews on trip advisor but we aren't very impressed with it. The room is small, amenities are not generous(tiniest bottle of shampoo, one bath towel for two guests, very limited storage) and the staff, although helpful, are not well trained. If you decide to stay here, be aware that breakfast is considerably cheaper if you book ahead rather than come down from your room. Beats me!

title: Great location for foodies
desc: I picked Dorsett Singapore for its location and it didn't disappoint. It's just next to the Outram Park MRT stop (be sure you take the purple line, the North East Line because the green line will take you to another exit). There's even an escalator that takes you to the ground from the MRT. No change required from Changi Airport. Another plus for Dorsett Singapore is that it's in Chinatown. Right opposite hotel there's the Peranakan restaurant Candlenut. The price is on the high side although guests at Dorsett get a 10% discount (this also applies to other restaurants in the area). The hotel is also close to the famed Maxwell Food Centre and Hong lim market & food centre. All within walking distances! Great for foodies! We stayed there in early Sept for four nights and were

title: Short Stay Holiday
desc: The Dorsett Singapore proved to be great value for money in an excellent location. All of the staff and facilities proved to be better that what we anticipated. The hotel is located over Outram Park Train Station so access to all parts of the city was exceptional. The taxis are so cheap that if you are a party of 4 it would be cheaper to just catch a cab. Easy 5 minute walk to Chinatown and all of it's great eating places. One train station in the other direction to Harbourtown. All in all a great experience.

title: Lovely Hotel...next to Chinatown and train station
desc: Lovely hotel, right above the train station, which was great for us and to get around. Chinatown is a mere 3 to 5 minute walk to get to. The room was small compared to the other rooms we had on our trip, but I understand that it's in Singapore. The bathroom has a strange design, I would have hated to have been a big/large person trying to use it. The gym was okay and the pool area looked good, but did have restrictions on any food and drinks being consumed there. Overall it was good for the 2 days we stayed in Singapore...

title: Much better than I expected
desc: I booked the hotel at very last moment, not enough time to make a research. I booked and then I saw it had normal reviews in different sites, so I was prepared for a normal hotel. Turned out to be quite good. The location just next to MRT, the staff very helpful and polite. The room was small but well equiped, clean, nice bathroom, and with nice beds. What else to ask for when in a business trip???? A bit overpriced but this is Singapore...

title: Clean and efficient hotel
desc: The hotel is located very close to Chinatown which is a very entertaining part of Singapore. The room is very clean and tidy. However, the room is small but to be honest it was perfect size for us because we spent most of our time seeing Singapore incredible destinations. The breakfast is limited and repetitive. The staff were polite and always available to help us. Definitely will come again.

title: 7 STAR SERVICE
desc: My wife and I booked this hotel for our daughter 7th Birthday. We planned to have a short trip to Singapore therefore we choose Dorsett hotel. Upon arrival they are very strict with regards to checking in guests at exactly 2pm but it doesn't matter... most hotels do... but what impressed me was they greeted us warmly as we arrived at the hotel and assisted us immediately with our luggage. They immediately ushered us to the concierge, took our bags for safekeeping, accompanied us to the reception for guest registration and informed us to roam around while our rooms will be available. Waiting for our check in time is not so hassle because there are many eateries and restaurants across the hotel where you can feast your eyes upon. When collecting our room key card, the counter is

title: Very good location, nice rooms
desc: I was staying at the Dorsett at a loft room. Loft rooms are located on the second floor, which makes is necessary to close the curtains at almost all times. The rooms have a good size with very comfortable beds. Unfortunately, the bedding is very warm and the air-conditioning quite windy. The controls are on the lower level of the loft unit which requires some running around to get it right. The best about the hotel it the location, directly above a MRT station and in close proximity to very nice restaurants, cafes and bars.

title: Great Location
desc: The location is perfect, it's 1 hour from airport by MRT. Outram Park Exit H is right next to the hotel. Maxwell is 10 - 15 Mins away on foot. FREE WIFI in room. Free upgrade to room with balcony at 3/F (Much appreciated) Pool looks great (Dont have chance to try it tho) Got special room decoration upon request (Thanks) Staffs are friendly and helpful.

title: design hotel neat Chinatown nd meter from a MRT station
desc: perfect location if you don't want to pay the mark-up to ne locate in the center - Orchard - Marina - it's near Chinatown - less than 10 min by foot- , nd a door away from MRT station so you're sure not to be wet during shower's time, very quite location mainly if your room face the back side. room are small (new standard) but well equipped bath room with very nice and spacious shower. Wifi very efficient and a very long swimming pool. I was upgrade to balcony that give more space

title: Good location for a short stay but not for relaxation
desc: tWe were upgraded to the loft room as there's no king bed available upon our check in. As usual, there's a tv hanging from the ceiling for loft floor which i did not feel comfortable with it. Take note if you do not like things hanging on top of your bed. The pillow (probably down feather) was too soft and i request for other options but sadly they only offer 1 type of pillow. As for normal rooms, the toilet door will be facing the bed for all king bed option. I don't understand how the designer deal with this but it's not a very good layout considering the tight space between the bed and the toilet. However, this hotel is good in term of its location. Right on top of NE MRT and walking distant of 300m or so to EW MRT. There's even a lift in Dorsett Residence to connect to

title: Hip hotel on a great location.
desc: I like this hotel. I stayed here on two separate occasions & loved my stays on both occasion. The hotel design feels very chic & modern. I like the comfortable bed most. Though the room is relatively small, it doesn't feel that way. The location is very convenient, as the MRT station (Outram Park) is just a minute walk, so that means going around the shopping & tourist areas should be breeze. No problems also talking a cab too. At the "back" of the hotel are chic resto-bars & watering holes. A further 5min walk should bring you to Chinatown. You won't find a shortage of food options even late nights. Also, Maxwell Food Center where the Tian Tian Chicken Rice is just a short 10 minute walk from the hotel. Overall, well worth the stay.

title: Great hotel and location
desc: We stayed here for 6 nights for a birthday holiday. The room was comfortable with a really nice king bed. The room was small but it's what was expected for Singapore. The rainshower was amazing but the sealant on the door needs maintenance as water does tend to splash out. Housekeeping was great and the complimentary bottles of water were appreciated. Wifi was fast as was check in. Location was wonderful. A short 5-10 minute walk to Chinatown and various hawker food markets. The hotel is in between two major metro stations. Few niggles - there was no hairdryer provided which was disappointing. There was also no power point in the bathroom, only for the shaver. One significant issue was on our last night, we discovered that the joining door in our room did not actually lock

title: Impressive facade, very comfortable, reception operation professional
desc: The breakfast was too large for us, and correspondingly expensive. Did not dine in hotel. Facilities in room ok, but storage limited. The convenience of being built over MRT Chinatown station unequalled at any other I have lived in.

title: Cant complain after an upgrade can you??
desc: We arrived late and it appeared that the hotel was over booked for our 2 night stay. After about 10 minutes we were offered to wait longer or accept a lower level (in terms of height) but larger room. We went with the latter and ended up with a loft. Great room but had a few problems, all minor. There are 2 TV's in the room on the 2 levels but only 1 control, more annoying than anything really. The bed was on the second level (that only housed the bed and TV) and if you were sleeping on the wall side you had to clamber over the person next to you to get out, this is not great at 2am. Lastly, the steps need better lighting as once you turn the lights on the whole room is lit up, again, not great at 2am. But again, all this is minor, We really liked this hotel. The staff were good

title: Well priced hotel in a good location
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights on a stopover and had a lovely time. Lovely clean rooms, though a little small and we had an interconnecting room with the kids. Good breakfast and a nice bar. The staff were helpful and the pool was great fun. The hotel was in a great position with an MRT close by and China Town an easy walk away so we ate there most nights.

title: Lacked the Wow factor but OK
desc: Stayed with my adult daughter and had booked and re confirmed and prepaid for a twin bedded room. When we checked in they tried to put us in a double room and said they would put an extra bed in the room. The room was tiny, so we refused the room and eventually were allocated a room in the category that we requested. The room was adequate, pretty uninspiring view (police centre) and a strange bathroom that did not offer much privacy. The room was set up for one person, one robe, one pool towel, one pair of slippers, etc. we appreciated the complimentary water. The location was OK, in China Town, very close to a metro and not too long a walk to Clarke Key. We ate breakfast in the hotel once which was OK, better if you opted for the local options so I ate beef noodles and

title: A RARE GEM, I am glad we sparkled for you.....
desc: Just returned from a 3 night stay. The hotel is easy to find using the directions on the website and also from Google maps. We were greeted by the wonderful HUZAIFAH (I hope I spelled it right his name). Who was unfailingly helpful and friendly (note to management - whatever you are paying him, it isn't enough. He is an excellent ambassador for your hotel). A professional receptionist... A great concierge who know it all.... An instant immediate family.... He helped us with maps, directions, recommendations, he even arranged for our trip across to Legoland and made us a reservation in a fine dining restaurant in The Fullerton Bay so that we could have a full-filling and romantic 3 nights stays in Singapore. I entrust my holiday itinerary to him and I never regret it at all!!

title: Clean and tidy room
desc: Just stayed 4 nights at Dorsett Singapore from 15 to 19 July. Our room is on the 10th floor, housekeeping was very good, our room was clean and tidy. The double bed is large enough. Though the room and washroom was quite small but still enough space for two of us. The location is good, very close to MRT Outram Park station, only 1 stop to Harbourfrount station so you can go to Sentosa. And one stop to Chinatown. However, not much restarurant nearby and I can't find any convenient store too. The wifi connection is only average, sometimes quite slow and the water pressure inside the washroom is not strong enough.

title: Couldn't complain
desc: Location is great, can find lots of cafes and restaurants nearby, also near to MRT station Outram Park just find the lift to MRT, very close. The check in and check out is easy. Efficient and pleasant staffs. Good spread of breakfast for me, with egg counter. The room itself is rather spacious for Sg standard, clean bathroom and bed. Nice view from the windows. A plus is an iphone dock in room. Fast wifi. Overall great. The only complain comes from my friend, a smoker, the hotel is strictly no-smoking hotel so he had to smoke outside the lobby everyday. Also close to Chinatown if you need some last minute shopping, only one MRT stop away.

title: A decent hotel close to MRT
desc: Overall a functional hotel next to MRT and a couple of major roads into the city. Price is at par with the quality, hence the 3 stars. ROOM Small but functional, modern and naturally inclusive of internet, the room was ok .. except for the cockroach that felled down on the floor from between the mattresses in the first evening when I pulled my sheet loose. I captured it under a glass and left for the staff to clean it up the next day. I know that such happens when in Singapore and such places, but it does bother me, when I haven't seen a cockroach in my room in a good business hotel in ages. LOCATION Location is good considering the MRT station almost next door, and the closeness of pubs, high-end restaurants and lounges. Otherwise not overly interesting or close to office

title: Great location and great service. Ï¢ãÏùÄÏûÖÏßÄÏóê Ï¢ãÏùÄ ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§
desc: My mom and I stayed here for 3 days and it was great. Ïñ¥Î®∏ÎãàÎûë 3Ïùº Î¨µÏóàÎäîÎç∞ Ï†ïÎßê Ï¢ãÏïòÏñ¥Ïöî The location was amazing. Close to china town and there's subway is right next to the hotel. If you plan to hang out via subway, great choice. ÏúÑÏπò Ï†ïÎßê ÏµúÍ≥†. Ï∞®Ïù¥ÎÇòÌÉÄÏö¥ Í∞ÄÍπåÏù¥Ïóê ÏûàÍ≥†, ÏßÄÌïòÏ≤†ÏùÄ ÏßÑÏßú Î∞îÎ°ú ÏòÜÏóê ÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî. Swimming pool was clean, and staff are kind. I was little bit worried about privacy issue of pool view rooms. ÏàòÏòÅÏû• Î¨º Íπ®ÎÅóÌïòÍ≥† ÏßÅÏõêÎ∂ÑÎì§ÎèÑ ÏπúÏ†àÌï¥Ïöî. Í∑ºÎç∞ ÏàòÏòÅÏû•ÏóêÏÑú Î∞©ÏïàÏù¥ Î∞îÎ°ú Î≥¥Ïù¥ÎçîÎùºÍµ¨Ïöî Í∑∏Í±¥ Ï¢Ä Í±±Ï†ïÎêòÎÑ§Ïöî.

title: Great location, Great service, value for money
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights and this hotel is superb. It's new and modern, room was spacious as we got upgraded to a two storey room, water power in the shower room was great, daily necessities such as cotton pads and buds, tooth paste and tooth brushes are provided daily. 5 minutes walk to China town and 15 mins walk to Clarke Quay We'll definitely return to this hotel.

title: Maintenance problems lowers rating
desc: We were booked into this hotel by NUS conference organisers. We had a standard room I guess, it was tiny ... too small for two people on business. The bathroom was also cramped - had a good shower cubicle and then just enough space for the toilet and basin - nowhere to even hang your towels, since the wall space was actually doors to the wardrobe (2-way access). The hairdryer was hidden away in a drawer in the wardrobe, and had to be plugged into a socket by the bed - then stretched to view the mirror in the bathroom. The main lights in the bathroom didn't work - only the night lights. There were 2 large mirrors in the room, but both were dark (stylish but useless when you're trying to dress for business). When I told one of the admin staff about the lights, she laughed and said

title: Chic Rooms and Great Location
desc: We booked Dorsett because out of the Singapore hotels we've been eyeing, it's one of the most reasonably priced that's matched with nice interiors and good proximity with the MRT. Here's an itemized review of the things that mattered to me in any hotel I've checked in: Location: Right above Outram MRT station which is a stop that has two lines crossing it (purple and green lines). It's very strategic in a sense that it's direct trip from both the Airport and Sentosa Areas which are essential in my visit. There's still a bit of a walk underground going to the green line, but still it's quite convenient for any traveller. Checkin: We arrived around noon and knowing hotels typically has a 2:00pm checkin policy, we were expecting to have our bags stored until our room is ready.

title: family reunion (8)
desc: The rooms were adequate for 2. Any issues and the staff were quick to respond & rectify. The reception staff & concierge were always cheerful and very helpful. Laundry ( as everywhere expensive, Laundromat 5 minutes away in Chinatown). Very close to the MRT (50mt). Minutes walk to Chinatown. Overall, enjoyed the stay there (10 days).

title: WORST Staycation Experience EVER!
desc: Stayed here for 3D2N under the National Day Staycation package which includes free breakfast and complimentary minibar. Terrible service from the front desk right up to the restaurant staff in Pappasan. The front desk staff IMRFAN doesn't know his work at all, tried to charge my credit card with an additional S$100 for the deposit (they should only hold the amount NOT debit my credit card). Had breakfast in Pappasan on both mornings and experienced the worst service one can ever expect in a hotel! We had to walk into the restaurant and find our own table, no wait staff to take us to our table and when we sat down, we were asked to get up by a rude auntie because that table was reserved for VIPs only! The staff then tried to rush us through breakfast, kept rushing us to

title: Great Location
desc: Great location next to MRT station. Friendly staff. Rooms are pretty decent and well designed. Washroom was a little tired and could be cleaner. Overall had a great experience staying there and enjoy the hawker foods close by.

title: Superb location!
desc: We stayed for 2 nights here and the reason we chose this hotel is because it's located right beside the Outram Park which has 2 MRT lines, and very convenient to go to the aiport. The first surprise at check-in time was that we got free upgrade to deluxe room with no charge (thank you!!), I love the room coz it's really clean and everything looks new. The design of hotel interior is lovely and the pool area is beautiful. We didn't have chance to have breakfast at the hotel so we have nothing to say about the food. Will come back for sure!

title: Fair to middling
desc: I stayed here for 3 nights a couple of weeks ago during a business trip to Singapore. It's a fairly average hotel, although it's location is good for visiting Chinatown, Clarke Quay, and the selection of surrounding bars and restaurants is good too. If you can, do not eat at the hotel restaurant as it is overpriced and bland, and breakfast is woeful if you expect some kind of selection. Try to get out and sample actual restaurants as there are loads of Chinese cafes around the area, and Italian 20 yards away, and various other places to enjoy. If you want a drink, try The Reading Room which is a small bar just up the street. Good food, nice drinks, welcoming staff. Staff at the hotel are good, helpful, and assisting. Cleanliness was ok, odd stain on the floor, but all in

title: Very friendly staff, decent hotel.
desc: I found the location of this hotel very useful. It is situated just next to the Outram Metro station (Use exit H). The hotel is very close to the Sentosa Island. The aminites were all very decent. The staff was very helpful. Just next door are a lot of eating places to choose from.

title: A pleasant stay at Dorsett Singapore
desc: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a short staycation (for the night of Aug 10). The hotel is new and its furnishing gives people a premium feel. As parking is not free (a small letdown), we decided to leave our car at home and take public transport. Having no car did not give us any problem at all since Dorsett Singapore is strategically located right above the underground Outram MRT Station. And better still, there is a hotel elevator that ferries hotel guests between the surface and the underground MRT station. This saves hotel guests who use public transport a lot of time and walking. Locating at Outram Park means you will have easy access to a wide array of tourist attractions such as Chinatown and its Food Street, all within walking distance. The room we stayed in was

title: Good locations but cleanliness is to be improved
desc: Been staying at Dorsett for two nights (business trip) and was upgraded to loft. Not an exciting one as i was not quite happy with the room‚Äôs cleanliness, particularly the sofa bed (where stains were observed). In addition, the housekeepers seemed not paying attention in cleaning the room. There was a hand towel (used by previous guests) under the bathroom sink and it was still there when check out. While the toiletries were up-side down upon room service (I wonder!) Other than that, the room was good. Checked in/out was fast but the front desk staffs did not look friendly either. As for the location, it was superb!

title: 30th wedding anniversary
desc: Stayed at the Dorsett for 8 nights June/July. We chose this hotel as it is close to Outram Park MRT and we could use the MRT to transfer to the hotel from the airport. It is also situated on the edge of China Town. We were made to feel very welcome when we arrived after a long trip from the UK and found a complimentary fruit basket and lovely towel display in our room on arrival. We found the room was always cleaned to a high standard and we enjoyed the outdoor pool. Should we return to Singapore we would definitely stay here again.

title: Short n Sweet
desc: The purpose of our holiday was to see Singapore and experience what the little nation has to offer. So the Hotel stay was not really a focal point. We just needed a centrally located hotel with attentive service, clean and hygienic rooms with comfort when we wanted to relax after a day out. The Dorsett provided just that. Very clean, attentive and friendly people, willingly providing extra services without anticipating a tip. Loved it and would not hesitate to go back. The hotel is located very conveniently close to China Town and right on Outram MRT. There is even an entrance to the Green + Purple (East West + North East) lines from the same building.

title: Booking cancelled few days before arrival
desc: I booked this hotel online in May 2015. When I noticed 15 days before arrival that my credit card was not debited yet I contacted the hotel by email to ask whether payment was done or not. Then I was abroad and had an "out-of-office" message in my mail saying I will reply when back. When I came back from abroad I received emails from the hotel saying that booking is cancelled as they were not able to debit my credit card. They did not try to reach me by phone nor anything else! They told me that the booking is cancelled but I can book again for a 50% higher price! Now I have to find a new hotel within 2 days! This is really 0 customer service and they are only looking for money!!

title: Excellent customer service and friendly staff.
desc: They provide excellent customer service and will try their best to fulfil your requirement as long as is within their limit. Counter staff is very friendly. Their balcony room facing the koi pond is really lovely and awesome. The room is very clean and very relaxing. Thank you Doresett Singapore for the wonderful and memorable stay. The hotel is very near MRT which is very convenient for travellers.

title: Nice hotel
desc: Very confortable room, fine location. Front desk Staff service kind of awful. My booking stated clearly double room. Staff insists that she ll give me twin bed until i ask her to read my printed voucher.

title: Easy access to MRT and lots of eating options
desc: I've stayed in this hotels many times already. Why? Firstly, its located just beside the Outram Park MRT station. If you just landed in Singapore, its easily one train ride from the Airport (EW line to Joo Koon |14 stops | 58 minutes). Outram Park is also an interchange station that serves the EW line and NE line that takes you to Orchard and Little India. Secondly, it is located at the fringes of Chinatown. So its just a 5-10 walk to the busy and colorful Chinatown for some sight seeing. Thirdly, there are many cafes and eateries within the vicinity of the hotel to choose from. You'll never go hungry here. If you are adventurous, head to Everton Park to try out the many cafes and bistros tucked within the residential HDB flats that are operated by locals. Its cheap eats but

title: Great mid-price hotel in excellent location
desc: We found the Dorsett to be a very good mid-price hotel in an excellent location to explore Singapore from. Being on the edge of Chinatown and close to Outram Park MRT station, as well as having its own taxi rank, we were able to travel the city easily. We contacted the hotel before our stay for an early check in having arrived from a 16hr flight early in the morning. Whilst they couldn't guarantee it over email, they had made the arrangements and we had quick access to the room. Check in was courteous and although we found the room to be small (expected at that price point and central location), it was well-equipped with a great shower and facilities. The bed was very comfortable and the a/c worked well - the housekeeping was also excellent throughout our stay. The 35m

title: Great experience at Dorsett Singapore
desc: The hotel is located near the MRT Stations of Outram Park and Tanjung Pagar. Very accessible to the City Hall, Chinatown areas. Easily commutable to other landmarks. Great breakfast buffet, with a several choices of international dishes. The rooms are clean and tidy,albeit a bit small. I like most the designs of the room numbers ( camera-inspired) Their lifts and lobby are also cool and nice.

title: JIUJIAN1MOROUND goes Dorsett Singapore
desc: Artistic, creativity and little details is what attracts me. Though there was a small hiccups only when i checked into the balcony room and found out there is actually no balcony room that leads to pool, which i was attracted by the picture when i did the booking. Fortunately my disappointment was soon taken care when the front desk offered to upgrade me to their Splash room with luxury bath tub space and see through glass panel separating bath room and bed room. For some one that needs space, the Splash room was seems a good choice. After the 1st night i decided to extend my stay with Dorsett to try other room types and to my surprised i was being upgraded again, this round the loft room which provides a mezzanine level that separate work and rest area with a King Size Bed,

title: Kimmy Li
desc: We stay 4 nights here, very convenience to trip as it's next to the underground station- Outram Park MRT, also nearby the China Town, overall is good, room is small but the toilet is not so clean, we found hairs on the glass door. But the staffs were nice and helpful.

title: Pretty average
desc: I stayed (rather I am staying) in Dorsett Hotel for 3.5 weeks for a business trip and I will say its a pretty average hotel.. You can surely get a better hotel in the same price range. Room: Fairly decent for the location and probably the biggest positive... Good views from the room.. Location: Right at the Outram Park MRT station and again a big positive.. Pool: Well maintained.. Room Service: very inconsistent, one day you could call for room cleaning and they will take 3 hours to come (after going down to the reception and giving them a good piece of my mind) and other days they will be fairly quick.. Breakfast menu: Horrible.. specially coming from India where you are spoilt for choices.. there was hardly anything to eat.. I had to settle with eggs and croissant everyday..

title: New hotel and well-maintained
desc: Located next to Outram Station, approx. 250m to Chinatown center. Room is compact but clean. Staff were bit cold but professional. Hotel facilities were well-maintained. Not much to say - not too impressive but nothing to fault either.

title: All that glitters..
desc: I really wanted to like this Hotel, and from first appearances its stunning. The designers did an amazing job, unfortunately there are just too many little problems. It shouldn't take 15 minutes waiting at reception to find out what the breakfast costs are for a four year old. After reserving, and paying extra for, an extra bed, being told that a fold away will not fit in your room is ridiculous. After receiving 'an upgrade' we have a soiled fold out lounge, which when folded out has the mattress on the floor and makes it necessary to walk over the mattress to get to the bathroom!! And if paying extra for another bed it would be great if I didn't have to call down at 9pm for sheets/towels. In the bathrom exposed wiring and multiple things not properly fixed to the wall really

title: "Good location and good service "
desc: First time staying here at Dorsett Singapore that recommended by a friend. Good location near Chinatown area and easy access with MRT Outram Park station just below the hotel.
