Service is good from front office and housekeeping staff. Room a bit small but clean and cosy. Breakfast spread at Papasan Restaurant not so great and less choice option. However the stay is pleasant and will back again

title: Good hotel and location
desc: Clean, comfortable hotel positioned close to China Town ‚Äì several very good restaurants nearby. The hotel bar and restaurant were to a good standard but limited atmosphere. Friendly and efficient service. Slightly cramped bathroom layout with sliding door of wardrobe used as privacy screen. Modern but not particularly practical.

title: Memorable for the wrong reasons.
desc: I had a strange experience at the Dorsett and it is difficult to write about. The problem: Arrived very late at night (nearly 2 AM) to find my room to be dirty. There was a stained carpet, hair and bits of lint everywhere and something indescribable in the bath area. Immediately and painlessly switched to another room and had a similar problem, minus the stain. The sheets were clean and it was nearly 3 AM, so I stayed put. The next morning I was moved to a third room which was lovely. *I'm sparing you the photos I took of the bits of lint, hair, and what appeared to be a small piece of glass on the carpet. I am trying to be fair to the hotel. The good points: The staff at the front desk were very accommodating and did all they could to make up for the unclean rooms. They

title: Good location, comfortable stay!
desc: Had a very comfortable stay with my partner and decided to visit again with my family. First stay was in the Splash Room & second visit with my family we booked the Dorsett Rooms. Both room types have pretty much the same deco. Difference is that the Splash Room had a slightly bigger room space and bathtub in the bathroom. Nevertheless, both rooms were clean and cozy with comfortable beds, definitely value for money! As for the breakfast selection, there was not much of a spread and it was not great but the friendly service made up for it. Location is great as the hotel is conveniently located just above the Outram MRT station. There are also many F&B choices and nice bars just a stones throw away. Also a big shout out to May Kwan & team, for being friendly and accommodating

title: Run of the mill hotel
desc: There is a lot of gold and bling in the lobby, so it all looks quite flash but then is very average inside. The rooms are standard small rooms, perfectly nice, but the bathroom is effectively in the bed room with just a sliding glass door. Little to no privacy with the toilet maybe five feet from the edge of the bed? The restaurant is small and breakfast in peak time was a bit of a scrum with food running low and difficult to find a table. The reception staff were excellent though, very professional and accommodating. It's south of Chinatown so not super convenient for CBD. A fair hotel if you need to be in that location, but nothing special and I would probably try somewhere different next time.

title: Nice hotel / good location
desc: Decided to stay here bcs of the location that is just above the Outram Park MRT. We arrive early before the check in time and surprisingly the room was ready. The size of the room (standard) isn‚Äôt big. Room is good for 2 and if you have more luggage, the room feels a little bit cramp. In the room there are hairdryer, safe deposit box, refrigerator. We stayed for 3 nights and unfortunately we notice something. The floor wasn‚Äôt vacuumed during our stay! Location wise is exactly above outram mrt. Nearest 7-11 is across the street at pearl center. So a bit far bcs you have to walk down through the mrt tunnel. Behind the hotel there are some nice restaurants. All in all - i would recommend this for a layover stay.

title: Modern place at the edge of Chinatown and next to two rail lines
desc: A new hotel located at the edge of Chinatown and metres from a station for two underground rail lines (i.e. Outram Park MTR station). Modern, medium-sized room (good by Singapore standards) with a king-sized bed, excellent toiletry and other handouts (but no pen and only 1 washer and 1 hand towel), room safe, good TV, water and coffee making facilities. The shower was excellent but the rest of the bathroom was relatively small. One feature is that the bathroom mirror is on the inside of the opened cupboards door! There was no shaving mirror but the lights were good for shaving. The rack rate is very expensive but we got a great rate online.

title: Great location and price
desc: Singapore is not an easy place to find a newish and reasonably priced hotel with a pool. Luckily, I came across the Dorsett which also had the added bonus of being on top Outram Park MRT (note there is a lift that goes straight from the residences next door down to the MRT). This is a simple but good hotel option. Rooms are reasonably sized with the usual mod cons, although bathroom a little too 'exposed' for our liking. The pool was great and got the direct afternoon sun. Service was good - we were offered a 2pm check out which was great. This hotel is in a great location on the border of Chinatown. We spent a lot of time in the area as there are also some very trendy little cafes and bars in the backstreets, such as Club St. I would definitely recommend as good value, with

title: Decent quality hotel
desc: A very tastefully-decorated and furnished hotel that merits a revisit. Hard to fault any aspect; comfy and spacious (by Singaporean standards, that is), the room was definitely something I'd look forward to after a long day out. Location-wise, it's a decent area to be in. Duxton Hill and the legendary Maxwell hawker centre are both within walking reach; if you're feeling lazy then Bukit Pasoh Road to the back of the hotel has a number of western caf√©s and watering holes while cheaper local fares can be had down New Bridge Road (the bit that intersects with Keong Saik Road features a couple of ok late-night eateries). Another huge plus is the MRT station next door, which provides direct connections to Plaza Singapura, Chinatown, and the CBD via two separate lines. Breakfast

title: A mixture of Great and Okay
desc: Decided to stay here because the hotel is empaneled to company's also bcs of the location that is just above the Outram Park MRT. I arrive rather early before the check in time, checked in took about 10minutes and surprisingly my room Is ready. The size of the room isnt big. I got upgraded to Deluxe room facing the road. room is good for 2 and more than enough space for your large luggage. But if you are to put extra bed am sure it wont fit. AC works too well it get so cold at night at i turned it off while sleeping. In the room there are hairdryer, safe deposit box, refrigerator. Pretty standard. I stayed for 4 nights and unfortunately during my 2nd night the housekeeping didnt refill the shower cap and razor. I dont know why this is not their standard. I had to call the

title: Just a room
desc: If you are in Singapore for business and only need a room to sleep in then this is the hotel. Small, clean, neat and has the basic things you need. Breakfast is not great but not bad. Decent for a full breakfast. Near China town around 15 minute walk.

title: Not bad for a short stay
desc: We recently had a short stopover in Singapore (less than 24 hours) and didn't want to pay the high end prices of the Marina Bay area. The Dorsett is excellent value - I think we paid about $185AUD - but you do get what you pay for. A small room, actually a teeny tiny room and a teeny tiny bathroom. But the bed was super comfortable! We didn't try the hotel food so can't comment. But why would you need to when you are located next to the most chic cafe/bar/restaurant precinct? This was a fab find for us, so much so that we are going back to Singapore for a week soon to do more exploring.... Complimentary late checkout to 2pm was a nice touch for a late flight. If you are briefly in town, want a comfortable bed at a good price and excellent coffee and food on the doorstep then

title: Nice location, friendly staff
desc: I really enjoyed my stay and will go back. It was reasonably priced for Singapore. I stayed in one of the lofts. People are very friendly and helpful. It's right off the SMRT line that goes to the airport, with a change of train near the airport.

title: Great Hotel Excellent Staff
desc: This is a new hotel one rail stop from the cable car to Sentosa Island. It has an excellent restaurant which is very good. We stayed there for three nights after our cruise. We found the bedroom very comfortable and the bathroom was excellent with large shower and stand alone bath. One word of advice don't buy a beer from any hotel in Singapore. I was charged close to $20 for a local beer. I advise anyone wanting a beer to go to a local service station/store where you can buy a large can o Tiger for 5 Singapore dollars.

title: Good Hotel and Charming Staff, But the Decor Hurts My Eyes
desc: This is a new hotel in Singapore, right on the edge of Chinatown. It's got a lot going for it: fine location; modern, safe and convenient construction; a super staff. So I'm going to quibble and tell you, this hotel could be a lot better than it is. Here are the details: First, getting there: this hotel is just outside the central business district, a few minutes west of the center of town. It's right on the edge of Chinatown (which is good). It's right on top of a metro station. I took a taxi to the hotel from Changi Airport. The taxi had no trouble finding it and the fare was just over S$25; maybe 20-25 minutes en route, which is very manageable. Check-in is fast and easy, and right away you're going to be greeted by some of the nicest and most professional hotel staff

title: Efficient service
desc: Stayed for 2 nights at Dorsett during my recent trip to Singapore. Recommended by a colleague who has stayed there previously. I would rate this hotel almost 4 stars for service, comfort, location and cleanliness. The front desk ladies are all very sweet, friendly and efficient. Even though i checked in late at night, the front desk staff were still bright, perky and full of smiles. However if i have to rate the hotel based on f&b then perhaps it will drop to 1 or 2 stars. After a late night flight into Singapore I thought I can wake up to have a satisfying breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was dismal. Bacon was oily and so soggy (I cook bacon on my own and i know its not difficult to cook bacon properly!). The orange juice tasted funny as if it was stale. I had to go

title: Dorsett singapore
desc: Room was a bit crowded but was fine for a couple of days. Nice to get bottled water. Loved the pool and the gym. Location was fantastic and close to everything we wanted to see. Mrt close by was great

title: Good service, great location
desc: Overall, had a very pleasant stay at Dorsett. Front desk staff were always friendly and full of smiles. The check in process was fast and efficient. The room was abit small but nevertheless clean and comfortable. Wifi speed was also good which is very useful for business travellers like myself. My only complain will be the breakfast at the hotel. Firstly, breakfast was not included in my room rate, secondly the price of the breakfast is too expensive for the totally uninspiring breakfast. Saving grace was the Dorsett Delights program which gave us hotel guests certain dining privileges at the surrounding cafes and restaurants. Breakfast is a very important meal especially for busy on the go travellers who are on business trips. I do hope to see better breakfast offered at

title: Near by SGH (Singapore General Hospital
desc: It's the best location near by Singapore General Hospital, after visit your docter / check up, it is a must to go to china town for refreshing & relaxing time to shop or to dine.The place you should visit Chinatown Point and Hong Lim Food Center.

title: New hotel
desc: Hotel new, service still need to improve Room is fair size,l

title: Better than 4 star
desc: I stay in hotels 40 weeks a year. It's hard to stand out, but the Dorsett did. Staff are fantastic. So friendly and attentive. Clean, it's spotless. The rooms are a good size. The amenities good. Located above Outram station, it's quick to the airport and not far from most things, but very close to Chinatown. I would definitely stay again.

title: Great location, great stay!
desc: I was staying for 2 nights at Dorsett on a business trip. Perfect location. Just a short walking distance to some attraction points such as chinatown n clarke. No need to take cab after going back from some nightlife spots. Literally on the top of the MRT station (outram park). Had to wait for almost an hour upon check in. I was told by the front desk staff that the room i reserved wasnt prepared yet. Tho i arrived at around 2.10pm (SG time). But the front desk staff served me with her nice smile. Great service! Overall was a great stay. Super clean n tidy room and complete amenities.

title: Small adequate hotel
desc: Small but adequately equipped hotel. Good for a short business trip stay or a short getaway with a partner. Breakfast not included in the room rate which is a tad disappointing. Looked at the breakfast spread available at the hotel restaurant but it was very unappetizing by sight. Hope the hotel will improve on the breakfast standard and service. Very convenient that there are quite a few good restaurants and cafes for early breakfast and brunch near to the hotel. The hotel has a dining program which is useful for the hotel guests. Hotel guests get dining privileges at the participating f&b outlets. Nice touch! Overall a very pleasant n good stay. Will recommend for short stay.

title: Staycation in Dorsett Singapore
desc: The room at Dorsett Singapore is really small but comes with a comfy bed. However I had little to complain as I took the SG50 promotion offer which came up to less than SGD170. The room had a view of the city. And what's great is that there are many restaurants and cafes around the area for you to explore, you will definitely not go hungry. The Outram MRT station is also nearby which makes traveling around so convenient. The only blooper was when I did a mobile booking, what was a confirmed booking showed up as an error and I ended up booking 2 rooms instead of one. This was resolved upon calling the reservations and confirming again at check in.

title: "Excellent, Brilliant, Comfortably !"
desc: Brilliant Hotel located above the transport hub of Outram Park MRT interchange station, and just one station to Harbor Front - Vivo City (Sentosa Express). We came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Thanks for the fantastic room upgrade and it was beyond perfect. Every staff we ran into was friendly and welcoming. Service was top class. Room was beautiful, tastefully decorated, spacious but homely, and very quiet. No noise pollution from neighbouring rooms. Breakfast in the Pappasan was good, setting us up well for a day exploring the city, with cereals, cold meats, cheeses, as well as sausage, fish fillet and ham in the hotplates. (Top mark to the Chef ‚Äì Jo Jo who was friendly and helpful). Can‚Äôt rate this hotel highly enough, don't hesitate to book this hotel

title: "Great staff, good location"
desc: Location is great, between Outram Park and Chinatown which can both easily be reached by a short walk. Outram Park MRT station right below of the hotel. Rooms aren't big but well laid out and cozy. Bed was comfortable and room well maintained and very clean. The staff is great, super helpful and very friendly. Breakfast selection wasn't great but from what I hear they are working on this at the moment. It's still a very new hotel so I'm sure they'll improve in this area. In any case it's no problem as there are great food options nearby around the hotel. I enjoyed my stay here and would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: "Worth a stay"
desc: In general, the stay was great - comfortable room and clean room. Staff very helpful and accommodating especially housekeeping and front desk team. The breakfast spread is definitely not impressive but you can always eat out to experience the Singapore local delights.

title: Nice hotel but a pity about the breakfast
desc: Had a pleasant stay at Dorsett, room was relatively small sized but very comfortable and clean. Value for money. Hotel is conveniently located with the train station just a stone throw away. Only complain will be the below par standard of the breakfast. Totally unacceptable quality of breakfast served at the hotel that I had to venture out to search for breakfast outside the hotel. Thank goodness I manage stumble upon a few cafes that opened early, served good coffee as well as hearty breakfast items.

title: Looks good on the outside, average on the inside
desc: Downsize your expectations - do not judge a book by its cover. I was wow-ed the minute I got out of the taxi because I spotted the gleaming chandelier at the entrance of the hotel. My first impression was still WOW when I stepped into the lobby which smelt pleasant. However, as it was May 1 (labour day public holiday), we waited for a while at the check-in desk before we were served. We expected the crowds so we were okay with it. Not sure if it was bad luck or because of the high occupancy, we experienced quite a few misfortunes during our stay. Let me start with the pros: Pros - Hotel is in a good location. Outram Park MRT exit is right next to the hotel. Use the one labeled Dorsett Residences and take the lift to the 1st floor. The 2nd floor opens up to the car park. -

title: A Comfortable Business Stay
desc: Stayed for 4 days and enjoyed my time in the hotel. Staff are friendly and efficient and you're always greeted with a smile whenever you walk through the lobby or past reception. Check in and check-out was fast and efficient - an absolute pleasure. Every morning leaving for work the staff happily go down onto the main road to hail you a cab and of course - service with a smile. Rooms are adequate in size and are pretty well appointed. Bedding nice and crisp and clean and clean towels provided daily. The may want to do an "audit" on their cleaning staff though - for the 4 days I was there, there were a couple of long black hairs on my bathroom floor that were never removed - shows a lack of thoroughness in cleaning (my hair is all grey so definitely not me). One thing

title: Room is so small
desc: For the price, I consider the hotel is over valued, lack of space that is. Aircon is very loud. Amenities and cleanliness is ok, but the rest of the stay doesn't feel like 4 stars. The second night there was false alarm, everyone was hectic. That also made my stay less enjoyable.

title: Great value, poor amenities
desc: Have stayed here on multiple occasions during my trips to Singapore, and the hotel itself has generally been a real pleasure to stay in given the price and the location. The concierge is helpful and proactive, and we've had a good experience on all our times here. We made a request for late check-out that was promptly attended to, the rooms are clean and well sanitised. The only regret is thr breakfast, which, while not particularly horrible, was uninspired and got boring after the first day. Some dishes were extremely bland. (How anyone can cook soggy bacon is beyond me). We ended up exploring the other cafes in the area during the rest of our stay (plenty down the road it's adjoined to), and that saved us the grief of the food.

title: Run-of-the-mill
desc: Hotel was faultless on cleanliness and comfort, but I'm going to ramble on about their restaurant here since they don't have their own page. The breakfast was a waste of calories! Even though the room came with breakfast for our stay, we decided to go to the nearby cafes instead for our breakfast the rest of the week. It just didn't make sense to come to Singapore, a food paradise, and wind up eating soul-less hotel food. Strike one. We were stranded by the rain, and came back again for lunch, thinking that local dishes might be their specialty even if breakfast isn't, and I had the signature local Chicken Rice. The chicken tasted seriously foul and like it was blood-soaked while being poached. My husband and I both took a bite and pretty much spat it out. Strike two. Service

title: Great Hotel & Loaction
desc: What a Gem or a Hotel.... Friendly Staff, good food, great cocktails... Bed was Great, wanted to take it with me :) Location was good, easily get any where with a Taxi... Staff were very helpful with organising some tours :) Would stay again next time... I usually stay in middle of Singers on Scotts Road.... but this hotel price, staff and food has changed my plans of staying anywhere else... Pool was great, good for doing laps :) Thank you all :)

title: Perfect location for a holiday in Singapore
desc: It was my first time travelling to Singapore and Dorsett Hotel has been the perfect choice. I have done some research few months ago to find an affordable but great accommodation. I found that most of the hotel that was within my price range was either too far from city centre or have tiny rooms. It was hard to find a hotel like Dorsett hotel that is close to MRT/city centre, affordable with clean and spacious room. Although the hotel room was palatial, it had everything I needed - wifi, decent/clean bathroom/toilets, pool and a gym. I have to admit, the gym was tiny but it did the job for me. The biggest advantage was that Outram park MRT station was literally a stone throw away from the hotel (given that you know which exit to go to - I learnt this the hard way). I did

title: Comfortable & Clean
desc: The room small but all the utilities are well furnished. Location is convenient, located next to outram mrt. Reasonable price with such convenient location. The roof top garden is odd, there is nothing there but just grass (but it is very clean) and the swimming pool is small hence i never dip in. Overall is good.. Had an enjoyable staycation here :)

title: Secret Garden
desc: We arrived on a Sunday morning having had a night flight from Brisbane, with stinging eyes and hangovers. Well, Emirates mix you cocktails in the sky and it would be churlish not to. The foyer of the Dorsett was glossy and airy. The reception staff were pleasant and check- in was quick. I was mentally beseeching them to let us into the room now rather than at 2.00, but they didn't. However we could use the pool and were given a key, a towel plus a bag of toiletries, which was very thoughtful. The pool is above the standard of many of the pools we had encountered on our trip. It had plenty of sunbeds on which to collapse and was relatively quiet from the point of view of people. But it was noisy as it overlooks a busy road and there was a huge tree being cut down opposite,

title: Simple, Clean, Friendly
desc: This hotel is strategically located right above Outram Park MRT station. There's a lift at one of the exits which will take your directly to the main street right outside the hotel. A short walk down would find yourself at Chinatown, with plenty choices for food and entertainment. As my check-in was done around 7 pm, it was quick and friendly. Present your identification and credit card and you'll get to your room in less than 10mins. There's also free wifi throughout the hotel, the log in ID and password is provided on the keycard sleeve. Wifi signal is quite strong and fast. Booked the Splashroom as it was the only roomtype with bathtub. The room was generally clean and tidy. Being eco-friendly, they would only change your towels and sheets if you indicate so. The mini bar

title: Comfortable but still average
desc: Was granted an early check-in (10 am) but had to upgrade as there were no other rooms available. Room was small but the bed was comfortable and air-con excellent. The only shortcoming was there was no bidet which is rather inconvenient. Also breakfast should have been included in the SGD300+ rate. Staff were friendly and responsive.

title: Extra helpful service
desc: My husband and I broke a long flight from Ireland to Australia with a stopover in Singapore on February 25/26. Our flight arrival time was very late but I chose this hotel in city centre so that we could maximise our next day in town, with a very late airport departure. The hotel confirmed in advance by email that they would store our baggage after checkout. What we did not expect was that they also kept our passports and tickets in safety deposit, while we explored Singapore - all at no extra charge. Perhaps most unexpectedly of all, we were greeted on arrival after midnight by the polite but reserved reception staff who handed us two fresh oranges for Happy Chinese New Year! A midnight treat - we made a cup of tea and coffee in our spacious room and enjoyed fresh fruit! The

title: Pleasant business hotel
desc: Stayed in the Dorsett for two days. Location is convenient, next to Chinatown and adjacent to a MRT station. Service is professional and efficient. Modern, attractive design of the place. Facilities and amenities are very good. Only setback is the size of the standard room - it could hardly be smaller for a 4-star hotel. Overall a hotel to be recommended.

title: Comfortable enough
desc: Stayed for 2 nights. Concierge was friendly and helped out with our needs. The room was a little cramp but good enough for the price we paid. Location is convenient, as the MRT is just a stone throw away...

title: what service?
desc: been to many hotels all over the world, be it budget or high end, i was horrified by the level of service from dorsett considering how it portrayed itself. with its prime location, the hotel should be well prepared and equipped with trained staffs to cater to guests or at least be on par with its nearby competitors. sadly, that wasn't the case. upon check in, which was late in the evening, super low peak with no other guests in line, reception was unenthusiastic and unwelcoming. wasn't a big deal at first, i understand that everyone has a bad day sometimes. the room card was handed over but with no information or hint or gesture to guide us towards the lift lobby. fine, we can just walk. it was either a left or right turn from the reception desk and we took a left only to find

title: Dorsett @ Singapore's Chinatown
desc: My business trip via Dorsett was a mild surprise. Aside from the place being a quick distance from the main Chinatown area, it was surrounded by pubs and restaurants that gave a different vibe from the commercialized adventures in the Orchard and City Hall areas. As a Four-Star Hotel, I found its amenities a bit lacking but functional for business-related runs. The staff were courteous and helpful, which can't be said even about some of the Five-Star Hotels in Singapore! If you need a place in the area and you simply need a good bed to sleep on, one should try Dorsett if only for its location.

title: Excellent Room, Swimming Pools and Restaurant.
desc: We have been staying here for the past six months. The staff are friendly, helpful. The room and hotel facilities are excellent. Only a block away from MRT. only one stop to Harbor Front.The food and drink in the restaurant are really good. I really enjoying my afternoon drinking my beer and smoking my cigarette outside the restaurant. We plan to stay for the next six months here at Dorsett. Keep up the good work!!

title: Disappointing Stay
desc: I have been around many hotels I Malaysia. I have never had a more terri le experience than my stay at Dorsett Hotel Singapore. My mum had a triple bypass at SGH. We wanted to be nearer her than our Tampines home for eventualities. I booked 3 rooms and was promptliy charged the full amount through my credit card. When I checked in, I was asked a rather odd question, "Are you staying in all the three rooms?" When I booked three rooms at MBS, and many other hotels esp in Malaysia, I was never asked such a question! Answering with no got me into a situation. They refused to let me have 1 of the rooms. I paid for it and I cannot get to use it. After saying a few things to them(tthere were about 5 at the counter), they gave me the keys to the last room and asked me to get the

title: Excellent Hotel and Location
desc: Booked this property on-line for a 2 night stay. The Hotel was first class and the front desk staff friendly and couldn't do enough to make your stay enjoyable. The location is excellent. The subway (Outran) is right there and you are only a 5 minute walk to Chinatown. The rooms were very adequately sized and the amenities first class. This was our first trip to Singapore and the staff certainly added to our enjoyment of this wonderful city. Would definitely recommend.

title: Good middle class Hotel
desc: I only had a one night sleep at the Dorsett. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Some of them are really hard to understand since they speak some chinenglish....... The rooms are a bit small but still good value for the money. Breakfast is to expensive and not worth the money. Location is good with the MRT just next door. I will probably stay again in this hotel on my next trip to Singapore.

title: very clean and quiet
desc: i recently in early March 2015 spent 5 nights at the Dorsett Hotel Singapore,this 10 storey hotel on New Bridge Road is one i would return to,for Singapore the rooms are very clean,i was on the 3rd floor which is the same floor as the gym and pool,the pool although big is only 1.2 m deep,i would have preferred it to be deeper,the staff were always very attentive,and always had a smile on their face,although the hotel is on a major road there is no noise due to the double glazing,it is good value for money.

title: Great hotel with great staff
desc: Having spent over 100 days in this warm and friendly hotel I have nothing but praise for the facilities and staff. If there was ever a problem Michelle and her team would have the problem fixed or would move myself or which ever member of our team to another room regardless of if they had to upgrade at no extra cost to us. Even though myself and the team had to be up and on the road half an hour before the breakfast started they managed to open early for us ensuring we did not leave on an empty stomach. I will definitely be staying there again if I ever return to Singapore. Once again thanks to all the members of staff for making my stay a memorable one.

title: Awesome location, elegant rooms and lovely staff
desc: We stayed at the Dorsett Hotel Singapore from the 2nd to the 5th March. The hotel was stunning: modern, elegant and very trendy. Our room was well laid out and looked exactly like the photos on the website. The hotel itself was just as stunning. Chandeliers, marble and timber were all quite striking. Very visually appealing hotel. Loved the colourful cameras propped up against the wall outside each room... buttons on the camera were used for the doorbell etc.The staff were just lovely. We were travelling with our two little boys and the reception staff would leave their posts to interact with us and the boys. Very friendly and helpful. The location was awesome! We were right on top of the MRT station. $1.50 Singapore was all it cost to board the service and it was one stop

title: Excellent hotel!!
desc: I was pleasantly suprised by the services rendered especially the from the front desk . The check in was smooth. Front Office staffs went the extra mile by giving us maps and providing information on places to visit. The bellman was very fast and efficient in helping us get taxis. Staffs always smiled and greeted us everytime we walk pass. The room was nice however was a bit small. Location was fantastic as we could easily travel by the train and busses to everywhere. It is so convenient! I would definitely recommend Dorsett with the excellent service and fantastic location.

title: well placed hotel
desc: i stayed in this Hotel in Feb 2015.It is ideally placed for Chinatown-only metres away & there is a subway station right outside too,which is a great way to travel cheaply,especially to the airport & cruise ports- i would def. recommend it

title: Comfortable, clean, friendly, well located
desc: My room was not large but had all required, and an excellent modern bathroom with shower. Comfortable bed, good double glazing and easy to control air conditioning. The location is close to buses (including one of the hop-on/off bus lines, the underground MRT, and buses. Chinatown is a short walk away. The hotel's pool is a delight, although overlooked by hotel rooms it is large enough to provide a great swim and a chance to sunbathe. There are breakfast facilities in a sort of cafe off the lobby, not spectacular but quite well supplied with continental and asian breakfast foods. There are eggs to order - not surprisingly bacon and sausages are a bit hit and miss. I had a late onward flight and was able to book another half day which made life much easier. Along with a decent

title: Excellent location
desc: Location was really good as the hotel is close to the train station. We booked at Dorsett not really minding the size of the room as we are spending most of our time outside. When we arrived, the reception told us they have upgraded our room which was really a surprise. The room we had was bigger than we expected and my son can't wait to soak in the bath tub. Will definitely stay here when we go back to Singapore again.

title: Location is excellent, service is disapponting
desc: When I arrived at the hotel, there was no staff/bellboy to assist me with my luggage. It was quite off-putting. I also don't like that they do not offer late night in-room dining. I usually arrive back in the hotel around 11pm and the kitchen is already closed so there's no more in-room dining. But I did love their bed! It was so comfortable. And the best thing about Dorsett is that their location is fantastic! It's only about a 3-min walk to the Outram Park MRT station. Since their room rate is relatively cheaper, i would say that i still received a good value for my money (mostly because the location is fantastic). I'm rating it with 4 stars mostly because of its location.

title: Not worth it!
desc: For over $300 per night, you would expect much better--even in Singapore. Where to begin, the room was tiny and cheaply furnished. There was no bathroom privacy as the closet door had to be opened to close off the toilet area. It did not close completely, leaving a 5 inch gap where someone in the bedroom could view the bathroom. My boss's secretary booked the room. When I got the bill, I compared online to Hotels.com and the price was 50$ more per night. I have had better toiletry items in a Motel 6--the shampoo and conditioner were "combined". There were no washcloths and the towels were no better than mid-range Ikea. The worst thing was that the clock wasn't properly set. I arrived after midnight and had meetings the next day. I was an hour late for my meeting

title: Modern hotel in a very convenient location
desc: The hotel is right above the MRT station so using this transport from Changi is an option. It is very convenient for China town and also some very nice quieter restaurants and bars in the surrounding area. The room are average sized for a major city hotel and being a new hotel in good condition.

title: Near to MRT
desc: The Dorsett is clean and comfortable without being ostentatious. Situated directly above Outram Park MRT makes it easy to get around town and it is a short walk in to Chinatown to sample the authentic Oriental cuisine. The pool on level 3 is long, narrow and shaded during the afternoon. Parking can be a problem because the car oark is shared with the Dorsett Apt. Residence.

title: Another pleasant stay
desc: Great hotel near China town, short walk to many restaurants and shops. The deluxe room was good but small as most Asian hotel rooms are. The free wi-fi was fast. Check-in and out were easy and fast. Hotel is above Outram Park MRT or walk to Chinatown MRT. Reception staff are friendly and efficient. Housekeeping was good. Chinatown was really busy compared to our visit in March last year. Would stay here again.

title: Location, location, location. And Comfort.
desc: Its located very near Chinatown and 15 mins walk to Tanjung Pagar, and more importantly, right outside an exit of Outram Park MRT. Bed was soft and comfortable enough. If you prefer firm mattresses, do take note. We stayed 2 nights during the valentine's day weekend. 1 night in the loft room and another in the deluxe room. We took the Love promo with the loft room. From the classy lobby to the cozy rooms, the deco and design on the hotel deserves a thumbs up. Staff were friendly and helpful for the most part. Internet and phone apps will help with the rest. We had breakfast for 1 morning. Selection was so so. If you missed it, don't need to feel bad or hungry. Chinatown Food Centre is less than 10 mins walk away. And Keong Saik has lots of hip cafes and restaurants sprouting.

title: Simple and good value for money, but not boutique nor luxurious
desc: Across from the metro station and walkable to good restaurants, etc. Small rooms but they have everything you need. Fine if you are a single, business traveler. Good beds and linens. If travelling with a friend - the toilets in many rooms are semi-exposed. (glass wall) Almost no vanity space at the sink. Large space under entry door allowed noise and light to enter room from corridor = unacceptable. (I had to jam bed pillows at the bottom of the door in order to get to sleep) BEWARE - this hotel seems to cater to a lot of tour groups from China. I had to ask for a room change for my second night, as the tour group on my floor was extremely noisy and rude, even past midnight. Front Desk staff said this happens frequently. However, they were very good about accommodating my

title: MRT, Great bed, Friendly staff
desc: We stayed at the Dorsett Singapore for three nights and we happy with the stay. We got a great deal on a Dorsett room (standard) the room was small but adequate in size. The bathroom however as just a little too small shared door for the toilet and shower made it a little awkward as you had to walk outside the bathroom to open and then close the door to the shower..... The staff were were very nice smiles all around! (also provided helpful advice). The pool area was nice, the views not great but clean fresh with plenty of sun lounges, no pool bar :( the gym was small but ok for the purpose of a holiday workout! The decor of the hotel is opulent it makes you feel like you are in 6 star establishment! The Dorsett is located in the China Town area and is attached to the Outram

title: Well located new hotel
desc: Dorsett singapore is a nice new hotel with an mrt station ( outran park ) right under it so it's very convenient . It's also within china town so a lot of shopping and food areas around . Cheap souvenir shops and hawkers both for locals and tourists . Good to note that the price in food outlets in the local market is 40% cheaper than the more touristy stalls . The hotel rooms are well appointed . A little small but still comfortable . Breakfast is not very interesting so I don't think I'll get breakfast next time . There are other more interesting options within 5 minutes walk outside at 1/4 the price . There's a well rated fine dining resto just behind : Andre so if you are up for a nice meal it's a good place to try . Taxi to orchard is just Sg $ 10 so it's not very far

title: Average Stay
desc: I was looking forward to my stay with Dorsett Singapore at first, since there are many good reviews written about this hotel. However, the room condition was totally not what my friend and I expected. The room was so so dusty especially the cable of the iPod dock and there are even hair strands on the table which is totally not acceptable. Dust can be seen when we tried to flip the mini-bar menu/hotel guide. Bed sheet has a hole as big as 20cents and rain shower was not functioning well despite being a pretty new hotel. There are some good restaurants nearby though and we get special F&B discounts when we present our key card. The location of the hotel is really good, just right next to the MRT station which is super convenient for the guests. Overall, we felt really

title: Very comfortable hotel in excellent location
desc: The best thing about the Dorsett is its fantastic location, 1 minute from Outram Park MRT station (it has its own exit to the MRT but this was shut when I visited?) and on the doorstep to Chinatown (5-10 min. walk to Smith Street etc.). No shortage of sights nearby or fantastic places to eat at a reasonable price. The room itself was spacious enough for a single traveler and the bathroom was good. My card didn't work to access the swimming pool at first but the duty manager couldn't have been quicker to respond to this. Pool is a nice feature too but it's not the largest. It's certainly not cheap, but nor is any decent hotel in Singapore, and it deserves its rating - I'd stay again.

title: Nice hotel near Chinatown
desc: Spent 4 nights with friends at the Dorsett in December 2014. We had three standard rooms all up. The rooms were on the small side but were clean and the beds comfortable. There was only one suitcase stand, so finding room for another large case was awkward. The only real complaint was that there was no drawers anywhere (well we never found any?), so no place to unpack the shorts and socks etc. The hotel overall was a very pleasant experience, with very friendly staff everywhere from the counter staff to the cleaning lady. We also found the young doorman (I can't remember his name ... but I think he said he was only 16) the most helpful. He would arrange for taxi or help with luggage and nothing was too much trouble ... a real asset. The pool was a nice place to relax and cool

title: Only if you are alone...
desc: I arrived on a business trip to Singapore and the hotel was chosen by my host. The hotel looks prestigious until you enter you room. It was a small room with two beds (thank God - ut enabled me to put one suitcase on the other bed...). The toilets are on an open space - no door and what is more strange, it's opposite a big mirror... On the other hand the breakfast and lunch were great. The hotel is located on the Chinese Quarter and at night it seems to be the most live place in Singapore. The subway station is a minute ahead. I liked the location.

title: Great location and friendly staff
desc: Great location, next to Outram MRT and within easy walking distance to Chinatown. The staff were very friendly, gave us complimentary late check out and allowed us to store the luggage. The bell service staff were extremely helpful with our luggage storage and calling of taxi. Have read some negative review about the bathroom size and door, which I do not agree. It is modern, clean and comfortable. Highly recommended.

title: Good Service and Comfort Hotel
desc: Lobby smell fresh all the time even at wee hours. Lobby staff are helpful and very kind. (they even borrowed us entry parking ticket to access the parking throughout our stay). Room is clean and fresh. Bed and pillows are very comfortable. Shower is excellent. Good hotel for quick walk to china town and access via 2 mins walk to MRT station.

title: good value good location but a few odd things- but at the price cant complain
desc: i think the hotel would be much more appealing if they got rid of the silly little cameras outside the room that have the do not disturb and maid sign embedded in them. they looked dated already and imply a funkiness to the hotel that is just not there. The Dorsett is a nice clean hotel with good beds, i am not such a great fan of the pillows, and i have to say one of the best rain showers I have had in a long time. location on top of a subway station is perfect and the pool is very pleasant. the biggest drawback is the walls are pretty thin and you do hear a lot of noised. Food is ok but there are so many alterntives nearby dont worru about that.

title: Best place to visit this amazing city
desc: Amazing hotel with excellent location..is literally 1 min walking from the MRT train station that will take you everywhere!China town is just 2 min walking and if you want to eat something on the budget that's the place to be!Hotel was super clean and staff very polite and helpful..highly recommended!

title: Decent hotel
desc: I have stayed at a fair number of hotels in Singapore, and I would rank Dorsett about the middle of the scale. Although it does tend to be moderately more expensive than most, there are often promotional deals available. It is not dead central, but it is pretty good (just about Outram Park MRT station, on the fringes of Chinatown). Very quiet. The swimming pool is nice (but a bit long and skinny). Free WiFi which has decent speeds. Bed is comfortable. Shower is good, although hot water was path on occasion. Staff seem friendly and helpful. The gym was a bit of a letdown - two running machines and few free weights do not constitute a gym in my book. Overall, a decent experience, and no real complaints, but not enough to move it into my top few of Singapore hotels.

title: Boutique 4 star on the edge of Chinatown
desc: Having stayed at least a dozen times at various different hotels in SG, I decided to stay somewhere different this time and away from the CBD/Orchard Rd areas. The Dorsett is a new property located right on top of Outram Park MRT station and about a 10 minute stroll to Chinatown, for those more energetic, you can make Clarke Quay in about 25 or so minutes walk. As the property is new, the d√©cor and furnishings are first rate, the room itself despite being a little small, was well equipped, had a safe, bathrobes, mini bar etc. The bathroom's proximity to the bedroom was a little off putting, however as I stayed alone it wasn't an issue. The room cleanliness was patchy, at first glance all appeared clean, but the bed head had dust which had been there for a while, a previous

title: Great location for China Town (and the Gay bars)
desc: Right on the doorstep of China Town and also has its own entrance to the Singapore Metro. Hotel lives up to it's star rating. Modern glass and marble . Rooms a good sze with all the usual amenities. No negative points at all. I will certainly stay again.

title: Standard service all of guests is required
desc: I was there on the mid of January 2015.Two rooms are my choices that for 3 (extra bed ) and standard room. I would like to review basing on my opinion only below: 1.Registeration and helping from couter service is not OK for me and staff always choose for helping the rich persons(only my opinion) 2.Hotel room is not supplied towel for 3 person and not enought Cold and hot water is not stable and controled the temperature .Anything else are all os soap or water should be supplied more based on number of guests. 3.One of reserved room is not avialable as hotel schedule .I waited for long time to check in (on 4.00pm is still not available).For this reson ,I decide to sightseeing and then back to check in 8.00 PM 4.Location is convenient for transportation from Outram park MRT

title: great pool
desc: great hotel just near China town, short walk to many eatery and shops. the room was great with wifi in the room and fast. the pool on the 3rd floor was fantastic. the hotel had a restaurant if going for breakfast book at reception first it cheaper if booked before hand $20 per head compared to $28 if do not book. staff were very friendly and nothing was to much trouble. over all a great place to stay am and reasonably priced.

title: Excellent location for exploring
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights and used as a base to explore Singapore. The hotel is on top of Outram Park MRT station so is really handy if you want to go further afield. Being next door to Chinatown provides great food options. Find out the local food centre and you will find definitely the best value (cheapest)meal you will get in Singapore. As the guide books will tell you, follow the biggest queues for the best food. The rooms were well appointed, very clean with all you would need for a short stay. The one thing we didn't like was the layout of the tiny bathroom, as it didn't offer too much privacy. The public areas of the hotel are very clean and beautifully maintained. It was nice to have a pool to have a dip in after walking around all day. We didn't eat here so can't

title: Good value
desc: I stayed 2 nights on 15 and 16 Jan. The lobby is clean and smell fresh. Check in is fast. The staff is courtesy. When I check out, the staff reminded me to bring passport. The hotel is just next to Outram Park MRT station, you can walk to the China Town about 5 mins. Overall the hotel is good, room is spacious but the shower room iis too small.

title: Pleasant stay
desc: 1) Fast check-in and check-out 2) Very close to Outram Park MRT 3) Staffs are friendly and made the effort to ask whether we need any transport to airport and even offered additional info like telling us it's cheaper to book taxi before 5pm otherwise there will be an additional surcharge of 25% after 5pm (peak hours) 4) Although the room is small, we managed to arrange our luggage strategically (we brought 4 luggage - 2 big and 2 small ones) and we were still able to walk in and out comfortably with no hindrance 5) Good sleep as there was no noise from outside or next room 6) Housekeeping was good 7) Price is reasonable for 3 night stay as we booked 3 months in advance and enjoy the 25% advance discount :D 8) Free Wi-Fi Will definitely stay there again.

title: Very enjoyable
desc: The hotel is very new and tidy. Staff are very courteous and friendly. Rooms are nice and swimming pool is nice and long for people who want to swim laps (like me). Only downside was gym is quite lightly equipped and no staff frequent the pool area. So no poolside service. I recommend it highly. Good location near MRT.

title: Value for $. Convenient location.
desc: Located about 30 mins taxi ride from airport this beauty is just on the outskirts of Chinatown, right above Outram Park MRT station, 1 station away from Harbourfront station (to go to Sentosa). Rooms are nice and clean, not the biggest so if you have big suitcase it may get in your way. More importantly, you can't hear any traffic at all, not even the room next door. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. Hotel staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Many places nearby to get authentic food at very low prices. Though prices was at the high end of the mid range I reckon it is still worth every buck.

title: Bad experience in the hotel, left winter coat in the room upon check out and no lost and found report
desc: Service location is great. Value for money but bad experience with lost and found and housekeeping. Left winter coat in room upon check out but no one returns it and had to lodge a police report as hotel manager did not manage to retrieve it from the room. I won't be carrying a winter jacket to walk around Singapore so it must be in the room.

title: Excellent service
desc: Great hotel! Great service by housekeeping room attendant and front desk agent. Housekeeping were super asking if you wanted any additional items each day like water or extra toiletries. Every member of staff makes the upmost effort to relate to the guests. The hotel location is one of the best and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Nice and convenient
desc: Location is good as It is easily accessible because it is just above the MRT, can go to the hotel by taking MRT from the airport, so it is very convenient to get around. It is also about 10 minutes walking to China Town. Room is clean and comfortable and staffs are helpful.

title: Convenient hotel, great stay
desc: My wife and I stayed here in January 2015 for five nights as part of our honeymoon. Initial impressions were underwhelming - there were no standout/"wow" features about the hotel. However, the rooms were a good size for a city centre hotel. Our deluxe room had a lovely huge shower and a comfortable bed. The hotel had a great swimming pool on the third floor, and the three times I used it, I was the only person in the pool! The main benefit of the hotel, though, is the location. Walking distance to Clarke Quay and Chinatown, a few MRT stops from Sentosa, Little India, Marina Bay and Downtown. We couldn't really have asked for a better base from which to explore Singapore. We figured that we'd only really use the hotel for sleeping and getting ready, and for that, it was

title: Wonderful place
desc: Spent a week here in October. I can't say enough for how nice it is. The room was small (it's Singapore after all) but very luxurious feeling. The unique tile in the bathroom made me feel like a movie star and the sliding bathroom door made it feel much bigger. The staff was always professional and helpful to the extreme. The bed and bedding was very comfortable, I slept well. No noise was ever heard from surrounding rooms or hall. I love the swimming pool at this hotel, absolutely gorgeous and serene. The subway stations are extremely close and it was a short walk to China town and to great restaurant, and only a short taxi ride from everywhere else. A great place to stay!

title: Convenient location quality rooms
desc: Spent one night in Singapore in transit to Europe. The Dorsett Hotel was in a very convenient location to enjoy local attractions for a day. Near China town and the Tiong Bahru Estate, easy walk to Funan Digital Life Mall and many other sights. Service was excellent at the Dorsett and they let us have a late check out for our evening flight out of Singapore. Only good experiences.

title: We Love Dorsett Singapore!!!
desc: Me & my wife stayed at Dorsett Singapore for 3 nights to celebrate New Year 2015 and our wedding anniversary. Thanks to Dorsett Singapore for the room upgrade, it's surprised for us. Also thanks to Dorsett Singapore team or people. We love the room (Splash Room), view from our room it's really nice. Great hotel. Good location (near Outram Park MRT Station). Very friendly staff. Excellent service. Good hotel facilities and room amenities. We love it!

title: Overall, a nice stay
desc: We just completed a nice stay at the Dorsett. We booked it through our Diamond Resorts membership and the room charges were covered without issue. We were happy to find that we were upgraded to a Deluxe room with a king room which I can see from the photos posted is an improvement in size over the standard room. We found the size just fine but the bathroom is cramped with an awkward layout and has a sliding door adjacent to the bed, so privacy is limited. The carpet was VERY dirty but the rest of the room was clean on arrival and the view out the front was nice with large windows. One important update on instructions to arrive via MRT from the Airport. When you get out of the train at the Outram Park station (East-West) line, immediately follow signs to transfer to the

title: U won't regret staying in dis hotel:)
desc: It's a no-brainer for choosing dis hotel for its location n very close proximity to Outram Park MRT station. My recent two trips to SG hv been staying in dis hotel, d three rooms we booked hv been upgraded to d loft rooms, incredible n very much appreciated consider it was on a New Year's Eve. It is d hotel to stay whenever I m on a SG trip in future.

title: Good Location, small and impractical room
desc: Pros: Location next to Outram Park MRT. From there you can easily reach all the interesting spots of the city. Staff nice and helpful. Gym, swimming pool and wifi. Good mattress. Cons: The room is extremely small and it's difficult for two people to be comfortable. The bathroom leaves no privacy at all as there is not a proper door but it can only be separated from the rest thanks to the closet door. Breakfast was nothing special, average quality and not much choice. A lot has to improve when it comes to the cleaning.

title: Excellent location!
desc: The hotel is in a great location above the Outram Park MRT. It is only 1 stop from HarbourFront/VivoCity so it‚Äôs easy to get to Sentosa Island and 1 stop from Chinatown and a few stops from Orchard Rd, Town Hall, and Marina Bay. There are many places to eat and drink just outside and it‚Äôs only a 10 minute walk to Chinatown and hawker centers. The rooms are nice and generally well maintained. We had a room on the 9th floor with views of the CBD. The staff are friendly and helpful. The beds and pillows were comfy and the room was quiet. Free wifi is also a bonus. The gym is small and the pool is nice. The only downside to the room is the design of the bathroom. There is very little bench space to place things and the light under the mirror combined with a glass wall/door make it

title: Great Hospitality and location
desc: I ended up here staying on a cheaper deal through a booking website. The hotel is fantastic, rooms a great, clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The only downside is the room setup with the small bathroom and toilet. It is a weird setup is the best way to put it. But..... the hotel is right near Chinatown with great food a short stroll away and one of the best restaurants price and quality wise right next door (Candelnut). Tripadvisor said steer clear of brekkie so I did but with so much food near by its not worth paying anything extra unless you feel like some Western food. The restaurant attached is only any good if you cannot be bothered looking for somewhere else to eat. Make Candlenut your local you will not regret it.

title: Good location, small-ish rooms
desc: The hotel is conveniently located near Outram Park MRT (subway) station which is close to most of the major attractions in Singapore. I travelled in a group of 6 and we had originally booked 3 twin rooms. When we got there, the hotel couldn't find 3 adjoining rooms so they upgraded my room to a king-sized bed. What a major difference! The room was much more spacious and the bathroom was pretty big with a large walk-in shower. The twin rooms were small, which is typical of inner-city hotels. The hotel offers free wifi and has a nice outdoor pool and gym.

title: Good luxury hotel
desc: We booked this hotel via agoda for our new year holiday in singapore, you can reach this hotel via mrt station, you just go to outram park mrt station and look for exit H, and the hotel is exactly next to mrt station (very very convenience) The hotel itself is quite new, interior wise is very good, check in was very quick and fast, we got the standard room with shower bathroom not bathtub, since i am travelled with my 6months old baby, it was a shock, but luckily the hotel have baby bathtub for us to borrow, Inside the room amazingly was quite big for singapore standard, usually you will feel very cramp in singapore hotel, but the room was quite spacious and clean, they have a nice bed but the pillow is too soft for our needs The hotel also provide swimming pool and gym, we

title: Not a New Hotel
desc: We stayed with the Dorsett for 2 nights and were quite surprised. We expected a new hotel but we got an old room with stained carpet and well used furniture. Air condition could not be regulated and the shower had spontaneous changes in water temperature. The bed was very clean and comfortable, though. Additionaly, the staff is competent and friendly. For us it was disappointing perhaps other rooms are equipped better.

title: Comfortable dorsett stay in Singapore
desc: I am wowed by the unique interior of the hotel. The variety of table seatings style available give the sense of cosiness while stimulate the experience be it in the lobby lounge or in Papasan restaurant. I fully agreed with reviews from goody55 , captmike_11 and Lillenigel on the location I observed staff are prompt and attentive during our 2 day stay.Facilities like the Gym is small and simple, good for cardio and basic weight training.The pool environment which was relaxing. We were given room with the view of the pool which was very nice. Top marks on room cleaniness and comfort. The hotel need to invest more on their maintenance program to ensure their facilities remain in good tiptop condition and remain attractive to visitor. Like Silka Maytower KL, this hotel do

title: Excellent location and great value in overall
desc: I was staying there for 2 nights when transiting from Brisbane before going back to Jakarta. The hotel was relatively new and I chose this hotel because of its location and I want to try new hotel in Chinatown vicinity (I used to stay in Amara for many times before). Turned out I was not disappointed. This is my new favorite hotel in Singapore. Location Location is excellent if you're happy to stay somewhere not in Orchard Rd or Marina Bay area. It is so close to Chinatown with so many good & cheap eats. You can even have a healthy walk to Clarke Quay. The nearest MRT station is Outram Park, which served two lines, the East West green line (direct to Changi Airport) and the North East purple line (to take you to Clarke Quay or Harbour Front). The East West station is just

title: Great simple boutique for business or vacation
desc: Company booked this hotel, its fairly new and in a very good location. I stayed two nights with a colleague. No bar but its OK as there are several around. Restaurant was good for breakfast, did not try dinner. Service with a smile everywhere and very efficient. Some trouble to get taxi and had to wait 10-15 mins normally. Rooms where compact but effective, nice bathroom very quiet, had room on back with balcony, will book again.

title: Average Hotel - small rooms - good location
desc: First the negatives - The hotel lobby looks horrible, I realize this is a very personal opinion but I did not like it, there is a lot of crystals and bling going on, in a very obscure way. The uniform that the poor reception staff have to wear is like something from a 1950's cleaning company. It is really awful. The bedrooms are very small, so for business, I would not recommend it. The breakfast was very poor. It had a poor selection and the quality of the food was very average. On the plus side, the staff were friendly and accommodating. It seemed that due to the location it was relatively easy to get a taxi. There is a good Irish bar opposite the hotel entrance, which I believe is part of the hotel. Overall, I would stay again depending on the price but it wouldn't be my

title: Location, location, location
desc: This hotel is so close to Chinatown, Outram Park MRT, and some great breakfast places (since the hotel buffet is okay but pricey). We recommend a french bakery, Bread and Hearth. My husband and I always look for a hotel with a pool. This is one of the nicest 30 m pools we have ever swum in. Plusses: Comfy bed, adequate gym, newspaper downstairs, intimate seating areas in the lobby, free bottles of water left in room every day, free Wi-fi, and very friendly, attentive staff. Minuses: The bathroom is small with no counter space or privacy. The design is too clever and space saving! No blowdryer. Also, I could have used a reading chair in the room. (Our room looked like the one featured in the photo.) Overall, it was good value. We would stay here again. We booked over two weeks

title: Great location
desc: The Dorsett Singapore is tidy, modern and a reasonably priced hotel (for Singapore standards). The best part about it is it's location; sitting right on top of a central metro station. The rooms, while perfectly clean and modern, were quite small but this seems to be the norm for Singapore hotels. One of our rooms had a roller bed so three people could stay in it but we had to choose the Deluxe Room for this option, because they are a tad bigger to fit the extra bed. The pool area was just okay, it had view to the street and a park across the road but the pool was more of a lap pool than anything. Again, the gym was just okay, in that it was quite small but seemed to have everything you would need. There was free, easy to access wifi in the rooms and lobbys too which was nice.

title: A hotel that never learn from experience!
desc: This was the first time my wife travel alone on her own without my companion so I choose Singapore as I believed their travel industry should be mature and service level should be high but finally it was proven to be wrong! Dorsett Singapore should be a good choice as it is close to Outram Park SMRT which means you can access to most of the hot places for tourist within one or two stops like China Town, Raffles, Marina bay and Sentosa. The hotel is new and the facilities are good but only that their service level is inferior and the hotel never learn from experience. The hotel offered two free bottles of drinking water but if you find it insufficient you have to call house keeping for additional. But for THREE consecutive nights she have to call house keeping and front desk

title: Great Stay
desc: Very much enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Dorsett. Taxi from the airport was $28. The best thing about this hotel was it's location to the Outram MRT stop! This made getting about the city extremely easy and cheap! The most we paid for a one way trip was $1.25 and most rides were .70c. $15 lasted us 3 days. The MRT was sooooooooooo easy to use and we never waited more than 5 minutes for a train! The Dorsett is 1 stop from Harbour View and from there you can get the cable car or ever walk the board walk to Sentosa. We stayed in the deluxe room which was comfortable. It was a little oddly appointed i.e. they had a small step to get into the bathroom and I kept tripping over it. The bathroom isn't very private so it would be uncomfortable if you were sharing with a colleague or

title: Conveniently located!
desc: Dorsett is a relatively new property and just next to the MRT Outram Ghaut. There are two metro lines here so much of Singapore can be covered by the metro. The restaurants attached are pretty good. There is also an Irish pub which offers a discount to hotel residents. Check-in staff were very helpful. Rooms are not big by any standard but all in all, a good business stay.

title: Great location
desc: I stayed at this hotel for business 32 nights to be precise, I found the staff to be great rooms very clean well maintained. The location is just outside China town, with a MRT about 100 yards down the road. I will use this hotel again and again.

title: Conveniently located! Only 0.1 km to Outram Park MRT Station
desc: Decent hotel is literally within minutes of walk to the Outram Park MRT Station. Hotel breakfast is just so so. But Chinatown is only a short walk from the hotel with lots of good eats. Money exchange is conveniently located at the plaza by China town has much better rates than the airport. Free wifi in room and at lobby is a big plus. Service is good and staff are friendly. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will stay here again.

title: Location
desc: Perfect location, MRT, China town. Clean, modern, functional and for Singapore not badly priced. I had a great view from my room of the Singapore skyline. Pool and pool area really nice. Internet good and free, Breakfast fairly good. Staff a little 'sterile' and lacked smiles but can't complain. Cant stretch to 5 stars as I found the rooms a little cramped.

title: Reasonable hotel price with all amenities near Chinatown and train station
desc: My husband and I stayed at this hotel last November 2013. My mum and her sister had a connecting room to ours. It was very new then and just a lovely little hotel. It was very clean, front desk was very efficient, beautiful chandeliers and had many Christmas decorations around the hotel as well as in the restaurant! They have an outdoor swimming pool on the roof which is nicely done and situated very beautifully among plants to give an atrium feel. One has a good view of the city as well from there. Most hotel rooms in Singapore tend to be smaller than in most other places and this one is not any different though we had a king size bed in our room and it fit well and had all the western amenities one could want in a room. It was very clean and had enough space for our 2

title: Rooms don't live up to the pictures
desc: Currently staying for my 21st birthday with my best friend. Had a standard twin room, found it was way too small to even put our luggage anywhere. I talked a lovely lady downstairs who upgraded me to a slightly bigger room for $20 a night. Which was fine until I realised it was just as bad as the first room. There was a little bit more room to move at the end of the bed but barely enough room to get into bed. But the bathroom is even worse, you literally have to turn to your side and squeeze through the shower door to get out without smacking into the bathroom door. The place is clean and beautifully decorated, and the staff are lovely but the rooms are a disappointment.

title: Great location, but not so great facilities
desc: I stayed at Dorsett in June,2914 on a business trip. It's a great location since it's close to China Town and is very well connected through MRT, buses and taxis to other parts of the city. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but extremely small. It's good for a short business trip, but for a long-ish stay, could feel a little cramp. It has all the facilities, and most of the staff is cooperative. The restaurant has very limited options and for a vegetarian, next to none. One would have to rely on eating places closeby. The hotel doesn't have a round the clock room service, which could be very challenging, especially post late night meetings. However, the reception staff was very helpful to order a pizza from outside üòÑ. It's a new hotel and is stepping up well. They could

title: Lovely stay
desc: Room is very clean and comfortable. Very modern and trendy. Bed is very comfortable. Nice view from the room and the swimming pool. Walking distance to China town and Clark Quay. The hotel is literally outside outram park station (purple line). Definitely worth paying the extra to stay here. Also very helpful and friendly staff at the reception.

title: Lovely hotel, very good for Chinatown
desc: We picked this hotel for both the reasonable price and its location. It is situated on top of the Outram Park MRT station (exit H) and 5 mins walk to the centre of Chinatown. It is also only 1.5 miles to Marina Bay. The room was relatively compact but perfectly adequate for our needs. Free wifi and excellent service throughout. We used the swimming pool after checking out which gave us a nice refreshing start to our travel home.

title: Nice stay
desc: This is my last day in SG and in fact I'm writing this review in the hotel's lobby. I stayed for 3 nights with my family. One thing I'm quite surprise, they have a special room for disabled which is more spacious than regular standard room - I stayed in this room. Very fascinating!! Hotel design is modern yet vintage, nice. Staff is friendly, breakfast was just okay - not so special. However, this morning when we had breakfast (there are 5 of us), I put one additional chair in 4 seats table which they allow me to do, I grab the chair from other empty table. All of a sudden, one of the waiter took the chair and return it as there were 2 guests (business traveller I suppose) would like to sit in there - in 4 seats table - which there are still 3 more chairs. I understand if they

title: Nothing speciall
desc: Stayed there for 2 nights in business trip. Upgraded to loft room from standard room without asking which was not convenient for me since the loft room bed was upstairs and found it not comfortable. Everything was OK except the following: - The bathroom was not cleaned properly when checked-in, stains in the floor and cabinet, hair in the basin, I had to call housekeeping to redo this while I was inside the room. - Despite that the hotel is new, The room furniture does not reflect that, it is either the quality is bad or the maintenance not up to the standard. - The breakfast was less than ordinary and tasteless for me, One of the restaurant staff who was prepare omelette (Male Chef) was ignorant in very bad and unacceptable behavior.

title: Pleasant stay!
desc: The location is very good as it is just next to Outram Park train station. Staff was very helpful and speaks good English. Very near Chinatown as well. The breakfast is okay. Room service is excellent.

title: Convenient location, right next to Outram Park MRT
desc: I stayed here for 1 night in Dorsett Room. The staff at the reception area was very helpful. The room is clean and the bed is comfy. My only complaint is that there might be a problem with the shower. I adjusted abit and it either becomes too hot or too cold. The breakfast Cafe was really small too and there are no indications that the egg station is located outside. The waitresses were pretty board too; I asked for omelette and she asked me to order outside but I saw her going to 2 other tables, asking if they wanted eggs. Other than that, i have no other complaints.

title: Great location
desc: great location near to the Outram Park station and Chintown. Room was clean but very minimal storage options, and the small bathroom takes a wee while to get used to. Had a delay with our check in but overall 4 stars.

title: Great location
desc: Spent 5 nights here this week. Rooms are well equiped with all the essentials, comfy bed and pillows, great air con. Great location next to Outram Park Mrt, which we used to go everywhere even to and from airport. Had breakfast only one morning $98 Sgd for 3 adults inc tax bit on pricey side and nothing really out of the box same as you get in any hotel in asia. Staff are very polite. All in all a good stay.

title: Good Location
desc: The room is clean and cosy. You can sleep well because it is not noisy. If you need bathtub, maybe this is not for you... You can walk to China town! It takes about 5 minutes. Hotel staff are nice. There are some international staff at the front reception.

title: Dorsett hotel, pity about the breakfast........
desc: This is a fairly recently built hotel situated in New Bridge road in Singapore. As we required a hotel stop over our travel agent built this hotel into our itinery along with another party of likewise tourists. The hotel was clean, rooms adequate without being overly large, king size beds and the usual tv and kettle etc, walk-in wet shower room. It has to be said that the hotel decor was a very quirky / strange mixture of modern art and sparkling bling with Asian culture ? The entrance and reception areas are plagued by a mechanically operated grand piano which drove us mad . The breakfast is the worst ever continental breakfast spread that we've encountered, a disgrace. No replacement food put out after the early birds had emptied what was there , complained but got nowhare

title: Conveniently Cosy!
desc: A great practical hotel suitable for business and leisure traveller. The check in process was smooth and the room was really cosy and clean. Bathroom although small has a luxe feel. The Hotel has many stylish features to capture as well. Location next to Outram Mrt station is superbly convenient! Commendable staff Ira at Front desk and Sunthar, bellman for extending a warm hospitality upon arrival. Would definitely consider coming back to stay longer and experience other facilities within the hotel and it's vicinity.

title: The Royal Treatment
desc: Dorsett is very reasonably priced for its high-end luxury feel. We stayed there for 6 nights and the hotel was absolutely ideal for us. The sparkling swimming pool and jacuzzi, spotless cleanliness and luxury finishings all make this hotel a comfortable stay. As soon as you enter the front door of the hotel you are greeted by a huge sparkling chandelier, a clean and fresh scent and the soft melodic tones of a piano. As you walk past the lobby to access the lifts, you can't help but smile at the coloured Buddha angel sculptures - ones that inspired and fascinated us so much we walked around Chinatown hoping to find one of our own. This hotel knows the importance of the small details and first impressions, and provides everything you need for a relaxing and convenient stay

title: Quirky hotel in downtown Chinatown
desc: Modern pop art meets Asian elegance at The Dorsett. Newly renovated, the rooms are small but beautifully appointed with plush king size beds, and city views over the red-tiled roofs of Chinatown. The pool is on the roof, surrounded by tropical plants, and the small gym overlooks the space. The breakfast is western and eastern - congee one side, bacon and eggs the other. Don't bother with the coffee - seek out a western cafe elsewhere. My room was only serviced once in three days - no one could explain why- but towels were brought up promptly when asked. Great location, minutes from all the sights, smells and sound of Chinatown - plus a short walk from the subway system.

title: Lovely, great
desc: Love the place. Easy to find. MRT friendly, just above it. Been there with whole family, 2 parent, 1 infant. Very cozy, clean, friendly staff, especially we stayed right when my mom birthday. The staff sent a very nice and delicious chocolate cake. Thank you for the great experience given to my family. Would like to stay again someday, and will recommend it to all my friend.
